name: Resume Screening
description: Analyze and compare resumes/CVs to find the best candidates. Import PDFs or DOCXs from a folder and ask questions like 'Who has the most Python experience?' or 'Compare candidates on leadership roles.'

documents.title: Accomplished Software Technologist Profile
documents.content:
**Sri Bolisetty\
**214-901-8452 \|
[[SrinivasB@gmail.com]{.underline}](mailto:SrinivasB@gmail.com)

**Summary**

Accomplished Software Technologist & Informatics Leader with 15+ years
of success driving transformative change and delivering impactful
solutions across biopharmaceuticals, academic cancer centers, and other
sectors. Expertise in technology leadership, software architecture,
cloud computing, data management, and enterprise applications. Proven
ability to align technology strategy with business objectives, optimize
operations, and deliver significant ROI.

**Core Competencies**

-   **Technology Leadership:**

    -   Global team leadership (up to 25)

    -   Offshore team setup & mentoring

    -   Visionary technology strategy

-   **Software Architecture & Development:**

    -   Design & development of scalable, complex systems

    -   Full-stack development

    -   Proficiency in Java/J2EE, .NET, C/C++, Python/Perl, RESTful
        services

    -   3rd party integrations

-   **Cloud Computing & Infrastructure:**

    -   AWS, Azure, GCP expertise

    -   Infrastructure setup, deployment, optimization

-   **Data Management & Analytics:**

    -   Database design & analysis (Oracle, MySQL, SQL Server,
        PostgreSQL)

    -   Tableau reporting

    -   Data warehouse development

-   **Enterprise Applications & Integration:**

    -   Veeva Vault, Salesforce

    -   Enterprise Search solutions

-   **Process Improvement & Automation:**

    -   SDLC with CI/CD

    -   PowerBI/Tableau streamlining

-   **Strategic Planning & Business Acumen:**

    -   Technology alignment with business goals

    -   Strategic initiative development

**Value Delivered**

-   **Streamlined Operations:** Automated processes and implemented
    CI/CD pipelines, significantly improving software delivery
    efficiency.

-   **Enhanced Decision-Making:** Developed data analytics solutions and
    reporting infrastructures (e.g., North Star NextGen Data n Analytics
    System) to provide actionable insights.

-   **Technology Leadership:** Led and mentored global teams, fostering
    a culture of innovation and high performance.

-   **System Design & Implementation:** Designed and implemented
    critical systems such as the SPIRIT platform and next-generation
    401K/Trust-fund management systems.

-   **Strategic Vision:** Aligned technology initiatives with business
    objectives, driving strategic growth and transformation.

**Professional Experience & Key Projects**

-   **Parker Institute for Cancer Immunotherapy (Executive Director of
    Technology):**

    -   Led the technology framework for clinical trials,
        bioinformatics, and research data analysis.

    -   Implemented Salesforce CRM and Tableau reporting.

    -   Migrated Exchange to GSuite.

-   **City of Hope National Medical Center (Director of Research
    Informatics Applications):**

    -   Oversaw technology strategy.

    -   Managed research informatics platforms.

    -   Designed and implemented the SPIRIT platform (technical debt
        resolution, CI/CD, streamlined reporting).

    -   Designed SPIRIT-HopeSEQ for variant analysis.

-   **CSL Behring (Head of Data & Analytics Engg):**

    -   Led development of North Star NextGen Data n Analytics System.

    -   Led Big Data, Operational Data Warehouse, and enterprise
        analytics teams.

    -   Enhanced Operational Data Warehouse.

    -   Integrated Enterprise Search.

    -   Streamlined PowerBI/Tableau.

**Earlier Roles**

-   **Habeas Inc.:** Director of Engineering

-   **TrustBenefits Online:** Director of Product Development

-   **Caresoft Inc.:** Engineering Manager/High-Tech Consultant

-   **Broadway & Seymour Inc.:** Sr. Software Engineer

-   **Hindunet Inc.:** Co-founder/CTO

**Entrepreneurship & Innovation**

-   Co-founded Hindunet Inc. and secured venture capital.

-   Contributed to grant proposals with architectural solutions.

-   Developed the SPIRIT platform and Smartkit framework.

-   Created and re-engineered systems across industries.
documents.summary: Sri Bolisetty is a seasoned Software Technologist and Informatics Leader with over 15 years of experience in driving transformative change across various sectors, including biopharmaceuticals and academic cancer centers. His expertise encompasses technology leadership, software architecture, cloud computing, and data management, with a proven track record of aligning technology strategies with business objectives to deliver significant ROI.

documents.title: Srinivas Bolisetty's Professional Profile
documents.content:
# **Srinivas Bolisetty (Sri) M.S.**, M.Tech.

Frisco,TX

(214)-901-8452
[[SrinivasB@Gmail.com]{.underline}](mailto:SrinivasB@Gmail.com)

Leadership, Mentoring, Software Architecture, Application Platforms,
Large Portfolio of Applications, Vendor Relationship, Innovation,
Strategy and Process Improvement

## 

## Performance Highlights

> Leadership

-   Managed diverse groups of about 17 team members, responsible for all
    aspects of application analysis to development to operationalization
    to production support, with an yearly budget of \$3.5 million at
    City of Hope National Medical Center (COH).

-   Managed global team of about 10 members, responsible for product
    design and development, vendor management, user training at elan
    Pharmaceuticals.

-   Managed global team of about 25 members, responsible for product
    development, Engineering and performance tuning, BI analysis and
    Datawarehouse at Habeas.

> Innovation and Platforms

-   Envisaged and led development of Software Platform for Integrated
    Research Information and Transformation (SPIRIT), for basic,
    clinical and translational informatics (COH)

-   Conceived and directed implementation of RISe (Research Informatics
    System at elan) -- a cutting edge integrated pre-clinical
    informatics platform for chemistry, biology and preclinical safety
    labs; Patent: Shah, Ajay*, et. al.* System and Method for Managing
    Information of Biological Entities. **Patent** \# 20130013623,
    (2013)

-   Redesigned and engineered a Reputation platform for Marketing
    Companies to statistically evaluate and analyze effectiveness of
    email campaigns that led to quick market adoption eventually leading
    the No.1 competitor in the space to acquire Habeas.

> Strategy and Process Improvements

-   Re-engineered an non-existing SDLC process to adopt best practices,
    set up a Release Management cycle that rolled nicely into Enterprise
    ITIL process later on.

-   Envisioned a 4-tier environment for software applications
    development to help improve the quality of enterprise software
    applications.

-   Strategically planned adoption of cloud platforms within Research to
    help address the future needs in time as the demand arised.

-   Strategic alignment of resources with a global partner reducing the
    overall costs by 40% (\$1M to \~\$600K), while more than doubling
    the total number of resources (1+6 to 1+ 14) and increasing the
    productivity by 50% (number of product releases, features, reports).

> Entrepreneurship and Grants

-   Founded and obtained venture capital for an internet portal

-   Contributed architectural and technical solutions to multiple grant
    proposals. Wrote informatics components of grants as
    co-Investigator. Responsible for informatics portion of grant funded
    national data coordination center projects.

-   Helped Habeas acquire multitude of clients by scaling out
    application architecture on demand before the PaaS and IaaS days.

## 

## Professional Experience

> **Director, Research Informatics Applications, City of National
> Medical Center, Duarte CA (Oct 2011 - Present)**
>
> [Leadership]{.underline}: Managed and mentored a team of upto 19
> informatics professionals, including multi-discipline teams with a
> budget of 2.5 million.
>
> [Organizational]{.underline}:Re-focused the teams and processes to be
> efficient and effective at building research applications, innovative
> thinking and automating daily tasks.
>
> [Portfolio]{.underline}: Managed portfolio includes Research Systems,
> Research Applications, Clinical Trials Data Analysis and Automation,
> Decision Support, Adverse Event monitoring and reporting, SQA, Disease
> Registries, Clinical Pathology Variant Analysis, Genomic Sequencing,
> Cloud Platform, Virtualization and Innovation.
>
> [Process Improvements]{.underline}: Design and development of a
> software platform called SPIRIT, Implementation and automation of
> SDLC, Vendor and Software license management, Continuous Technology
> Training.
>
> [Partnerships]{.underline}: Partnering with IT teams, PI's,
> Researchers, Physicians and Clinicians
>
> [Innovation]{.underline}: Encouraging, Advising, brainstorming,
> supporting whichever way needed to build applications, POC's in areas
> of Machine Learning, Process Pipelining, Cloud Computing, NLP, Cohort
> Discovery, Technology Adaption.
>
> [Training]{.underline}: Thru the use of Community of Practice,
> Innovation sessions and Online self-directed CBTs, Individualized
> course curriculums - kept the teams abreast of technology, and be more
> productive and efficient.
>
> **Program Manager, elan Pharmaceuticals, South San Francisco CA (Feb
> 2009 - Jun 2011)**
>
> [Leadership]{.underline}: Managed blended teams of 10 - 20
> Informaticians and Developers in supporting multiple Research
> Informatics projects.
>
> [Portfolio]{.underline}: Managed portfolio include Agile development
> methodology with continuous development-and-testing with onsite and
> offshore teams, an Integrated RI Platform in building Research
> Applications such as Antibody, Plasmid and Cell-line Registry
> databases, Laboratory Electronic Notebook.
>
> [Process Improvements]{.underline}:
>
> [Partnerships]{.underline}: Vendor partnerships for lab notebooook and
> RI Platform architecture and implementation.
>
> [Innovation]{.underline}: RISe as a platform designed for developing
> biological entity registration and managemt system resulting in a
> Patent.
>
> **Director of Engineering,Habeas (Acq by Return Path), Mountain View
> CA (Mar 2006 - Jan 2009)**
>
> [Leadership]{.underline}: Managed diverse global teams of 12 - 25
> members, leading multidisciplinary responsibilities with a budget of 1
> Million.
>
> [Organizational]{.underline}:Re-Engineering the systems to scale up to
> withstand the sales growth, from \<100 to \>800 clients. Putting
> together an Analutical Reporting framework to provide insights into
> customer data, segmentation, concentration and focus areas for
> Marketing and Sales.
>
> [Portfolio]{.underline}: Portfolio include End-User Interface with
> rich media integration, Restful Service API based Middleware framework
> for flexibility and scalability, robust backend database design to
> scale both horizontally and vertically to support growth.
>
> [Process Improvements]{.underline}: Fully Automated QA framework that
> tested engineered products end to end with different campaign
> parameters to mimic real world situations, engineering and
> rearchitecting the components of the platform to take advantage of
> technology, fully optimized 24/7 development and testing cycle.
>
> [Partnerships]{.underline}: Partnered with global vendors like
> Persistent Systems and Sierra Atlantic in Built-to-Own model.
>
> **Director, Product Development, Trust Benefits Online, Emeryville CA
> (Nov 2003 - Mar 2006)**
>
> [Leadership]{.underline}: Managed and mentored a team of upto 9
> software professionals and business analysts.
>
> [Organizational]{.underline}:Setup and organized the team\'s from
> ground up to support the design and development of product development
> framework.
>
> [Portfolio]{.underline}: Managed portfolio includes Backend Annuity
> Calculation Engine, Middleware Platform supporting Trust Client
> specific Rules and Guidelines, Semi-Automated Content Management
> System that automated building Trust specific websites with limited
> effort from analysts.
>
> [Process Improvements]{.underline}: Automated template based approach
> for building websites with minimal HTML coders/coding. Separation of
> Business Rules from Operational Processes, Very highly scalable
> middleware that can support large number of clients and web traffic.
>
> [Partnerships]{.underline}: Partnering with Business Teams, Trust Fund
> Managers, Business Analysts, Technology Partners.
>
> [Innovation]{.underline}: CMS and Template based approach to building
> websites automatically. Unique adoption of new trends in Application
> Server Framework to advance development of Product Framework.

## 

## 

## 

## Patents and Awards

-   Conceived and directed implementation of RISe (Research Informatics
    System at elan) -- a cutting edge integrated pre-clinical
    informatics platform for chemistry, biology and preclinical safety

-   **American Medical Informatics Association (AMIA) Distinguished

## 

## Conference Presentations

SPIRIT ML âˆ’ A Machine Learning Platform for Translational Research,

[BioAsia-IT]{.underline} Hyderabad, India (Feb 2014)

## Educational Background

-   MS (Computer Science), University of Southwestern Louisiana,

-   M.Tech. (AI & Robotics), University of Hyderabad, Hyderabad India

-   B.E. (Electronics and Communications Engg.), Osmania University,

> ++++++++++++++++++STUFF+++++++++++++++++

-   Over 10 Years of Research Informatics experience in leading research

-   Over 23 years of experience in Software Application Development

-   Streamline operations, adopt better practices, improve overall

-

-   Hands on project management experience with large portfolio of

-   Dependable leader for mentoring small to large sized development

-   Efficiently managing projects from inception thru implamentation

-   Transforming organizations and individual teams from ad-hoc

-   Experienced with working and integrating distributed and remote

-   Well versed with managing multi discipline teams

## **Experience**

-   **Ã‰lan Pharmaceuticals, South San Francisco, CA -- RISe Program
    Manager**

> Feb 2009 --- June 2011
>
> Ã‰lan Pharmaceuticals is a multi-billion dollar neuroscience-based

>

>
> Utilized many tools including: VersionOne for agile project

-   **Habeas Inc., Mountain View, CA -- Director of Engineering**

> March 2006 --- January 2009

>
> Managed multiple engineering teams across multiple locations, onshore

>

>

>
> Hired, mentored and setup an offshore development team to help sustain

> team.

-   **Trust Benefits Online, Emeryville CA -- Director of Product

>

>

>
> Managed several client deployments from acquisition thru staging thru

-   **Hindunet Inc./GHEN Soft Inc., San Diego, CA**

> April 2001 --- September 2002

>
> Helped successfully get funding for Hindunet as a social venture.

>
> Responsible for designing and development of the SmartKit framework

>
> Managed several teams and projects comprising different projects.

-   **VeuhaSoft Inc., Santa Clara, CA**

> August 2000 --- April 2001
>

>
> Consulted with VeuhaSoft helping many of their clients with product

-   **Caresoft Inc., Sunnyvale, CA Engineering Manager**

> July 1999 --- August 2000
>
> Caresoft was a pioneer in bringing personal health management tools

>
> Managed several projects in a short-time with a quick-turn around,

>

documents.summary: This document outlines the professional achievements and experience of Srinivas Bolisetty, highlighting his leadership roles in software architecture, innovation in research informatics, and strategic process improvements across various organizations. It details his management of diverse teams, successful project implementations, and contributions to patentable technologies.

documents.title: Experienced Software Development Leader
documents.content:
Cover Letters:

Hello

With an over 20 Years of software development and information technology
experience and leadership include more than 14 years in Project
Management and team building. Dependable leader in creating and managing
software development among many areas including Financial, Credit Cards,
401K, Trust Funds, Health care, Pharmaceutical and Email industries.
Hands on project manager with extensive experience in managing a large
portfolio.

Efficiently managed products from inception thru implementation and
deployment, while transforming organizations and individual teams from
ad-hoc processes to well known agile development. Always keeps a keen
focus on business goals while bringing disparate teams together.

Participates with cross-functional team exercises to better understand
overall goals and stimulate the teams to strive for success of the
entire company.

I feel I am quite qualified and suitable for your position. Should you
feel the same feel free to contact me.

-Sri
documents.summary: This cover letter highlights over 20 years of experience in software development and project management, emphasizing a strong background in various industries and a commitment to agile methodologies and team collaboration. The author expresses confidence in their qualifications for the position and invites further contact.

documents.title: Software Development Manager Application
documents.content:
**SRINIVAS BOLISETTY (Sri)**

***E-Mail:*
[[Srinivas.B@shalusri.com]{.underline}](mailto:Srinivas.B@shalusri.com)**

BUSINESS NAME

ADDRESS OF COMPANY

Gentlemen:

I would like to apply for a position as a software development/manager
in your company.

As someone who, in seventeen years, has developed many innovative
software products, I am seeking a challenging position, working to
develop high impact technological products and strategies that will
provide positive growth and profitability to your company. In addition
to possessing real world knowledge of a competitive, software
marketplace, I offer proficiency in the analysis, architecture, design,
and development of software applications.

With solid experience in goal-setting and team-building within the
companies that I have worked, I bring a strong background of technical
expertise and leadership in development of software solutions. I combine
this with a strong educational background, including a double-Masters
and a verifiable track record in the creation of innovative software.

I have a strong love of problem solving, which has led me to adopt
technology for the business process and create order even, sometimes, in
a chaotic business environment. Having worked with numerous technologies
(cloud computing, client-server, system integration, web-based
applications, database design, open source solutions) and programming
languages (C/C++, C#, Perl/PHP/ASP, Java/J2EE, .NET) and methodologies
(n-tier, middle-ware, XML) and middleware (MQ-Series) and relational
databases (Oracle, Sybase, MySQL, Informix and Ingres) and
web-technologies (Apache, IIS, Application servers like
Dynamo-WebLogic-WebSphere). I can quite confidently say I am a software
engineer at heart, who has learned to work effectively in a
goal-oriented, business environment, relating effectively to members of
my teams and higher management.

As I enjoy challenges, I often bring an unusual appetite for technical
difficulties that can, at times, create an unusual confidence in
circumstances that would otherwise seem somewhat difficult. But this is
my approach and it has brought me recognition within my circles as an
optimistic and successful problem solver. This approach has been helpful
to those I have worked with, since it has been combined with the
concrete experience of participating in software development teams of
varying in sizes (from 2 to 22 developers). With this background and
approach, I am confident I can fit in any team and tackle any complex
project that you may have. I am sure I can be a valuable asset to your
organization.

I have enclosed a copy of my resume. I look forward to talking with you
soon regarding new opportunities within your company.

Sincerely,

(Srinivas Bolisetty)
documents.summary: Srinivas Bolisetty applies for a software development/manager position, highlighting his 17 years of experience in innovative software products, technical expertise, and leadership skills. He emphasizes his problem-solving abilities and adaptability in various technological environments.

documents.title: Business Executive Application Letter
documents.content:
Hi

Please find attached is my resume for the position of Business Executive. I have been a key contributor in driving product solutions for the past 9 years. Built software teams from ground up, mentoring them on the highly complex applications while ensuring that we reach product's goals. I am a hands-on manager and architect that participates in every aspect of product development from ideas to inception to implementation and deployment. With over 15 years of experience, I have been working with technologies that range from cutting edge Java/J2EE/.NET to low-key-high-performance C/C++/Python/Perl programs. I am very well known to produce great results on projects that others give up and make the projects fun and easy to do.

I am looking forward to hearing from you. Should you have any questions, please contact me at: 214-354-5489.

Thank you.

-Srinivas
documents.summary: Srinivas applies for the Business Executive position, highlighting 15 years of experience in product development and team management, with expertise in various programming technologies. He emphasizes his hands-on approach and success in driving projects to completion.

documents.title: Senior Architect Application Cover Letter
documents.content:
Hi

Please find attached is my resume for the position of Senior Architect. 
I have been working with highly complex systems for the past 16 years.

Starting with Broadway & Seymour worked with automated Credit Card 
processing and decisioning to Design, Development and customization of
TouchPoint-CRM product to the most recent Email Reputation system for
Habeas has been riddled with complex systems - in terms of business
knowledge, wide array of technology and depth of applications to kept
the systems running for both in-house and clients alike.

I have worked with most chaotic and given up project/products and made
them turn-around like the best. While I have had the opportunity to
work with some of the most talented folks around me, I work to inspire
folks around me like there is no tomorrow which is exactly the way I
like to deliver. 

I have been working with technologies that range from cutting edge 
Java/J2EE/.NET to low-key-high-performance C/C++/Python/Perl programs.
Having worked with many of the commercial as well as open-source
technologies, I almost always think outside the box to come up with
solutions to not just everyday problems, but think about future while
designing for today.

From the brief I have seen here about this project, it seems like this
is a good fit for me and the job. I look forward to having a meeting
to go over in depth discussion. Thank you.

-Srinivas

# Gmail - CV

4/23/25, 11:43 AM

Sri B. <srinivasb@gmail.com>

CV
Sri B. <srinivasb@gmail.com>
To: Harold Thiers <hthiers@katonahgroup.com>

Mon, May 11, 2020 at 10:23 PM

Hi Harold
I appreciate your honest feedback on my resume. Here is a summary of my achievements.
Parker Institute for Cancer Immunotherapy
* Put together off-the-shelf Clinical Systems to get PICI ready for deploying Phase 1A and 1B trials. Later
one of the trials was successfully extended to phase 2.
* Extended the partnerships with vendors to support more complex Microbiome and Platform (or basket)
trails.
* Implemented Veeva Vault for Quality and eTMF that laid the road for later expansion to other Clinical
offerings such as Veeva Safety.
* Selected a vendor thru RFC process, trial-onboarding and vendor-management for Study Form
development and deployment.
* Implemented Salesforce in record time, under 3 months, to allow multiple teams collaborate efficiently
on their daily workflows. The first phase implemented about 60% of core day-to-day workflows.
* Implemented Tableau based reporting infrastructure to help integrate different datasets and build a
uniform reports and dashboard acorss the enterprise and Clinical Studies.
City of Hope
* Improved processes and adopted Agile methodologies to streamline software development, saved time
and effort. The direct result is that the total team went from 40+ to 20+ with overall delivered better
quality product in much shorter timelines.
* The improvements showed better productivity with 30% less budget (from $5M to $3.5M) within two
years.
* Envisaged and led development of a new application framework SPIRIT (Software Platform for
Integrated Research Information and Transformation) to help build rapid applications with less cost for
developemnt, quick deployments, and less operational overhead.
* Implemented SSRS based reporting infrastructure that is fully integrated into enterprise SDLC processes
and cut down report generation from few weeks (2 to 6 weeks) to few hours.
* Retired and replaced old technologies - Dos based, insecure web-apps, hard to maintain software - and
in their place brought up SPIRIT based applications or simply converted them to micro-services or
backend operations.
Elan Pharmaceuticals
* Implemented RISe (Research Informatics Systems at elan) to support multiple applications and directly
supported multiple Research groups namely Plasmids, Antibodies, Compound Tracking etc.
* Implemented an electronic lab notebook system for Researchers including migrating the data and
workflows and eliminated cumbersome systems interface for Lab users.
* Managed multiple overseas vendors in systems development and deployment.
Habeas
* Strategically aligned with a Global Partner reducing the direct resource costs by 40% (from $1M to
~$600K) while increasing the productivity by over 35% (number of releases, features, reports etc.).
* Successfully Re-engineered the systems architecture to be able to adopt changing products, demand for
features, exponential growth of Customers.
* Successfully negotiated with the acquiring partner to get a better deal for Engineering team (2WKs to
6months for next job).
Other Prior achievements
* Mentored and coached multiple teams in multipe organizations in software developemnt, product

documents.source: C:\Temp\Resumes\MD\Gmail - Insight Global Follow Up - Bank of America.md
documents.content:
# Gmail - Insight Global Follow Up - Bank of America

4/23/25, 11:26 AM

Gmail - Insight Global Follow Up - Bank of America

Sri B. <srinivasb@gmail.com>

Insight Global Follow Up - Bank of America
Sri B. <srinivasb@gmail.com>
To: Zach McClure <Zach.McClure@insightglobal.com>

Thu, Sep 3, 2020 at 3:17 PM

Hi Zach
It was very nice talking to you this morning. I would be happy to get 120K as a full-time salary as a
Developer in the Dallas area. In return, I am sure to get a multi-fold value back to the organization. As a
consultant or contract worker, I would be happy to get between $70 to $75 per hour. I have always made
organizations feel they got me at a bargain no matter how much they paid me. The challenge in a job is
what brings best in me and I have always enjoyed making everyone around me better along the way.
Appreciate the heads up on Sulakshana's positions. Here is my response to the position you shared with
me.

> â€¢ Strong programming experience in Angular (2 and above), Java, Java Struts 2.x, JDBC, JNDI, Spring, JSON,
Node.js, JavaScript, Maven, JUnit and Oracle PL/SQL.
Yes for all the technologies except for Spring. Designed an original framework that is very similar to Struts before
it even released. I have done extensive work in JDBC based middleware and always enjoyed automating
everything.

> â€¢ Significant Experience in Restful Web services and Advanced Java programming
Yes. Used Core Java and JDBC to provide restful web-services based framework to replace the traditional
business layers. The end-to-end automation was setup in a way that the web-portals were deployed with minimal
or no work from the Development team. The business team used to put the content together, test the sites and
work with Development team in deploying the finished portal. It was fun to watch and build web-portals without
doing any work.

> â€¢ Working knowledge on Unix/Linux and Shell scripting.
Yes, of course. Been self sufficient and usually do my own automation thru various scripting methods - whether
they are Shell or Perl/PHP.

> â€¢ Experience in Website/Portal development
Yes, like the back of my hand. I always enjoyed teaching and mentoring others around me in building portals the
better way - in terms of security, extensible and maintainability.

> â€¢ Design, develop and integrate services in large-scale distributed enterprise infrastructures (cloud etc.)
Yes, worked with all 3 major clouds - AWS (since 2007), GCP (since 2017), Azure (since 2015). Before the Cloud
as we know it, worked with VMWare in setting up test-environments thru scripting for build-up and tear-down
processes in a SDLC.

https://mail.google.com/mail/u/0/?ik=d2af758ead&view=pt&search=all&permmsgid=msg-a:r2463277173249442022&simpl=msg-a:r246327717324944â€¦

1/2

 4/23/25, 11:26 AM

Gmail - Insight Global Follow Up - Bank of America

> â€¢ CI/CD tools ( JIRA, Jenkins, Ansible, BitBucket, Sonar, jFrog)
Yes, worked with many CI/CD toolsets at multiple times. Worked with JIRA (and others as well) including
administration and setup. Worked with BitBucket counterparts like SVN, GIT. Familiar with Ansible but not directly
worked with Sonar or jFrog.

> â€¢ Develop, enhance, debug, support, maintain and test software applications on diverse development
platforms, software, hardware, technologies and tools.
Yes, that is the life of a developer. No matter what the tool or technology (Microsoft Stack or WAMP or LAMP or
Custom Development Platform) is the fundamentals doesn't change that much. We only learn more about
effectively using them as the time passes.

> â€¢ Good to have experience in Restful Web services and Advanced Java programming with Java, Java Struts,
spring, JSON, Angular-JS, Ant, Maven and Oracle PL/SQL
Very comfortable with everything here having worked with all of them, except for Spring. Wrote my own ANT and
debugged others to know and improve things overall.

> Plusses:
> â€¢ Good communication and analytical skills. Capable of working as a team player regionally and globally.
> â€¢ Capable of working in Agile environment

Been working with Agile since 2006 and worked with many tools and methods along the way. Not shy of learning new
things and adopting to the situations. I have always strived to make the computer my tool and than the other way around.
The only way I do that is to understand the current process, what the goals are and figure out how to head there with the
tools that I have in my hand. If I need more tools or machines to get something done - I have done that with a proof-ofconcept implementation or through an example. I excel in technology, grasping the complex systems, coming up with
strategy and design and implementing that no matter how hard it may get. I am a very passionate individual when it
comes to technology and even more passionate about getting things done the right way.
-Sri
[Quoted text hidden]

---Sri

Let the world share the light within you - Anonymous

https://mail.google.com/mail/u/0/?ik=d2af758ead&view=pt&search=all&permmsgid=msg-a:r2463277173249442022&simpl=msg-a:r246327717324944â€¦

2/2

Good Evening Mr. Yee
I would like to thank you for the opportunity to talk about this position this morning. I sincerely understand your need for

# Gmail - Updates_

4/23/25, 12:00 PM

Gmail - Updates?

Sri B. <srinivasb@gmail.com>

Updates?
Srinivas B. <srinivasb@gmail.com>
To: Mark Hazzard <mark.hazzard@cgcginc.com>

Wed, Oct 7, 2009 at 9:34 AM

Good Morning Mark
Thank you for the feedback. Through out my career, I simply solved the problems and built the systems for any company
that I came across - be it Enterprise Systems like TouchPoint/IMAP with Broadway & Seymour and TrustBenefits Online
or startups. I have done N-times of what is expected from me and built systems that sustained growth to change in
requirements. I become a part and parcel of any and every company that I had ever worked with, be it full-time or parttime, and comes become a leader in taking that company to the next level. The next level could be products, scaleable
framework, business expansion, process improvements or automation. I have excelled in every aspect of these and many
others that I touched. I bring in a unique personality to team, the problem space and how it is solved.
From my conversation with Viresh, I am perfectly qualified to take up the initiative that Viresh is heading up. If you think
there is a shot for me, please go ahead and forward my resume to him and talk to him. If he has any questions or
concerns, I will be able to speak to him over phone. If not, I will continue my search for in finding my next challenge.
Eitherway, I really thank you for bringing me this opportunity and appreciate your confidence in my skills.
-Srinivas

documents.title: Srinivas' Professional Recommendations
documents.content:
### [Consultant, Program Manager for RISe]{.mark}

#### [Elan Pharmaceuticals]{.mark}

![Mike Gaal](media/image5.jpg){width="0.8333333333333334in"
height="0.8333333333333334in"}

##### **[Mike Gaal]{.mark}**

###### **[Technology Solution Professional, Datacenter at Microsoft]{.mark}**

[Srinivas was absolutely great to work with. He\'s very experienced,
very hands on, and willing to do whatever it takes to get something done
while maintaining an excellent environment for a team. There were many
times that he actually taught me things about technologies I had
supported / implemented / administered that I had never thought about,
or even used. He\'s very savvy and extremely multi-faceted. It was a
privilege to help him wherever I could on the ambitious RISe project at
Elan, and would absolutely work with him again in the future.]{.mark}

[August 4, 2009, Mike worked with Srinivas at Elan
Pharmaceuticals]{.mark}

### [Director of Engineering]{.mark}

#### [Habeas - acq by Return Path]{.mark}

![Michael Mills](media/image1.jpg){width="0.8333333333333334in"
height="0.8333333333333334in"}

##### **[Michael Mills]{.mark}**

###### **[Vice President, Program Management at Return Path]{.mark}**

[Srinivas is one of the sharpest, most versatile and most dedicated
technology professionals I have ever worked with. Throughout the 3 years
we worked together at Habeas and into the acquisition by Return Path, I
witnessed Srinivas build up a productive engineering team, re-architect
and "industrialize" a hastily built code-base and establish solid,
reliable engineering and operations processes. He is a fast and
aggressive problem solver and can range from thinking deeply about
architecture and frameworks to diving in quickly to address the most
immediate issues. I\'ve seen him work literally "around the clock" to
make things happen. And when Srinivas tells you something is going to be
done, I can assure you, something will be done! On top of all this,
Srinivas has a strong sense of business value which he applies to all
that he works on. He is a consummate mix of vision and pragmatism and
brings tremendous value to any organization.]{.mark}

[January 18, 2009, Michael worked with Srinivas at Habeas - acq by
Return Path]{.mark}

![Des Cahill](media/image9.jpg){width="0.8333333333333334in"
height="0.8333333333333334in"}

##### **[Des Cahill]{.mark}**

###### **[Chief Marketing Officer at Kerio Technologies]{.mark}**

[Srinivas was an exceptional employee who was critical to the success of
Habeas. He is an extremely dedicated employee and very very strong
technically. Srinivas was instrumental in scaling up the Habeas platform
and managing and motivating the Habeas development team on a day to day
basis. Srinivas moved to India for about 8 months and started up our
outsourced India development and QA teams from scratch. He did a
teriffic job getting this team up and running and integrating it with
the US development team. Srinivas is a star employee and any
organization will be lucky to have his drive and talent. Contact me at
descahill@yahoo.com for further information..]{.mark}

[November 6, 2008, Des managed Srinivas indirectly at Habeas - acq by
Return Path]{.mark}

![Bill Hunt](media/image10.jpg){width="0.8333333333333334in"
height="0.8333333333333334in"}

##### **[Bill Hunt]{.mark}**

###### **[Chief Product Officer at SugarCRM]{.mark}**

[Srinivas is the rare breed who can lead a team, think strategically and
code deeply. He is a great architect, but also flexible and able to come
up with timely solutions. His software expertise is broad, and he is
very capable in both developing as well as operationalizing a project.
Srinivas built and led our development center in India, while managing
our US dev team. He is widely respected throughout the organization.
Srinivas is an incredibly valuable member of our team, and I would be
excited to work with him again.]{.mark}

[August 29, 2008, Bill managed Srinivas at Habeas - acq by Return
Path]{.mark}

![Philip Smith](media/image11.jpg){width="0.8333333333333334in"
height="0.8333333333333334in"}

##### **[Philip Smith]{.mark}**

###### **[Consultant and Advisory Board Member to Startups and Emerging Growth Technology Companies]{.mark}**

[Srinivas is one of those rare gems - a supremely good individual
software engineer in his own right, and an outstanding manager and
leader of his team! Any problem, anywhere - Srinivas will solve it. And
under his guidance his teams produce outstanding results to complement
his own achievements. He\'s an incredibly hard worker and I would love
to work with him again someday]{.mark}

[August 21, 2008, Philip managed Srinivas indirectly at Habeas - acq by
Return Path]{.mark}

![Michael Bierman](media/image7.jpg){width="0.8333333333333334in"
height="0.8333333333333334in"}

##### **[Michael Bierman]{.mark}**

###### **[Principal Product Manager, Mobile Services at \@WalmartLabs]{.mark}**

[Srinivas was an absolute pleasure to work with. He could listen to any
issue or business case brought to him and present sound options for
solving the problem. At times, the solution would simply materialize
literally overnight when all that was promised was that \"He\'d look
into it.\" When things were more challenging than that, Srinivas was
able to present clear options and explain the trade offs required and
have a calm, rational discussion about the options. Once an agreement
was in place, he worked like the wind to move forward. I would be
honored to work with him again in the future.]{.mark}

[June 20, 2008, Michael worked directly with Srinivas at Habeas - acq by
Return Path]{.mark}

![Sudhir Krishnan](media/image3.jpg){width="0.8333333333333334in"
height="0.8333333333333334in"}

##### **[Sudhir Krishnan]{.mark}**

###### **[QA Architect/Manager]{.mark}**

[I\'m extremely impressed with Srinivas\'s technical proficiency and
high energy! There is no aspect of enginnering that I doubt he cannot
handle - be it product and db design, database development, backend
application development or even ui development if need be! He is a
truely gifted and motivated individual and one of my role models I
lookup to in learning what it takes to make a startup successful from
the perspective of engineering\'s deliverables.]{.mark}

[He has the ability to jump into any aspect of the project, to
effectively work with vendors in getting the agreed upon deliverables
and rigorously handpick and grow a high quality technical team from
scratch!]{.mark}

[Srinivas is always on the lookout for how things can be made more
efficient across enginnering and how the time it takes to do a task can
be reduced without compromising quality! I also like the fact that he is
a down to earth approachable person - if you connect with him and
listen, there is a lot you will learn!]{.mark}

[\'Highly recommended\' is not a strong enough phrase for
Srinivas!]{.mark}

[March 9, 2008, Sudhir reported to Srinivas at Habeas - acq by Return
Path]{.mark}

![Kalyan Wunnava](media/image6.jpg){width="0.8333333333333334in"
height="0.8333333333333334in"}

##### **[Kalyan Wunnava]{.mark}**

###### **[DBA Manager at Zendesk]{.mark}**

[Srinivas is one of the best directors of engineering/software
development I have come across. He has an excellent combination of
skills in software development and engineering management. Srinivas is
always ahead of the curve, and is a trail blazer. He has great acumen
and penchant for solving complex problems and providing long-term
solutions. He is a strong advocate of process automation and
improvements. Personally, I consider it a great privilege to be a part
of Srinivas\' team!]{.mark}

[June 24, 2007, Kalyan reported to Srinivas at Habeas - acq by Return
Path]{.mark}

![Larry Ellis](media/image4.jpg){width="0.8333333333333334in"
height="0.8333333333333334in"}

##### **[Larry Ellis]{.mark}**

###### **[Executive Director]{.mark}**

[This recommendation is a tough one for me, because I could say so much
and not enough.]{.mark}

[Simply put, Srinivas is thoughtful, goes the extra mile (yep that meant
weekends when I needed his help), and is without a doubt a team player
and a rock solid engineer.]{.mark}

[Some people you want on your team, Srinivas is someone that you will
also welcome as a friend!]{.mark}

[June 18, 2007, Larry worked with Srinivas at Habeas - acq by Return
Path]{.mark}

### [Engineering Manager]{.mark}

#### [Caresoft Inc.,]{.mark}

![Subha Guhan](media/image8.jpg){width="0.8333333333333334in"
height="0.8333333333333334in"}

##### **[Subha Guhan]{.mark}**

###### **[Technical Lead at Apple Inc.]{.mark}**

[I have always found Srinivas to be a great mentor and very accountable
and dependable for his projects. He was the lead on several projects at
Caresoft. Srinivase was always on top of the technical details and
provided great mentorship to the team. I would like to work with
Srinivas any day!]{.mark}

[March 10, 2008, Subha worked directly with Srinivas at Caresoft
Inc.,]{.mark}

![Srinivas Penumaka](media/image2.jpg){width="0.8333333333333334in"
height="0.8333333333333334in"}

##### **[Srinivas Penumaka]{.mark}**

###### **[President and Co-Founder, ReadyPulse]{.mark}**

[Srinivas is one of the best technical minds I have seen in my career.
He is super sharp and can relate business challenges to technological
solutions. I had the pleasure of working with him as a colleague and as
well as his manager. I recommend him to any one who is looking for a
senior Engineering leader with proven skills in management and hands-on
experience in delivering solutions based on latest web
technologies.]{.mark}

[March 6, 2008, Srinivas managed Srinivas at Caresoft Inc.,]{.mark}
documents.summary: This webpage features a series of recommendations for Srinivas from various colleagues and supervisors, highlighting his exceptional technical skills, leadership abilities, and dedication in multiple roles, particularly at Habeas and Elan Pharmaceuticals. The testimonials emphasize his problem-solving capabilities, team-building expertise, and significant contributions to engineering projects.

Responsible for setting up, daily operations and optimizing operational expenditure of
Cloud Environment - AWS, Azure and GCP. GCP was primary with 90% load with Azure

Implemented Tableau Cluster for building unified Dashboard Infrastructure for both
Clinical and non-clinical users. Utilizing information across multiple datasets and
eliminating the heavy use of â€œpre-preparedâ€ reports over Box and Email.
Worked with multiple vendors in building Bio-Tech pipelines for data analysis and

City of Hope Hospital, Los Angeles, CA (Julâ€™11 - Augâ€™17)

environment for modern UI, ease of use and integration at the enterprise level.

Pathology Department - that visually helped them analyze and compare the data with

research needs. A single application framework built on the SPIRIT framework that is
customizable within the UI to support different disease types, user-roles and
permission-sets and feature-mappings.
Envisioned and implemented the SDLC process with CI/CD pipeline for all the Research
Informatics Applications, reducing the unnecessary overhead and increasing the quality
and time of the software delivery.

â—

release of the code into SaaS farm. Designed and implemented template-based content

repositories which are in turn used by the application at the run-time.

based.

Dear Hiring Manager,

worked with full stack development from UI all the way to the backend and integration with 3rd
party systems. Involved with coding and every phase of a project or a product from
requirements gathering to production deployment and operations. I am confident that my easy
go personality will fit into most of the development teams whether it is in product development,
or deployment/operations or customized software application development.
Having worked with traditional in-house systems to cloud based applications, I have seen many
complex situations that are almost impossible to solve and took pleasure in making them look
so easy at the end. I always enjoyed working in environments where there seem like too many
problems and challenges than the people can solve. I take satisfaction in solving the toughest
problems and mentoring others along the way.
Should you have any questions, feel free to contact me at â€‹srinivas@suhritha.comâ€‹ or at
214-901-8452.
Thank you and have a great day.
-Srinivas

documents.title: Software Architect Profile Overview
documents.content:
# SB_Architect (1)

Srinivas Bolisetty (Sri)
Software Architect
661-927-7254(Cell) Srinivas.B@shalusri.com
I am currently seeking a challenging position where I can participate in resolution of unique
problems experienced in complex software applications. With a go-getter attitude and always
seeking process and architectural improvements within the systems; imaginative, out-of-box
thinking, visualize and enforce frameworks over problem solving; wide variety of expertise in
technologies, databases, business areas and corporate.
Specialties: Software architecture, Leadership, complex systems analysis, design and
development, problem solving, process improvement and re-engineering, Software FDLC,
Database systems design and analysis and architecture, Cloud Computing, Research &
Development.

Overview
With an overall 17 Years of software development experience and leadership include more
than 10 years in Architecture and Systems Design. Dependable architect in creating and
managing software systems among many areas including Financial, Credit Cards, 401K, Trust
Funds, HealthCare, Email and Pharmaceuticals industries.
Strategically built products from inception thru implementation and deployment, while
transforming organizations and individual teams from ad-hoc processes to well known agile
development. Always keeps a keen focus on strategic business goals while bringing disparate
teams together.
Participates with cross-functional team exercises to better understand overall goals and
stimulate the teams to strive for success of the entire company.

Major Accomplishments
â—

Played key-role at Ã©lan in providing both architectural and technical skills in taking a vision
from paper to reality, within the budget and resources that are set forth.
Improved FDLC, (Full Development Life Cycle), by adopting Scrum development
methodology, (holistic approach to new product development).
Strategic planning of revamping existing systems architecture from ground up at Habeas.
Responsible for engineering next-generation trust-fund management system.
Single handedly took a bare-bones startup firm to multi-client, multi-application system
providing multiple-revenue streams.
Lead the systems integration teams for FDC (First Data Corp, Omaha NE) projects
including AEGIS: The credit card fraud detection system
Deployed IMAP (IMaging APplication) product for Chase Manhattan Bank for automated
processing of Credit Cards

â—
â—
â—
â—
â—
â—

Experience
â—

Ã‰lan Pharmaceuticals, South San Francisco, CA
Feb 2009 â€” Present
Ã‰lan Pharmaceuticals is a multi-billion dollar neuroscience-based biotechnology company

Srinivas.B@shalusri.com

Sri â˜ 661-927-7254

 that is focused on discovering, developing, manufacturing and marketing advanced
therapies in neurology, autoimmune diseases, and severe pain.
I am responsible for managing all RI projects using Agile Methodology, provide strategic
architectural roadmap for technology, manage supporting information technology
platforms for scientists and analysts, offshore vendor relationship management, interact
with end-users, scientists and scientific community gathering requirements, user
workflows, prioritization of features, system design and development. Also responsible
for the technology oversight, hands on architecture and product solution reviews, Test
Case documentation and planning, QA preparation and testing.
As proof of concept, the sample applications were built on the frameworks using Java/
J2EE stack as well as .NET/Sharepoint stack. Lead the architecture team to review
the stacks, business needs and decided to go with the final framework that is based
on .NET/Sharepoint based SOA framework. This framework is designed to integrate
existing enterprise solutions as well as to support future business applications.
Utilized many tools including: Cruise Control for daily builds, Hibernate and ADO.NET for
ORM and database connectivity, entity-attributed based database as well as relational
database for data flexibility, N-Unit for unit testing, TeamDefine for scenario and use
case building, CaliberRM for requirements management, Bugzilla for bug-tracking, TOAD
for Database design and management.
â—

Habeas Inc., Mountain View, CA
March 2006 â€” January 2009
Habeas provides comprehensive, email reputation management and delivery services
enhancing the performance and certainty of email operations and improves the
reliability, safety and financial performance of email marketing campaigns. Habeas is
acquired by ReturnPath in August 2008.
I was primarily brought in to redesign a system that has grown out of its purpose.
During the time when the data grew more than 1200% and clients grew by about
350% - the system and the backend were completely redesigned to sustain the growth
patterns and maintaining the customer satisfaction. I was personally owned the design
and development of all the layers of the application from UI to middle-tier to database
design and reporting thru SOAP service calls.
Delivered release after release in-time while improving the quality of the old code and
processes and all the while creating new product features. Both ad-hoc and BI reporting
capabilities were developed using OpenSource tools such as Jasper and MySQL.
The architecture of the system was based on middle-tier running as a RESTful Web
Services with ORM layer running on Hibernate and the front-end based on PHP and Flex.
Flex was not only there to jazz the people with RIA capabilities, but also there to help
the user analyze the enormous data that we collect as part of the services.
The technology stack is based on open source tools that include: Linux and MySQL for
backend, Apache Axis and Tomcat for REST based services, Adobe Flex and PHP for
web-based UI and RIA, CruiseControl for Daily Builds, Hibernate for ORM and database
connectivity, Perl and Python for many scheduled jobs, C-based programs for highperformance multi-threaded programs.

Srinivas.B@shalusri.com

Sri â˜ 661-927-7254

 â—

Trust Benefits Online, Emeryville CA
November 2003 â€” March 2006
Recently acquired by International Concepts Inc., TrustBenefits offers web-based
benefits administration solutions meeting the ever evolving needs of Trust Funds,
Employers, Administrators, and Plan Participants. TrustBenefits is a spinoff from
Associated Third Party Administrators, a veteran company that provides administrative

documents.title: Software Architect Profile Overview
documents.content:
# SB_Architect.6

Srinivas Bolisetty (Sri)
Software Architect
661-927-7254(Cell) Srinivas.B@shalusri.com
I am currently seeking a challenging position where I can participate in resolution of unique
problems experienced in complex software applications. With a go-getter attitude and always
seeking process and architectural improvements within the systems; imaginative, out-of-box
thinking, visualize and enforce frameworks over problem solving; wide variety of expertise in
technologies, databases, business areas and corporate.
Specialties: Software architecture, Leadership, complex systems analysis, design and
development, problem solving, process improvement and re-engineering, Software FDLC,
Database systems design and analysis and architecture, Cloud Computing, Research &
Development.

Overview
With an overall 17 Years of software development experience and leadership include more
than 10 years in Architecture and Systems Design. Dependable architect in creating and
managing software systems among many areas including Financial, Credit Cards, 401K, Trust
Funds, HealthCare, Email and Pharmaceuticals industries.
Strategically built products from inception thru implementation and deployment, while
transforming organizations and individual teams from ad-hoc processes to well known agile
development. Always keeps a keen focus on strategic business goals while bringing disparate
teams together.
Participates with cross-functional team exercises to better understand overall goals and
stimulate the teams to strive for success of the entire company.

Major Accomplishments
â—

Played key-role at Ã©lan in providing both architectural and technical skills in taking a vision
from paper to reality, within the budget and resources that are set forth.
Improved FDLC, (Full Development Life Cycle), by adopting Scrum development
methodology, (holistic approach to new product development).
Strategic planning of revamping existing systems architecture from ground up at Habeas.
Responsible for engineering next-generation trust-fund management system.
Single handedly took a bare-bones startup firm to multi-client, multi-application system
providing multiple-revenue streams.
Lead the systems integration teams for FDC (First Data Corp, Omaha NE) projects
including AEGIS: The credit card fraud detection system
Deployed IMAP (IMaging APplication) product for Chase Manhattan Bank for automated
processing of Credit Cards

â—
â—
â—
â—
â—
â—

Experience
â—

Ã‰lan Pharmaceuticals, South San Francisco, CA
Feb 2009 â€” Present
Ã‰lan Pharmaceuticals is a multi-billion dollar neuroscience-based biotechnology company

Srinivas.B@shalusri.com

Sri â˜ 661-927-7254

 that is focused on discovering, developing, manufacturing and marketing advanced
therapies in neurology, autoimmune diseases, and severe pain.
I am responsible for managing all RI projects using Agile Methodology, provide strategic
architectural roadmap for technology, manage supporting information technology
platforms for scientists and analysts, offshore vendor relationship management, interact
with end-users, scientists and scientific community gathering requirements, user
workflows, prioritization of features, system design and development. Also responsible
for the technology oversight, hands on architecture and product solution reviews, Test
Case documentation and planning, QA preparation and testing.
As proof of concept, the sample applications were built on the frameworks using Java/
J2EE stack as well as .NET/Sharepoint stack. Lead the architecture team to review
the stacks, business needs and decided to go with the final framework that is based
on .NET/Sharepoint based SOA framework. This framework is designed to integrate
existing enterprise solutions as well as to support future business applications.
Utilized many tools including: Cruise Control for daily builds, Hibernate and ADO.NET for
ORM and database connectivity, entity-attributed based database as well as relational
database for data flexibility, N-Unit for unit testing, TeamDefine for scenario and use
case building, CaliberRM for requirements management, Bugzilla for bug-tracking, TOAD
for Database design and management.
â—

Habeas Inc., Mountain View, CA
March 2006 â€” January 2009
Habeas provides comprehensive, email reputation management and delivery services
enhancing the performance and certainty of email operations and improves the
reliability, safety and financial performance of email marketing campaigns. Habeas is
acquired by ReturnPath in August 2008.
I was primarily brought in to redesign a system that has grown out of its purpose.
During the time when the data grew more than 1200% and clients grew by about
350% - the system and the backend were completely redesigned to sustain the growth
patterns and maintaining the customer satisfaction. I was personally owned the design
and development of all the layers of the application from UI to middle-tier to database
design and reporting thru SOAP service calls.
Delivered release after release in-time while improving the quality of the old code and
processes and all the while creating new product features. Both ad-hoc and BI reporting
capabilities were developed using OpenSource tools such as Jasper and MySQL.
The architecture of the system was based on middle-tier running as a RESTful Web
Services with ORM layer running on Hibernate and the front-end based on PHP and Flex.
Flex was not only there to jazz the people with RIA capabilities, but also there to help
the user analyze the enormous data that we collect as part of the services.
The technology stack is based on open source tools that include: Linux and MySQL for
backend, Apache Axis and Tomcat for REST based services, Adobe Flex and PHP for
web-based UI and RIA, CruiseControl for Daily Builds, Hibernate for ORM and database
connectivity, Perl and Python for many scheduled jobs, C-based programs for highperformance multi-threaded programs.

documents.title: Manual Conversion Instructions for DOC File
documents.content:
# SB_Architect_9

> **DOC FILE - MANUAL CONVERSION NEEDED**

This is a legacy DOC file that requires manual conversion.
Original file: SB_Architect_9.doc

**How to convert:**
1. Open SB_Architect_9.doc in Microsoft Word
2. Save As > Choose "Word Document ^(.docx^)" format
3. Run this converter again on the DOCX file

**Alternative options:**
- Use online converter (CloudConvert, Zamzar)
- LibreOffice: Open > Export as DOCX
- Google Docs: Upload > Download as DOCX

documents.content:
# Sri Bolisetty (1).3

Srinivas (Sri) Bolisetty M.S., M.Tech.
â˜â€‹(214)-901-8452â€‹

â€‹SrinivasB@Gmail.com

Manager and Architect in Technology Leadership, Software Systems and Data Architecture,
Application Platforms. Managed Large Portfolio of Applications, Clinical Trials Systems, Vendor
Relationship, Mentoring and managing diverse and distributed teams development, Innovation,
Strategy and Process Improvement. Deep expertise in cloud and mobile computing and special
expertise in building software platforms for basic, clinical and translational research and
healthcare.

Performance Highlights
Leadership
â—
â—
â—
â—

â—
â—
â—

Setup and managed Clinical Systems for conducting Phase 1A/1B and Phase 2 Clinical
Trials. Extended partnerships with vendors to support more complex Microbiome and
Platform (or Basket) trials.
Responsible for IT and Clinical Systems Quality and Auditability. Planned and prepared
Data Architecture and Security for Clinical Trials and IT Systems.
Implemented Salesforce for multiple teams to collaborate more efficiently on the daily
work activities with the goal of sharing information efficiently across the enterprise.
Responsible for managing Clinical Trials Systems, Clinical Study Form development and
deployment, Clinical Study progress coordination across vendors and partners, building
multi-cloud based Translational Informatics platform, Corporate IT infrastructure,
Governance and Auditability, IT and Data security, with an yearly budget of $2million at
Parker Institute for Cancer Immunotherapy.
Managed diverse groups of about 17 team members, responsible for all aspects of
application analysis to development to operationalization to production support, with an
yearly budget of $3.5 million at City of Hope National Medical Center (COH).
Managed global team of about 10 members, responsible for product design and
development, vendor management, user training at elan Pharmaceuticals.
Managed global team of about 25 members, responsible for product development,
Engineering and performance tuning, BI analysis and Data warehouse at Habeas.

Innovation and Platforms
â—
â—

â—

Envisaged and led development of Software Platform for Integrated Research
Information and Transformation (SPIRIT), for basic, clinical and translational informatics
(COH)
Conceived and directed implementation of RISe (Research Informatics System at elan) â€“
a cutting edge integrated pre-clinical informatics platform for chemistry, biology and
preclinical safety labs; Patent: System and Method for Managing Information of
Biological Entities. Patent # 20130013623, (2013)
Redesigned and engineered a Reputation platform for Marketing Companies to
statistically evaluate and analyze effectiveness of email campaigns that led to quick
market adoption eventually leading the No.1 competitor in the space to acquire us when
we are at No.3.

Strategy and Process Improvements
â—

Clinical systems process and engineering to handle multi-phase, basket trials that grew
from one trial to 4 trials in under two years, that span different spectrum such as
multi-drug to micro-biome. Process was improved and integrated to take advantage of
best available vendor systems, and technology platforms - Medidata Rave, EndPoint,
Veeva, Argus, Box.com and Tableau.

1 of 5

 â—
â—
â—
â—
â—

Re-engineered an non-existing SDLC process to adopt best practices, set up a Release
Management cycle that rolled nicely into the Enterprise ITIL process later on.
Envisioned a 4-tier environment for software applications development to help improve
the quality of enterprise software applications and provide a means for securing data
access mechanisms across multiple entities and user-roles.
Strategically planned adoption of cloud platforms within Research to help address the
future needs in time as the demand arised.
Managed Mobile applications development in clinical research including: BRisk, Clinical
Trials at COH, Adverse Events Calculator.
Strategic alignment of resources with a global partner reducing the overall costs by 40%
($1M to ~$600K), the productivity is increased by over 35% with half the staff (number
of product releases, features, reports).

Entrepreneurship and Grants
â—
â—
â—

Founded and obtained venture capital for an internet portal
Contributed architectural and technical solutions to multiple grant proposals. Wrote
informatics components of grants as co-Investigator. Responsible for informatics portion
of grant funded national data coordination center projects.
Helped Habeas acquire multitude of clients by scaling out application architecture on
demand before the PaaS and IaaS days.

Professional Experience
Executive Director of Technology, Parker Institute for Cancer Immunotherapy, San
Francisco CA (Aug 2017 - Present)
Responsible for managing Technology framework, development, data security and operations
of Systems responsible for Clinical Trials, Bio-Informatics data pipelines and Research Data
Analysis.
Re-focused the development teams to adopt better agile practices in delivering products and
frameworks with quality and deliverability as focus.
Implemented Veeva Vault for Quality and eTMF, and RaveX for eCRFs, EndPoint and RTSM,
Argus for Safety to support multiple trials under PICIâ€™s Clinical Trials Management product
suite.
Medidata Cloud Administration, Veeva Systems Administration, EndPoint Integration,
Translational and Clinical data analysis and development, GCP/AWS/Azure Administration,
Box/Tableau/GSuite implementation and adaptation, Salesforce implementation.
Implemented Tableau based reporting infrastructure to setup data architecture for the
organization and help integrate different datasets and build a uniform reporting and
dashboard for easy to access information all clinical and non-clinical purposes.
Responsible for Data Security and Architecture across the IT and Clinical Systems. Involved
with setting up SOPs, data reviews, data agreements and security analysis and prevention.
Director, Research Informatics Applications, City of National Medical Center, Duarte
CA (Oct 2011 - Aug 2017)
Managed and mentored a team of upto 19 informatics professionals, including multi-discipline
teams with a budget of 2.5 million.

Sri â€‹â˜â€‹ 214-901-8452

SrinivasB@GMail.com

2 of 5

 Re-focused the teams and processes to be efficient and effective at building research
applications, innovative thinking and automating daily tasks. The improvements showed
better productivity with 30% less budget, going from $5M to $3.5M, within 2 years.
Managed portfolio includes Research Systems, Research Applications, Clinical Trials Data
Analysis and Automation, Decision Support, Adverse Event monitoring and reporting, SQA,

Partnering with IT teams, PIâ€™s, Researchers, Physicians and Clinicians - encouraging, advising,

documents.summary: Srinivas Bolisetty is a seasoned manager and architect specializing in technology leadership, software systems, and data architecture, with extensive experience in clinical trials and healthcare informatics. He has successfully led diverse teams and implemented innovative platforms, significantly improving efficiency and reducing costs in various organizations.

documents.title: Sri Bolisetty - Technology Leader
documents.content:
# Sri Bolisetty (1)

Sri Bolisetty
204.901.8452 | srinivasb@gmail.com
PROFESSIONAL SUMMARY
Highly knowledgeable leader in designing and managing projects in software systems and data architecture. 15+ years in U.S. technology
leadership has allowed for overseeing a large portfolio of mobile applications, clinical trial systems, vendor relationships, and employee
working teams. Expertise in cloud and mobile computing solutions with an emphasis on building software platforms for clinical and
translational research for the healthcare field.

HIGHLIGHTS
â–ª

Led diverse, globally recruited teams of 10-25 members at a time, for a total of 50 supervised employees, focused on data
architecture, software applications, and product development projects. Annual budgets managed have averaged between $1
million and $3.5 million.

â–ª

Obtained $1 million in venture capital for an internet portal on Hindu Community, a network of websites promoting collaboration
and togetherness across geographic distances.

â–ª

Contributed architectural and technical solutions for 12 grant proposals in a two-year period.

â–ª

Instigated a strategic alignment of resources with global partners to reduce costs by 40% while increasing staff productivity by
35% with half the employees.

â–ª

Experienced in project management for mobile applications and their development for use in clinical research. Able to handle
multi-phase basket (multi-drug and micro-biome) trials, including increasing project load from one trial to four trials in under two
years.

â–ª

Engineered a reputation platform for marketing firms to be able to evaluate and analyze statistical effectiveness of email
campaigns. Led to quick market adoption and acquisition by the primary competitor in the industry.

RELEVANT EXPERIENCE
Parker Institute for Cancer Immunotherapy (San Francisco, CA)
Executive Director of Technology

2017-2019

â–ª

Skills Portfolio: Medidata Cloud, Veeva Systems, EndPoint, Translational + Clinical Data Analysis, GCP/AWS/Azure,
Box/Tableau/GSuite, and Salesforce.

â–ª

Managed holistic technology framework for systems that instituted clinical trials, bioinformatics, and research data analysis.
Technology framework management included software development, data security, and system operations.
Administered clinical software systems for conducting Phase 1A/1B and Phase 2 clinical trials; utilizing extended partnerships with
vendors to support more complex microbiome and basket trials.
Secured data and architecture across the entire information technology system. Created SOPs, data reviews, agreements, and
security analysis protocols.
Realigned development teams to adopt more agile practices in product delivery, with a focus on quality and efficient delivery
frameworks.
Implemented software programs to increase quality (Veeva VaulT), eCRFs (Etmf, RaveX), and safety (EndPoint, RTSM, Argus) in
multiple clinical trials.
Built a uniform reporting dashboard for easy to access clinical and non-clinical purposes by integrating different databases using a
Tableau-based infrastructure to setup the data architecture.

â–ª
â–ª
â–ª
â–ª
â–ª

 Page 2 of 3
City of National Medical Center (Duarte, CA)
Director of Research Informatics Applications

2011-2017

â–ª

Skills Portfolio: Research Systems + Applications, Mobile Applications, Clinical Trials Data Automation, Decision Support, Adverse
Event Monitoring, SQA, Disease Registries, Clinical Pathology Variant Analysis, Genomic Sequencing, Cloud Platform, Data
Architecture and Security, Virtualization.

â–ª

Oversaw 19 bioinformatics professionals working in multi-discipline teams: with an annual budget of $2.5 million. With the use of
various communities of practice, innovation sessions, and self-directed online CBTs; teams were able to be ahead of the curve on
industry standards.
Partnering with IT teams, PIâ€™s, Researchers, Physicians and Clinicians - encouraging, advising, brainstorming, supporting whichever
way needed to build applications. POCâ€™s in areas of Machine Learning, Process Pipelining, Cloud Computing, NLP, Cohort
Discovery, Technology Adaption.
Decreased budget dependency 30% (from $5 million to $3.5 million) over two years utilizing strategic team realignment to focus
on building efficient research applications, innovative thinking, and task automation.
Served as the catalyst and development director for the SPIRIT software platform that provides implementation and automation
of SDLC systems, vendor license management, and continuous technology training. SPIRIT built rapid application development
with less cost and operational overhead while increasing quality.

â–ª

â–ª
â–ª

elan Pharmaceuticals (San Francisco, CA)
Program Manager

2009-2011

â–ª

Portfolio: Agile Development Methodology, Continuous Development with Teams, Developing Integrated Research Databases,
Laboratory Electronic Notebooks.

â–ª

Led blended teams of 10-20 bioinformaticians and software developers while supporting multiple projects. Sustained a leading
role in the holistic software developing process including budgeting, project management, hardware evaluation, vendor selection,
offshore staffing, and platform implementation.
Utilized Microsoft Excel and Word-based lab notebooks to streamline the processes surrounding intellectual property protection
and lab assay documentation. Oversaw the vendor relationships for electronic lab notebooks and their RI Platform architecture.
As a result of the electronic lab notebook implementation, managed the creation and implementation of RISe as a platform
designed for developing biological entity registrations for U.S. Patents.

â–ª
â–ª

Habeas â€“ acquired by Return Path (Mountain View, CA)
Director of Engineering

2006-2009

â–ª

Skills Portfolio: End-User Interface using Rich Media Generation, Restful Service API-based Middleware Framework, Backend
Database Design.

â–ª

Led multidisciplinary, global teams of 12-25 members: with an annual budget of $1 million that partnered with global vendors like
Persistent Systems and Sierra Atlantic in with a â€˜built-to-ownâ€™ model.
Fully Automated QA framework that tested engineered products end to end with different campaign parameters to mimic real
world situations, engineering and re-architecting the components of the platform to take advantage of technology, fully
optimized 24/7 development and testing cycle.
Pioneered a fully automated quality assurance framework that tested engineered products with different parameters designed to
mimic real-world situations. Collaborated within an optimized 24/7 development and testing cycle to revise the components as
necessary to take advantage of current technologies.
Increased software systems to handle a client load from 100 to 800 clients with a database architecture that included high-level
security, while implementing analytics reporting programs to provide targeted insights on customer data, population
segmentation, and growth areas for marketing.
Helped Habeas quadruple clients from 20 to 80 by scaling out application architecture on demand before the PaaS and IaaS
systems were integrated. This led to a data growth of 2500% in a few months.

â–ª

â–ª

â–ª

â–ª

 Page 3 of 3
Trust Benefits Online (Emeryville, CA)
Director of Product Development

2003-2006

â–ª

Skills Portfolio: Backend Annuity Calculation Engine, Middleware Platforms for Trust Client Guidelines, Semi-Automated Content
Management Systems.

â–ª

Supervised a team of nine software developers and business analysts to support the â€˜ground-upâ€™ design of a product
development framework.

PATENTS + AWARDS
Directed implementation of RISe (Research Informatics Systems at elan); RISe is a cutting edge, integrated pre-clinical informatics
platform for chemistry, biology, and pre-clinical safety labs --- Patent: Shah, Ajay, et. al., System and Method for Managing
Information of Biological Entites; U.S. Patent No. 20130013523 --- 2013
American Medical Informatics Association (AMIA) Distinguished Poster Award; Software for Clinical Trials Cohort Discovery --- 2015

CONFERENCE PRESENTATIONS
SPIRIT SpecWiz: Metadata Driven, Semantically Enhanced Collaboration Tool for Generation of Specifications for Case Report Forms,
Ajay Shah, Srinivas Bolisetty, Fortino Martinez, Stacy
Berger, John Meng, Gwen Sale, Jennifer Boesen, Dona McQueen, Gayle Old-Smith, Weizhong Zhu, Joyce Niland, American Medical
Informatics Association, San Francisco, CA --- 2016
SPIRIT â€“ Integrated Platform for Protocol Decision Trees, Eligibility Screening and Cohort Identification, Ajay Shah, John Meng, Sai
Achuthan, Srinivas Bolisetty, MTech, Ayyappan Nagender, Weizhong Zhu, Joyce C. Niland, American Medical Informatics Association,
San Francisco, CA 2014
Protocol Decision Trees to Facilitate Protocol Planning and Patient Enrollment, Joyce C. Niland, Cy Stein, Julie Hom, Adina Londrc,
Karen Rickard, Srisairam Achuthan, Srinivas Bolisetty, John Meng, Ayyappan Nagender, Ajay Shah, American Medical Informatics
Association, San Francisco, CA - 2014
SPIRIT ML âˆ’ A Machine Learning Platform for Translational Research, Srisairam Achuthan, Mike Chang, Ajay Shah and Joyce C Niland,
American Medical Informatics Association, San Francisco, CA --- 2014
Integrated Translational Research Informatics, invited speaker and session chair, Ajay Shah John Meng, Sai Achuthan Weizhong Zhu,
Srinivas Bolisetty, Ayyappan Nagender, Mike Chang, Joyce C. Niland, BioAsia-IT Hyderabad, India --- 2014

EDUCATION
M.S. Computer Science, University of Southwestern Louisiana (Lafayette, Louisiana)
M.Tech. Artificial Intelligence and Robotics, University of Hyderabad (Hyderabad, India)
B.Eng. Electronics and Communications Engineering, Osmania University (Hyderabad, India)
documents.summary: Sri Bolisetty is an experienced technology leader with over 15 years in software systems and data architecture, specializing in mobile applications and clinical research. He has successfully managed large teams and budgets, secured venture capital, and implemented innovative solutions in healthcare technology.
