documents.title: Sri Bolisetty's Professional Achievements
documents.content:
**Sri Bolisetty -- Resume Questionnaire**

**Resume Writer: Sally Dixon, CPRW**

1\. In your resume, you mentioned that you obtained venture capital for
an internet portal. How much in venture capital did you raise? What did
the internet portal do?

The funding was for 1 Million

For a portal on Hindu Community, network of websites promoting
collaboration and togetherness across the countries and continents.

2\. In your resume, you mentioned that you contributed architectural and
technical solutions to grant proposals. How many grant proposals did you
contribute to?

Probably between 6 and 12 in a 2 year period.

3\. At PICI, when you realigned the development teams to adopt more
agile practices in product delivery, what improvements did you see?
Specifically, do you have a number or data to support it?

Improvements are:

-   Streamlined SDLC from inceptions to deployment and operations

-   Quick design to development (from months to weeks)

-   Quality product (poorly managed product to well planned feature
    delivery that provided guidance to what to expect in release after
    release)

Some of the quantifiable numbers include:

-   A report used to take anywhere from weeks to months to analyse and
    deliver. With the framework in place, the report can be delivered
    within days to a couple of weeks at the most.

-   A new application was usually months and year+ in the making. That
    time was reduced to within a month for an application to be deployed
    in Production with clear features pipeline identified and
    communicated.

-   Before I took over, there was a team of 30 individuals supporting
    about 6 applications and many loosely supported processes and
    reports. I managed that to be 17 individuals supporting 22
    applications with no more loose processes along the way.

-   Clinical Trial Data was requested and searched thru by a small group
    of people with access to Clinical Trial Systems. Sometimes this
    "searches" take up to weeks to get a simple questions such as "how
    many subjects are enrolled in a study". One of the applications that
    I managed to build this eliminated "this group of individuals" and
    made this information at the fingertips of anyone who is supposed to
    have access to the trial-data. No more "waiting", period.

-   Building Clinical Trial Forms was a long drawn process. Under my
    guidance this became standardized with utilizing Global Forms that
    define structure, syntax, semantics of how the data is organized,
    managed and labeled. This greatly helped in how we utilize this
    information in analyzing the data post capture.

4\. At PICI, when you built a uniform dashboard for easy to access
clinical and non-clinical purposes, what improvements did you see?
Specifically, do you have a number or data to support it?

Many a times a question that is asked and responded over email is
converted into putting the data in a form that is easily digestible and
usable from end-user directly. This tends to generate more "interesting"
facts and trends in a business user that drives insights into features
(they can be business opportunities or optimizing certain
inefficiencies). Here are a couple of points in this regard:

-   Our Finance department used to get "invoice" for the work that is
    supposedly completed on a clinical trial. Having a clinical-trial
    dashboard online at their fingertips, the finance team is now
    equipped to at least cross check whether work "invoiced" is actually
    complete or not and follow up with either Clinical Team or our
    sister organization to inquire in a more quantitative manner.

-   Our Clinical Teams are supposed to oversee the work being done on
    the trial. With an effective dashboard at their fingertips, they are
    no able to see the quality of work as well as time-sensitive issues
    in a more timely manner and follow up with sites to get on the
    important tasks first.

5\. At Habeas, how many clients did you acquire by scaling out the
application architecture on demand before the PaaS and Iaas days? What
results happened because of this, numbers wise?

-   The total number of clients went from 20+ to 80 in about 2 years
    (quadrupled)

-   The data gew from 1X to 25X in about 2 months (a handful of BIG
    clients tend to do that)

The architecture is key to addressing "customer" and "data" growth
alike.

6\. When you mentioned in your resume that you setup and managed
clinical systems for conducting phase 1A/1B and phase 2 clinical trials;
what job position did this occur in?

This is for PICI - a startup in Immunotherapy area. We grew at a fast
pace and I led the team that setup all the initial Clinical Systems that
helped bring up first 4 studies online. Some of the work was done by
folks in-house and some by consultants.

documents.content:
# Sri Bolisetty Resume (1).2

S R I N I V A S

B O L I S E T T Y ,

M.S., M.TECH

TECHNOLOGY EXECUTIVE | INFORMATICS LEADER | INNOVATOR | STRATEGIST
PHONE: 214-901-8452 | EMAIL: SrinivasB@gmail.com | LINKEDIN

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
Highly analytical, results-driven, established global technology leader equipped with strong business acumen, innovative mindset,
and 15+ years of documented success within the multibillion-dollar biopharmaceutical industry and academic cancer center. Expert
in architecture, technologies, databases, business processes and improvements, and automation and in-depth understanding of core
business functions and digital capabilities. Recognized for building, mentoring, and motivating diverse and distributed teams in
building and maintaining complex software platforms for clinical translational research and healthcare initiatives. Extensive
experience across a diverse set of systems and cloud providers, including AWS, Azure, and Salesforce and broad technical domains,
spanning security, infrastructure, network, and data. Adept at effectively balancing strategic and tactical needs while fostering
inclusive, performance-centric cultures within cutting-edge, multifaceted technology environments.
Technology Strategy ï‚¡ Clinical Systems & Software Development ï‚¡ Technical Project Management ï‚¡ Continuous Improvement
Business Operations ï‚¡ SDLC & Agile Techniques ï‚¡ Process Development ï‚¡ Research & Data Analysis ï‚¡ Vendor Management
Client Relationship Management ï‚¡ Team Leadership & Development ï‚¡ Executive Engagement ï‚¡ Communications

PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE
PARKER INSTITUTE FOR CANCER IMMUNOTHERAPY
Executive Director of Technology

2017-2019

Served in a critical leadership role for the leading San Francisco-based startup, specializing in funding clinical trials for cutting-edge
immunotherapy treatments. Held full accountability for system and data architecture, managing the technology framework,
development, data security, and operations of systems responsible for clinical trials, bioinformatics data pipelines, and research data
analysis. Oversaw data security and architecture across IT and clinical systems, as well as establishing SOPs, conducting data reviews,
setting up data agreements, and performing security analysis and prevention activities. Worked in collaboration with the VP of
Informatics to develop and execute comprehensive technology strategies, ensuring streamlined, effective, and cost-effective
workflows.
â€¢
â€¢
â€¢
â€¢
â€¢
â€¢
â€¢
â€¢

Effectively managed a $2M annual IT budget, ensuring high levels of accuracy and accountability.
Re-focused a 10-person development team to adopt better agile practices in delivering products and frameworks,
concentrating on quality and deliverability.
Established off-the-shelf clinical systems to deploy Phase 1A and 1B trials, resulting in extension to phase 2.
Extended vendor partnerships to support more complex microbiome and platform trials.
Implemented Veeva Vault for quality and eTMF, paving the way for later expansion to other clinical offerings.
Identified and selected a vendor through RFC process, trial onboarding, and vendor management for study form
development and deployment.
Implemented Salesforce CRM in record time (< 3 months), allowing multiple teams to collaborate efficiently.
Selected and implemented a Tableau-based reporting infrastructure to integrate databases and unify reports and
dashboards across the enterprise and clinical studies.

CITY OF HOPE NATIONAL MEDICAL CENTER
Director of Research Informatics Applications

2011-2017

Selected to oversee and manage 19 informatics professionals and multidisciplinary teams in developing and executing the
department strategy. Fully accountable for a $3.5M budget and large portfolio, including research informatics platforms and
applications, including, clinical trials data analysis and automation, decision support, adverse event monitoring and reporting, SQA,
disease registries, clinical pathology variant analysis, genomic sequencing, cloud platform, data architecture and security,
virtualization, and innovation.

 SRINIVAS BOLISETTY I PAGE 2 OF 2
â€¢
â€¢
â€¢

Re-aligned teams and developed streamlined processes, resulting in an increase in productivity with 30% less budget, $5M
to $3.5M within two years.
Envisioned and led the development of Software Platform for Integrated Research Information and Transformation (SPIRIT),
achieving significant cost reduction, decrease in operational overhead, and increased quality.
Streamlined software development, improved processes, and adopted Agile methodologies, reducing the team from 40 to
20, resulting in decreased efforts for enhanced results.

ELAN PHARMACEUTICALS
Program Manager

2009-2011

Directed cross-functional teams of 15+ in supporting multiple research informatics projects for the global biotechnology company.
Spearheaded various strategic and operational initiatives, including budgeting, planning, hardware evaluation and procurement,
vendor selection, platform implementation, offshore team development, and architectural decision-making. Cultivated and
maintained productive relationships with multiple overseas vendors, specializing in systems development and deployment.
â€¢
â€¢

â€¢

Conceived and directed the implementation of RISe (Research Informatics System at elan), a cutting-edge integrated
preclinical informatics platform for chemistry, biology, and preclinical safety labs. Patent# 20130013623 (2013). Directly
supported multiple research groups, spanning plasmids, antibodies, and compound tracking.
Managed a portfolio, including agile development methodology and continuous development of an integrated RI platform
for building research applications for use with Lab Notebook, Labware, and Symyx. Initiative allowed for use of single
software platform that resulted in significant cost reduction and enhanced functionality.
Implemented an electronic lab notebook system for Researchers, including migrating data and workflows and eliminating
unwieldy systems interface for lab users.

HABEAS (RETURN PATH)
Director of Engineering

2006-2009

Provided oversight and direction to a diverse global team of 25 resources and held full accountability for a $1M budget for the largest
email deliverability service provider. Developed, re-engineered, and maintained complex systems that handled rapid growth and
scalability and partnered with global vendors to source and employ cutting-edge capabilities aligned with company needs.
Mentored, coached, and directed multiple organizations in the areas of software development, product building, and operational
efficiencies, ensuring continual achievement of goals and objectives.
â€¢
â€¢
â€¢
â€¢

Strategically aligned with a global partner, reducing costs by 40% ($1M to ~$600K) and increasing productivity by 35%+.
Re-engineered systems to support sales growth from 100 clients to 800+, including developing an analytical reporting
framework that provided insights into customer data, segmentation, concentration, and focus areas for marketing and sales.
Spearheaded the early adoption of Amazon AWS and assisted a Bay Area startup with quickly launching their product on
iOS platform.
Successfully founded and obtained VC funding for an internet portal company.

TRUST BENEFITS ONLINE
Director of Product Development

2003-2006

Mentored and managed a team of 9 software professionals and business analysts in supporting the design and development of
product development framework. Partnered with Business Teams, Trust Fund Managers, Business Analysts, and Technology
Partners to drive innovation and move forward the business and technology strategy.
â€¢
â€¢

Supported a traditional mainframe-based parent company spin-off an internet-based, self-service oriented technology
company (TBOL).
Led the complete design and architecture of a SaaS product, delivering on-time and within budget.

EDUCATION
Master of Science (MS), Computer Science, University of Southwestern Louisiana, Lafayette
Master of Technology (MTECH), AI & Robotics, University of Hyderabad, Hyderabad, India
Bachelor of Engineering (BE), Electronics & Communications Engineering, Osmania University, Hyderabad India

# Sri Bolisetty Resume (1)

Accomplished technology leader with a 14+ year history of success in the biotech/pharma industry. Expertise in architecting
cutting-edge informatics systems, integrating research tools for seamless data flow, and empowering organizations through
cloud adoption and automation. Passionate about driving efficiency gains and streamlining research processes.

AI4HI - EIR

Oct 2023 - Present

As Entrepreneur in Residence and executive team member at AI4HI, I spearhead commercialization of innovative technologies
developed at both Amritha Vishwa Vidyapeeth and AI4HI. My mission is to create accessible, affordable digital health solutions
by strategically integrating hardware, software, and AI advancements. I ensure our technology remains cutting-edge,
adaptable, and fosters powerful collaborations with academic and industry partners..
CSL BEHRING - Head of Data & Analytics Engg

2021-2023

Spearheaded development of Knowledge Graph-based applications to enhance R&D collaboration.
Led Big Data, Operational Data Warehouse, and enterprise analytics teams at CSL Behring. Spearheaded development of
Knowledge Graph-based applications to enhance R&D collaboration.
PARKER INSTITUTE FOR CANCER IMMUNOTHERAPY - Executive Director of Technology

2017-2019

Integral member of PICI's team, establishing foundations for cross-functional clinical, regulatory, and IT initiatives that include:
development of translational research informatics platform, managed hybrid cloud/on-prem IT solutions and strategic
worldwide partnerships to drive innovation in rapidly evolving field.
CITY OF HOPE - Director of Research Informatics Applications

2011-2017

Modernized systems for diverse clinical trials (observational, clinical, population science) at City of Hope. Implemented
cutting-edge technology and automation, significantly boosting efficiency. Mentored teams and consultants to bridge
technology gaps, fostering career development and maximizing technology adoption.
ELAN PHARMACEUTICALS - Program Manager, Research Informatics

2009-2011

Spearheaded the strategic development of Elan's Research Informatics System (RISe). This transformative platform streamlined
data management across the R&D lifecycle. Integrated RISe with core tools (e.g., Electronic Lab Notebooks, assay designers) for
seamless data flow, accelerating application development and insights for research and business teams.

documents.title: Software Engineer Application Overview
documents.content:
# Sri Bolisetty-CL.1

Dear Hiring Manager,
I am a software engineer at heart having worked with a vast number of technologies. I am
currently looking for a Software Developer and Engineer role. I have worked with full stack
development from UI all the way to the backend and integration with 3rd party systems.
Involved with coding and every phase of a project or a product from requirements gathering to
production deployment and operations. I am confident that my easy go personality will fit into
most of the development teams that are in product development, or deployment and/or
operations or customized enterprise software application development.
Having worked with traditional in-house systems to cloud based applications, I have seen many
complex situations that are almost impossible to solve and took pleasure in making them look
so easy at the end. I always enjoyed working in environments where there seem like too many
problems and challenges than the people can solve.
Find attached is a summary of a few technologies that I have worked during my career. This
helps you understand my appetite for learning and working with the technologies that differ so
greatly from one another. I have always enjoyed learning new technologies and figuring them
to solve common business problems.
Also, find attached are a few LinkedIn Recommendations I have received over the years. This
helps you understand the depth of technology and commitments I have and my nature of
working with anyone from C-level all the way to the developer. I take complete satisfaction in
solving the toughest problems and mentoring others along the way.
Should you have any questions, feel free to contact me at â€‹SrinivasB@gmail.com or at
214-901-8452.
Thank you and have a great day.
-Srinivas

documents.title: Application for Sr. Java Developer
documents.content:
# Sri Bolisetty-CL

Date: September 3, 2020

Hiring Manager,
Bank of America
Dallas, TX
Position: Sr. Java Developer position, GWIS
Dear Mr. / Ms. Hiring Manager:
As a forward-thinking, innovative, established software technologist with over 15 years of
documented success, I can offer Bank of America the following:
â—

â—
â—

â—

Deep knowledge and technical understanding of processes, platforms, and technologies
and ability to quickly grasp strategies, drivers, priorities, and challenges to continually
meet and exceed business goals.
Extensive working knowledge in full stack development from UI to backend and
integration with 3rd party systems.
Proficient across a wide range of applications and technologies, including Java/JDBC,
Dynamo/WebLogic/Tomcat, BuildMaster/Jenkins, ANT/Maven, Client/Server and Web
Applications.
Extensive working knowledge in many database systems including Oracle, SQL Server,
MySQL and PostgreSQL.

Additionally, I possess an entrepreneurial spirit, strong emotional intelligence, and ability to
rapidly solve problems within fast-paced, ambiguous environments. I am eager to exit my
current sabbatical to achieve a critical role where I can employ my background, skill set, and a
passion for excellence that will add immediate value to your organization.
Thank you for your time and consideration. I look forward to meeting to discuss my
qualifications further.

Sincerely,

-Sri Bolisetty

Sri â€‹â˜â€‹ 214-901-8452

SrinivasB@gmail.com

documents.title: Srinivas Bolisetty's Professional Resume
documents.content:
# Srinivas Bolisetty, M.S., M.Tech . Technologist \| Innovator \| Strategist \| Informatics Leader 

â˜**(214)-901-8452**
[[SrinivasB@gmail.com]{.underline}](mailto:SrinivasB@gmail.com)

Highly analytical, results-driven, established technologist equipped
with strong business acumen, innovative mindset, and 15+ years of
documented success. Expert in architecture, application frameworks,
databases, business processes and improvements, and automation and
in-depth understanding of core business functions and digital
capabilities. Recognized for building, mentoring, and motivating diverse
and distributed teams in building and maintaining complex software
platforms for clinical translational research and healthcare
initiatives. Extensive experience across a diverse set of systems and
cloud providers, including AWS, Azure, GCP and Salesforce and broad
technical domains, spanning security, infrastructure, network, and data.
Adept at effectively balancing strategic and tactical needs while
fostering inclusive, performance-centric cultures within cutting-edge,
multifaceted technology environments.

## Professional Experience

> **Shalusri Inc., Frisco TX (Apr '20 - Present)\
> IT Consultant**
>
> Assisted organizations with systems Infrastructure, Legacy Systems
> Migration, Analysis, Technology Evaluation, DevOps process
> orchestration and Mobile Application Development.

-   Worked on a mobile application design and development on Android for
    a stealth-mode organization. The App was for COVID19 tracking and
    alerting and meant to be used without risking end-user privacy.

-   Analysis of a legacy toll collection system and strategic plan for
    migrating into modern systems utilizing Cloud Infrastructure as
    backend.

-   Reviewed a 15+ year old system and drew a plan for migrating to the
    latest systems infrastructure and technology with focus as minimal
    effort needed. The strategy included both short-term and long-term
    opportunities with technology stack.

-   Assisted in analyzing, designing and implementing the CI/CD pipeline
    for a successful startup with manual and long-drawn deployments with
    non-existing processes and heavy dependency on the core-team.

> **Parker Institute for Cancer Immunotherapy, San Francisco CA (Aug'17
> -- Dec'2019)\
> Executive Director of Technology**
>
> Served in a critical leadership role for the leading San
> Francisco-based startup, specializing in funding clinical trials for
> cutting-edge immunotherapy treatments. Held full accountability for
> system and data architecture, managing the technology framework,
> development, data security, and operations of systems responsible for
> clinical trials, bioinformatics data pipelines, and research data
> analysis. Oversaw data security and architecture across IT and
> clinical systems, as well as establishing SOPs, conducting data
> reviews, setting up data agreements, and performing security analysis
> and prevention activities. Worked in collaboration with Informatics
> and Clinical Leaderships in developing and executing comprehensive
> technology strategies, ensuring streamlined, effective, and
> cost-effective workflows.

-   Established a Clinical Trials platform with off-the-shelf clinical
    systems to deploy Phase 1A and 1B trials, resulting in extension to
    phase 2.

-   Extended vendor partnerships to support more complex microbiome and
    platform trials.

-   Implemented Veeva Vault for quality and eTMF, paving the way for
    later expansion to other clinical offerings.

-   Implemented Salesforce CRM in record time (\< 3 months), allowing
    multiple teams to collaborate for better efficient processes.

-   Led a development team to adopt better agile practices in delivering
    products and frameworks, concentrating on quality and
    deliverability.

-   Managed AWS, GCP, GSuite, OKTA among other IT systems.

<!-- -->

-   Implemented Tableau Cluster for building unified Dashboard
    Infrastructure for both Clinical and non-clinical users. Utilizing
    information across multiple datasets and eliminating the heavy use
    of "pre-prepared" reports over Box and Email.

> **City of Hope Hospital, Los Angeles, CA (Jul'11 - Aug'17)\
> Director of Research Informatics Applications**
>
> Oversaw informatics and multidisciplinary teams in developing and
> executing the department strategy. Fully accountable for a large
> portfolio of applications, including research informatics platforms,
> including, clinical trials data analysis and automation, decision
> support, adverse event monitoring and reporting, SQA, disease
> registries, clinical pathology variant analysis, genomic sequencing,
> cloud platform, data architecture and security, virtualization,
> innovation and team mentoring.

-   Re-aligned teams and developed and streamlined processes, resulting
    in an increase in productivity with 30% less budget annually, from
    \$5M to \$3.5M.

-   Envisioned and led the development of Software Platform for
    Integrated Research Information and Transformation (SPIRIT),
    achieving significant cost reduction, decrease in operational
    overhead, and increased and consistent quality.

-   Streamlined software development, improved processes, and adopted
    Agile methodologies, while the team was reduced from 40 to 20
    resulted in enhanced results.

<!-- -->

-   Envisioned and implemented the SDLC process with CI/CD pipeline for
    all the Research Informatics Applications, reducing the manual
    interventions and streamlining fully auditable deployment for the
    software delivery.

-   Brought SSRS and SSIS processes under CI/CD and eased out the
    grueling report development and verification process. The clinical
    reports that were taking weeks to months before this optimization
    started taking days to develop and verify.

-   Trailblazer in bringing Cloud based processes and data analysis into
    the organization eventually reducing time-to-build and overall
    cost-of-ownership.

-   Implemented numerous solutions for Researchers including NLP,
    Machine Learning, Bio Informatics Pipelines, Cohort discovery.

-   Initiated Mobile Applications development for bringing highly sought
    data to researchers fingertips within the enterprise - both on iOS
    and Android OS.

> **elan Pharmaceuticals (now J&J) in South San Francisco, CA (Feb'09 -
> Jun'11)\
> Program Manager, Research Informatics**
>
> Directed cross-functional teams in supporting multiple research
> informatics projects for the global biotechnology company. Spearheaded
> various strategic and operational initiatives, including budgeting,
> planning, hardware evaluation and procurement, vendor selection,
> platform implementation, offshore team development, and architectural
> decision-making. Cultivated and maintained productive relationships
> with multiple overseas vendors, specializing in systems development
> and deployment.

-   Conceived and directed the implementation of RISe (Research
    Informatics System at elan), a cutting-edge integrated preclinical
    informatics platform for chemistry, biology, and preclinical safety
    labs. Patent# 20130013623 (2013). Directly supported multiple
    research groups, spanning plasmids, antibodies, and compound
    tracking.

-   Managed a portfolio, including agile development methodology and
    continuous development of an integrated RI platform for building
    research applications for use with Lab Notebook, Labware, and Symyx.
    Initiative allowed for use of single software platform that resulted
    in significant cost reduction and enhanced functionality.

-   Implemented an electronic lab notebook system for Researchers,
    including migrating data and workflows and eliminating unwieldy
    systems interface for lab users.

> **Habeas (now ReturnPath) in Mountain View, CA (Sep'05 - Feb'09)\
> Director of Engineering**
>
> Provided oversight and direction to diverse global teams and held full
> accountability for the largest email deliverability service provider.

-   Developed a product suite of applications for Reputation Management

# Sri Bolisetty-Resume.1

Srinivas Bolisetty, M.S., M.Tech
.
Technologist | Innovator | Strategist | Informatics Leader
â˜(214)-901-8452

SrinivasB@gmail.com

Highly analytical, results-driven, established technologist equipped with strong business
acumen, innovative mindset, and 15+ years of documented success. Expert in architecture,
application frameworks, databases, business processes and improvements, and automation and
in-depth understanding of core business functions and digital capabilities. Recognized for
building, mentoring, and motivating diverse and distributed teams in building and maintaining
complex software platforms for clinical translational research and healthcare initiatives.
Extensive experience across a diverse set of systems and cloud providers, including AWS,
Azure, GCP and Salesforce and broad technical domains, spanning security, infrastructure,
network, and data. Adept at effectively balancing strategic and tactical needs while fostering
inclusive, performance-centric cultures within cutting-edge, multifaceted technology
environments.

Professional Experience
Shalusri Inc., Frisco TX
(Apr â€˜20 - Present)
IT Consultant
Assisted organizations with systems Infrastructure, Legacy Systems Migration, Analysis,
Technology Evaluation, DevOps process orchestration and Mobile Application Development.
â—

â—
â—

â—

Worked on a mobile application design and development on Android for a stealth-mode
organization. The App was for COVID19 tracking and alerting and meant to be used
without risking end-user privacy.
Analysis of a legacy toll collection system and strategic plan for migrating into modern
systems utilizing Cloud Infrastructure as backend.
Reviewed a 15+ year old system and drew a plan for migrating to the latest systems
infrastructure and technology with focus as minimal effort needed. The strategy included
both short-term and long-term opportunities with technology stack.
Assisted in analyzing, designing and implementing the CI/CD pipeline for a successful
startup with manual and long-drawn deployments with non-existing processes and
heavy dependency on the core-team.

Parker Institute for Cancer Immunotherapy, San Francisco CA (Augâ€™17 â€“ Decâ€™2019)
Executive Director of Technology
Served in a critical leadership role for the leading San Francisco-based startup, specializing in
funding clinical trials for cutting-edge immunotherapy treatments. Held full accountability for
system and data architecture, managing the technology framework, development, data
security, and operations of systems responsible for clinical trials, bioinformatics data pipelines,
and research data analysis. Oversaw data security and architecture across IT and clinical
systems, as well as establishing SOPs, conducting data reviews, setting up data agreements,
and performing security analysis and prevention activities. Worked in collaboration with
Informatics and Clinical Leaderships in developing and executing comprehensive technology
strategies, ensuring streamlined, effective, and cost-effective workflows.
â—
â—

Established a Clinical Trials platform with off-the-shelf clinical systems to deploy Phase
1A and 1B trials, resulting in extension to phase 2.
Extended vendor partnerships to support more complex microbiome and platform trials.
SrinivasB@gmail.com

1 of 3

â˜ 214-901-8452

Implemented Veeva Vault for quality and eTMF, paving the way for later expansion to
other clinical offerings.

collaborate for better efficient processes.

frameworks, concentrating on quality and deliverability.

Implemented Tableau Cluster for building unified Dashboard Infrastructure for both
Clinical and non-clinical users. Utilizing information across multiple datasets and
eliminating the heavy use of â€œpre-preparedâ€ reports over Box and Email.

City of Hope Hospital, Los Angeles, CA
(Julâ€™11 - Augâ€™17)
Director of Research Informatics Applications
Oversaw informatics and multidisciplinary teams in developing and executing the department
strategy. Fully accountable for a large portfolio of applications, including research informatics
platforms, including, clinical trials data analysis and automation, decision support, adverse
event monitoring and reporting, SQA, disease registries, clinical pathology variant analysis,
genomic sequencing, cloud platform, data architecture and security, virtualization, innovation
and team mentoring.
â—
â—

â—
â—

â—
â—
â—
â—

Re-aligned teams and developed and streamlined processes, resulting in an increase in
productivity with 30% less budget annually, from $5M to $3.5M.
Envisioned and led the development of Software Platform for Integrated Research
Information and Transformation (SPIRIT), achieving significant cost reduction, decrease
in operational overhead, and increased and consistent quality.
Streamlined software development, improved processes, and adopted Agile
methodologies, while the team was reduced from 40 to 20 resulted in enhanced results.
Envisioned and implemented the SDLC process with CI/CD pipeline for all the Research
Informatics Applications, reducing the manual interventions and streamlining fully
auditable deployment for the software delivery.
Brought SSRS and SSIS processes under CI/CD and eased out the grueling report
development and verification process. The clinical reports that were taking weeks to
months before this optimization started taking days to develop and verify.
Trailblazer in bringing Cloud based processes and data analysis into the organization
eventually reducing time-to-build and overall cost-of-ownership.
Implemented numerous solutions for Researchers including NLP, Machine Learning, Bio
Informatics Pipelines, Cohort discovery.
Initiated Mobile Applications development for bringing highly sought data to researchers
fingertips within the enterprise - both on iOS and Android OS.

elan Pharmaceuticals (now J&J) in South San Francisco, CA (Febâ€™09 - Junâ€™11)

Directed cross-functional teams in supporting multiple research informatics projects for the
global biotechnology company. Spearheaded various strategic and operational initiatives,
including budgeting, planning, hardware evaluation and procurement, vendor selection,
platform implementation, offshore team development, and architectural decision-making.
Cultivated and maintained productive relationships with multiple overseas vendors,
specializing in systems development and deployment.
â—

Conceived and directed the implementation of RISe (Research Informatics System at
elan), a cutting-edge integrated preclinical informatics platform for chemistry, biology,
and preclinical safety labs. Patent# 20130013623 (2013). Directly supported multiple
research groups, spanning plasmids, antibodies, and compound tracking.

â—

â—

evolving needs of Trust Funds, Employers, Administrators, and Plan Participants.
TrustBenefits is a spinoff from Associated Third Party Administrators, a veteran company
that provides administrative services to various multi-employer trust funds.

end-users access to their trust fund information. Mentored the original team from ATPA

Re-engineered the original engine that is coded in oracle and oracle forms and built an
multi-layer API to take advantage of building multiple products based on the same core
database design. Thus helping save years of labor spent in generating the core engine

Built an in-house build-system for preparing the clients, trust funds and building a new

documents.title: Software Developer Resume Overview
documents.content:
# Srinivas Bolisetty

â˜**(214)-901-8452**
[[SrinivasB@gmail.com]{.underline}](mailto:SrinivasB@gmail.com)

Experienced Software Developer -- with a wide range of expertise in
Operating Systems, Databases, Multiple Software technology stacks,
including Cloud and Mobile platforms -- seeking a software developer
role in the North Dallas, TX area.

## Professional Experience

> **Parker Institute for Cancer Immunotherapy, San Francisco CA (Aug'17
> -- Dec'2019)**

-   Salesforce Implementation for BusDev, Legal and Finance teams.
    Transformed day-to-day workflows into intuitive, easy to use,
    standardized Salesforce environment with a goal to transform the
    entire organization.

-   Migrated a 4 year old Exchange 2003 into Google Gsuite Enterprise.

-   Implemented OKTA, Box, GSuite, Smartsheets, Lucid, Slack, DocuSign
    and Office for the enterprise users including Active Directory
    integration, setting up and training.

-   Implemented Clinical Systems - Medidata RaveX, Veeva eTMF, Veeva
    Quality, Argus - for conducting Phase 1, 1B and 2 trials.

-   Participated in Clinical Trials on 4 studies, one of which went from
    Phase 1A to 1B and another is a platform trial across multiple study
    sites, 3 to 7, across the US.

-   Responsible for setting up, daily operations and optimizing
    operational expenditure of Cloud Environment - AWS, Azure and GCP.
    GCP was primary with 90% load with Azure for DevOps Pipelines and
    AWS for Technology Development.

-   Implemented Tableau Cluster for building unified Dashboard
    Infrastructure for both Clinical and non-clinical users. Utilizing
    information across multiple datasets and eliminating the heavy use
    of "pre-prepared" reports over Box and Email.

-   Worked with multiple vendors in building Bio-Tech pipelines for data
    analysis and product development.

> **City of Hope Hospital, Los Angeles, CA (Jul'11 - Aug'17)**

-   Responsible for a suite of Research Applications development,
    deployment and operations - About 12 daily utilized applications and
    6+ infrequent applications (for processes related to Governance,
    Compliance and Audit). Applications are key for about 200 users with
    a total of 1000 users across the enterprise.

-   Migrated an ASP.NET based Clinical Trials Online application to
    WebLogic based Java/J2EE environment for modern UI, ease of use and
    integration at the enterprise level.

-   Designed a SPIRIT platform - a Software Platform for Integrated
    Research and Information Technology - to solve technical debt
    created with numerous applications on different technologies over a
    period of 2 decades.

-   Designed and implemented SPIRIT-HopeSEQ - a Variant Analysis
    application for the Pathology Department - that visually helped them
    analyze and compare the data with other existing patients and
    comorbidities, reducing the time to analyze a single dataset from 8
    hours to few minutes. Technologies used are Angular, NodeJS and SQL
    Server.

-   Designed and implemented SPIRIT-Disease Registry - an application to
    capture any disease or diagnosis type and track patient data and let
    the users analyse and support research needs. A single application
    framework built on the SPIRIT framework that is customizable within
    the UI to support different disease types, user-roles and
    permission-sets and feature-mappings.

-   Envisioned and implemented the SDLC process with CI/CD pipeline for
    all the Research Informatics Applications, reducing the unnecessary
    overhead and increasing the quality and time of the software
    delivery.

-   Brought SSRS and SSIS processes under CI/CD and eased out the
    gueling report development and verification process. The clinical
    reports that were taking weeks to months before this optimization
    started taking days to develop and verify.

-   Revamped the Software Development of Research Applications and made
    it an example benchmark and instigated change across other teams
    within the Enterprise.

-   Proposed and performed POC projects to bring in Azure Cloud into the
    organization.

-   Brought a handful of Research Applications into the Cloud - with a
    fractional operational costs compared to huge capital costs.

-   Implemented numerous solutions for Researchers including NLP,
    Machine Learning, Bio Informatics Pipelines, Cohort discovery.

-   Developed a few Mobile Applications for helping researchers bring
    the already existing data within the enterprise - both on iOS and
    Android OS.

-   Other technologies used most commonly include: HP's Quality Center,
    RemedyForce, Teleriks' UI and Test Studio, MySQL, PostgreSQL,
    Drupal, Wordpress, VersionOne, JIRA, Linux(RHEL, CentOS and Ubuntu)
    and Windows (2008, 2012, 2016).

> **elan Pharmaceuticals (now J&J) in South San Francisco, CA (Feb'09 -
> Jun'11)**

-   Designed and implemented RISe - Research Informatics Systems at
    elan - a software platform for managing biological assets in the
    Research. After a successful POC and development phases, implemented
    for a handful of projects - Antibody Database and Plasmid Database -
    and eventually patented.

-   Implemented Symyx Laboratory Electronic Notebook across multiple
    labs at elan.

-   Worked with an offshore development team in building the platform
    and implementing the software with a small set of onsite resources
    in quality verification, deployment and training.

-   Technologies utilized include: .NET/C#, Hibernate, Oracle, Microsoft
    Workflow Foundation, HP's Quality Center, Seapine's Version Control
    and Test Track, VersionOne.

> **Habeas (now ReturnPath) in Mountain View, CA (Sep'05 - Feb'09)**

-   Developed a product suite of applications for Reputation Management
    for enterprises. The challenge was to automate the necessary
    processes, constant and continuous monitoring, reporting and
    remediation.

-   Implemented a software framework with Restful API based middleware
    platform to to scale database and application features with backend
    using Java and Hibernate with MySQL.

-   Reengineered the application framework to provide rich front-end UI
    capabilities using Adobe Flex.

-   Responsible for re-architecting the database backend to support
    tremendous growth in the number of clients and datasets we have
    seen. Clients grew from 80 to 600 with data growing from few
    hundreds of thousands points to over a billion per day.

-   Worked with offshore vendors to build multiple development teams
    with a core team onsite to support vision, quality and operations.

-   Implemented an Organization wide Reporting Distribution to help the
    business users get customers' data at their fingertips.

-   Technologies utilized include: Adobe Flex, PHP, Java, Hibernate,
    MySQL, JasperSoft, HP's Quality center and Load Runner, Microsoft's
    WCAP and Rally.

> **Trust Benefits Online (now International Concepts Inc) in
> Emeryville, CA (Nov'03 - Sep'05)**

-   TrustBenefits offers web-based benefits administration solutions
    meeting the ever evolving needs of Trust Funds, Employers,
    Administrators, and Plan Participants. TrustBenefits is a spinoff
    from Associated Third Party Administrators, a veteran company that
    provides administrative services to various multi-employer trust
    funds.

-   Engineered a SaaS based framework to build an online Participant
    Tool in providing end-users access to their trust fund information.
    Mentored the original team from ATPA in the new generation of
    technologies.

-   Re-engineered the original engine that is coded in oracle and oracle
    forms and built an multi-layer API to take advantage of building
    multiple products based on the same core database design. Thus
    helping save years of labor spent in generating the core engine that
    managed and performed the many complex calculations involving one's
    retirement and other benefits.

-   Built an in-house build-system for preparing the clients, trust
    funds and building a new release of the code into SaaS farm.
    Designed and implemented template-based content that non-technical
    folks can manage and deploy the content into ATG Dynamo's content
    repositories which are in turn used by the application at the
    run-time.

-   The technology stack is based on both commercial and open-source
    tools that include: ATG Dynamo for Java Application Server, Sun's
    Web Servers (Netscape, iplanet), Solaris and Oracle for backend,
    Perl based home grown build and content preparation system based.
documents.summary: Srinivas Bolisetty is an experienced software developer with expertise in operating systems, databases, and various software technology stacks, seeking a role in North Dallas, TX. His professional experience includes significant contributions to organizations in the healthcare and biotech sectors, focusing on software implementation, cloud environments, and research applications.

documents.title: Technology Leadership in Clinical Research
documents.content:
# **Srinivas** (Sri) **Bolisetty M.S.**, M.Tech.

â˜**(214)-901-8452**
[[SrinivasB@Gmail.com]{.underline}](mailto:SrinivasB@Gmail.com)

Manager and Architect in Technology Leadership, Software Systems and
Data Architecture, Application Platforms. Managed Large Portfolio of
Applications, Clinical Trials Systems, Vendor Relationship, Mentoring
and managing diverse and distributed teams development, Innovation,
Strategy and Process Improvement. Deep expertise in cloud and mobile
computing and special expertise in building software platforms for
basic, clinical and translational research and healthcare.

## 

## Performance Highlights

> Leadership

-   Setup and managed Clinical Systems for conducting Phase 1A/1B and
    Phase 2 Clinical Trials. Extended partnerships with vendors to
    support more complex Microbiome and Platform (or Basket) trials.

-   Responsible for IT and Clinical Systems Quality and Auditability.
    Planned and prepared Data Architecture and Security for Clinical
    Trials and IT Systems.

-   Implemented Salesforce for multiple teams to collaborate more
    efficiently on the daily work activities with the goal of sharing
    information efficiently across the enterprise.

-   Responsible for managing Clinical Trials Systems, Clinical Study
    Form development and deployment, Clinical Study progress
    coordination across vendors and partners, building multi-cloud based
    Translational Informatics platform, Corporate IT infrastructure,
    Governance and Auditability, IT and Data security, with an yearly
    budget of \$2million at Parker Institute for Cancer Immunotherapy.

-   Managed diverse groups of about 17 team members, responsible for all
    aspects of application analysis to development to operationalization
    to production support, with an yearly budget of \$3.5 million at
    City of Hope National Medical Center (COH).

-   Managed global team of about 10 members, responsible for product
    design and development, vendor management, user training at elan
    Pharmaceuticals.

-   Managed global team of about 25 members, responsible for product
    development, Engineering and performance tuning, BI analysis and
    Data warehouse at Habeas.

> Innovation and Platforms

-   Envisaged and led development of Software Platform for Integrated
    Research Information and Transformation (SPIRIT), for basic,
    clinical and translational informatics (COH)

-   Conceived and directed implementation of RISe (Research Informatics
    System at elan) -- a cutting edge integrated pre-clinical
    informatics platform for chemistry, biology and preclinical safety
    labs; Patent: System and Method for Managing Information of
    Biological Entities. Patent \# 20130013623, (2013)

-   Redesigned and engineered a Reputation platform for Marketing
    Companies to statistically evaluate and analyze effectiveness of
    email campaigns that led to quick market adoption eventually leading
    the No.1 competitor in the space to acquire us when we are at No.3.

> Strategy and Process Improvements

-   Clinical systems process and engineering to handle multi-phase,
    basket trials that grew from one trial to 4 trials in under two
    years, that span different spectrum such as multi-drug to
    micro-biome. Process was improved and integrated to take advantage
    of best available vendor systems, and technology platforms -
    Medidata Rave, EndPoint, Veeva, Argus, Box.com and Tableau.

-   Re-engineered an non-existing SDLC process to adopt best practices,
    set up a Release Management cycle that rolled nicely into the
    Enterprise ITIL process later on.

-   Envisioned a 4-tier environment for software applications
    development to help improve the quality of enterprise software
    applications and provide a means for securing data access mechanisms
    across multiple entities and user-roles.

-   Strategically planned adoption of cloud platforms within Research to
    help address the future needs in time as the demand arised.

-   Managed Mobile applications development in clinical research
    including: BRisk, Clinical Trials at COH, Adverse Events Calculator.

-   Strategic alignment of resources with a global partner reducing the
    overall costs by 40% (\$1M to \~\$600K), the productivity is
    increased by over 35% with half the staff (number of product
    releases, features, reports).

> Entrepreneurship and Grants

-   Founded and obtained venture capital for an internet portal

-   Contributed architectural and technical solutions to multiple grant
    proposals. Wrote informatics components of grants as
    co-Investigator. Responsible for informatics portion of grant funded
    national data coordination center projects.

-   Helped Habeas acquire multitude of clients by scaling out
    application architecture on demand before the PaaS and IaaS days.

## Professional Experience

> **Executive Director of Technology, Parker Institute for Cancer
> Immunotherapy, San Francisco CA (Aug 2017 - Present)**
>
> Responsible for managing Technology framework, development, data
> security and operations of Systems responsible for Clinical Trials,
> Bio-Informatics data pipelines and Research Data Analysis.
>
> Re-focused the development teams to adopt better agile practices in
> delivering products and frameworks with quality and deliverability as
> focus.
>
> Implemented Veeva Vault for Quality and eTMF, and RaveX for eCRFs,
> EndPoint and RTSM, Argus for Safety to support multiple trials under
> PICI's Clinical Trials Management product suite.
>
> Medidata Cloud Administration, Veeva Systems Administration, EndPoint
> Integration, Translational and Clinical data analysis and development,
> GCP/AWS/Azure Administration, Box/Tableau/GSuite implementation and
> adaptation, Salesforce implementation.
>
> Implemented Tableau based reporting infrastructure to setup data
> architecture for the organization and help integrate different
> datasets and build a uniform reporting and dashboard for easy to
> access information all clinical and non-clinical purposes.
>
> Responsible for Data Security and Architecture across the IT and
> Clinical Systems. Involved with setting up SOPs, data reviews, data
> agreements and security analysis and prevention.
>
> **Director, Research Informatics Applications, City of National
> Medical Center, Duarte CA (Oct 2011 - Aug 2017)**
>
> Managed and mentored a team of upto 19 informatics professionals,
> including multi-discipline teams with a budget of 2.5 million.
>
> Re-focused the teams and processes to be efficient and effective at
> building research applications, innovative thinking and automating
> daily tasks. The improvements showed better productivity with 30% less
> budget, going from \$5M to \$3.5M, within 2 years.
>
> Managed portfolio includes Research Systems, Research Applications,
> Clinical Trials Data Analysis and Automation, Decision Support,
> Adverse Event monitoring and reporting, SQA, Disease Registries,
> Clinical Pathology Variant Analysis, Genomic Sequencing, Cloud
> Platform, Data Architecture and Security, Virtualization and
> Innovation.
>
> Envisaged and led the development of a software platform called
> SPIRIT, Implementation and automation of SDLC, Vendor and Software
> license management, Continuous Technology Training. SPIRIT helped
> build rapid application development with less cost, less operational
> overhead and more quality in a uniform and cohesive manner.
>
> Partnering with IT teams, PI's, Researchers, Physicians and
> Clinicians - encouraging, advising, brainstorming, supporting
> whichever way needed to build applications. POC's in areas of Machine
> Learning, Process Pipelining, Cloud Computing, NLP, Cohort Discovery,
> Technology Adaption.
>
> With the use of Community of Practice, Innovation sessions and Online
> self-directed CBTs, Individualized course curriculums - kept the teams
> abreast of technology, and be more productive and efficient.
>
> **Program Manager, elan Pharmaceuticals, South San Francisco CA\
> (Feb 2009 - Jun 2011)**
>
> Managed blended teams of 10 - 20 Informaticians and Developers in
> supporting multiple Research Informatics projects. Provided a lead
> role in Budgeting, Planning, Hardware evaluation and acquisition,
> Vendor selection, offshore-team selection, Leading architectural
> decisions, Overseeing platform implementation
>
> Managed portfolio include Agile development methodology with
> continuous development-and-testing with onsite and offshore teams, an
> Integrated RI Platform in building Research Applications such as
> Antibody, Plasmid and Cell-line Registry databases, Laboratory
> Electronic Notebook.
>
> Excel/Word based lab notebooks to electronic lab notebook process to
> improve and support Intellectual Property (IP) protection and lab
> assay documentation and repeatability.
>
> Vendor partnerships for electronic lab notebook and RI Platform
> architecture and implementation.
>
> RISe as a platform designed for developing biological entity
> registration and management system resulting in a Patent.
>
> **Director of Engineering,Habeas (Acq by Return Path), Mountain View
> CA\
> (Mar 2006 - Jan 2009)**
>
> Managed diverse global teams of 12 - 25 members, leading
> multidisciplinary responsibilities with a budget of 1 Million.
>
> Reengineered the systems to scale up to withstand the sales growth,
> from \<100 clients to \>800 clients. Put together an Analytical
> Reporting framework to provide insights into customer data,
> segmentation, concentration and focus areas for Marketing and Sales.
>
> Re-engineered the backend database architecture to scale up and scale
> out with client-data security as focused goal.
>
> Portfolio include End-User Interface with rich media integration,
> Restful Service API based Middleware framework for flexibility and
> scalability, robust backend database design to scale both horizontally
> and vertically to support growth.
>
> Fully Automated QA framework that tested engineered products end to
> end with different campaign parameters to mimic real world situations,
> engineering and re-architecting the components of the platform to take
> advantage of technology, fully optimized 24/7 development and testing
> cycle.
>
> Partnered with global vendors like Persistent Systems and Sierra
> Atlantic in Built-to-Own model.
>
> **Director, Product Development, Trust Benefits Online, Emeryville CA\
> (Nov 2003 - Mar 2006)**
>
> Managed and mentored a team of upto 9 software professionals and
> business analysts.
>
> Setup and organized the team\'s from ground up to support the design
> and development of product development framework.
>
> Managed portfolio includes Backend Annuity Calculation Engine,
> Middleware Platform supporting Trust Client specific Rules and
> Guidelines, Semi-Automated Content Management System that automated
> building Trust specific websites with limited effort from analysts.
>
> Automated template based approach for building websites with minimal
> HTML coders/coding. Separation of Business Rules from Operational
> Processes, Very highly scalable middleware that can support large
> number of clients and web traffic.
>
> Partnering with Business Teams, Trust Fund Managers, Business
> Analysts, Technology Partners.
>
> CMS and Template based approach to building websites automatically.
> Unique adoption of new trends in Application Server Framework to
> advance development of Product Framework and Data Security.

## Patents and Awards

> Conceived and directed implementation of RISe (Research Informatics
> System at elan) -- a cutting edge integrated pre-clinical informatics
> platform for chemistry, biology and preclinical safety labs; Patent:
> Shah, Ajay, et. al. System and Method for Managing Information of
> Biological Entities. Patent \# 20130013623, (2013)
>
> American Medical Informatics Association (AMIA) Distinguished Poster
> Award for software for clinical trials cohort discovery (2015)

## 

## Conference Presentations

> SPIRIT SpecWiz: Metadata Driven, Semantically Enhanced Collaboration
> Tool for Generation of Specifications for Case Report Forms, Ajay
> Shah, Srinivas Bolisetty, Fortino Martinez, Stacy Berger, John Meng,
> Gwen Sale, Jennifer Boesen, Dona McQueen, Gayle Old-Smith, Weizhong
> Zhu, Joyce Niland, American Medical Informatics Association, San
> Francisco, (March 2016)
>
> SPIRIT -- Integrated Platform for Protocol Decision Trees, Eligibility
> Screening and Cohort Identification, Ajay Shah, John Meng, Sai
> Achuthan, Srinivas Bolisetty, MTech, Ayyappan Nagender, Weizhong Zhu ,
> Joyce C. Niland, American Medical Informatics Association, San
> Francisco, CA, (April 2014)
>
> Protocol Decision Trees to Facilitate Protocol Planning and Patient
> Enrollment, Joyce C. Niland, Cy Stein, Julie Hom, Adina Londrc, Karen
> Rickard, Srisairam Achuthan, Srinivas Bolisetty, John Meng, Ayyappan
> Nagender, Ajay Shah, American Medical Informatics Association, San
> Francisco, CA, (April 2014)
>
> SPIRIT ML âˆ’ A Machine Learning Platform for Translational Research,
> Srisairam Achuthan , Mike Chang, Ajay Shah and Joyce C Niland,
> American Medical Informatics Association, San Francisco, CA, (April
> 2014)
>
> Integrated Translational Research Informatics, invited speaker and
> session chair, Ajay Shah John Meng, Sai Achuthan Weizhong Zhu,
> Srinivas Bolisetty, Ayyappan Nagender, Mike Chang, Joyce C. Niland,
> BioAsia-IT Hyderabad, India (Feb 2014)

## **Educational Background**

-   **Master of Science** in Computer Science\
    University of Southwestern Louisiana, Lafayette

-   **Master of Technology** in AI and Robotics\
    University of Hyderabad, Hyderabad India

-   **Bachelor of Engineering** in Electronics and Communications Engg.\
    Osmania University, Hyderabad, India
documents.summary: Sri Bolisetty is a seasoned technology manager and architect with extensive experience in software systems, data architecture, and clinical trials management, focusing on innovation and process improvement in healthcare technology. He has successfully led diverse teams and implemented advanced platforms to enhance research and operational efficiency in clinical settings.

supporting Trust Client specific Rules and Guidelines, Semi-Automated Content Management

Automated template based approach for building websites with minimal HTML coders/coding.

that can support large number of clients and web traffic.  
Partnering with Business Teams, Trust Fund Managers, Business Analysts, Technology  
Partners.  
CMS and Template based approach to building websites automatically. Unique adoption of

and Data Security.

â€¢  
Designed and implemented SPIRIT-Disease Registry \- an application to capture any

research needs. A single application framework built on the SPIRIT framework that is  
customizable within the UI to support different disease types, user-roles and

permission-sets and feature-mappings.

and time of the software delivery.  
â€¢  
Brought SSRS and SSIS processes under CI/CD and eased out the gueling report  
development and verification process. The clinical reports that were taking weeks to  
months before this optimization started taking days to develop and verify.  
elan Pharmaceuticals (now J\&J) in South San Francisco, CA (Febâ€™09 \- Junâ€™11)

platform for managing biological assets in the Research. Resulted in US Patent  
\#â€‹US20130013623A1â€‹.

documents.title: Srinivas Bolisetty: Technology Leader
documents.content:
# SriBolisetty-12

Srinivas Bolisetty, M.S., M.Tech  
.  
Technologist | Innovator | Strategist | Informatics Leader

â˜(214)-901-8452 [SrinivasB@gmail.com](mailto:SrinivasB@gmail.com)  
Highly analytical, results-driven, established technologist equipped with strong business acumen, innovative mindset, and 15+ years of documented success. Expert in architecture, application frameworks, databases, business processes and improvements, and automation and in-depth understanding of core business functions and digital capabilities. Recognized for building, mentoring, and motivating diverse and distributed teams in building and maintaining complex software platforms for clinical translational research and healthcare initiatives. Extensive experience across a diverse set of systems and cloud providers, including AWS, Azure, GCP and Salesforce and broad technical domains, spanning security, infrastructure, network, and data. Adept at effectively balancing strategic and tactical needs while fostering inclusive, performance-centric cultures within cutting-edge, multifaceted technology environments.  
Professional Experience  
Shalusri Inc., Frisco TX (Apr â€˜20 \- Present)  
IT Consultant  
Assisted organizations with systems Infrastructure, Legacy Systems Migration, Analysis, Technology Evaluation, DevOps process orchestration and Mobile Application Development.  
â—  
Worked on a mobile application design and development on Android for a stealth-mode organization. The App was for COVID19 tracking and alerting and meant to be used without risking end-user privacy.  
â—  
Analysis of a legacy toll collection system and strategic plan for migrating into modern systems utilizing Cloud Infrastructure as backend.  
â—  
Reviewed a 15+ year old system and drew a plan for migrating to the latest systems infrastructure and technology with focus as minimal effort needed. The strategy included both short-term and long-term opportunities with technology stack.  
â—  
Assisted in analyzing, designing and implementing the CI/CD pipeline for a successful startup with manual and long-drawn deployments with non-existing processes and heavy dependency on the core-team.  
Parker Institute for Cancer Immunotherapy, San Francisco CA (Augâ€™17 â€“ Decâ€™2019)  
Executive Director of Technology  
Served in a critical leadership role for the leading San Francisco-based startup, specializing in funding clinical trials for cutting-edge immunotherapy treatments. Held full accountability for system and data architecture, managing the technology framework, development, data security, and operations of systems responsible for clinical trials, bioinformatics data pipelines, and research data analysis. Oversaw data security and architecture across IT and clinical systems, as well as establishing SOPs, conducting data reviews, setting up data agreements, and performing security analysis and prevention activities. Worked in collaboration with Informatics and Clinical Leaderships in developing and executing comprehensive technology strategies, ensuring streamlined, effective, and cost-effective workflows.  
â—  
Established a Clinical Trials platform with off-the-shelf clinical systems to deploy Phase 1A and 1B trials, resulting in extension to phase 2\.  
â—  
Extended vendor partnerships to support more complex microbiome and platform trials.  
â—  
Implemented Veeva Vault for quality and eTMF, paving the way for later expansion to other clinical offerings.  
â—  
Implemented Salesforce CRM in record time (\< 3 months), allowing multiple teams to collaborate for better efficient processes.  
â—  
Led a development team to adopt better agile practices in delivering products and frameworks, concentrating on quality and deliverability.  
â—  
Managed AWS, GCP, GSuite, OKTA among other IT systems.  
â—  
Implemented Tableau Cluster for building unified Dashboard Infrastructure for both Clinical and non-clinical users. Utilizing information across multiple datasets and eliminating the heavy use of â€œpre-preparedâ€ reports over Box and Email.  
City of Hope Hospital, Los Angeles, CA (Julâ€™11 \- Augâ€™17)  
Director of Research Informatics Applications  
Oversaw informatics and multidisciplinary teams in developing and executing the department strategy. Fully accountable for a large portfolio of applications, including research informatics platforms, including, clinical trials data analysis and automation, decision support, adverse event monitoring and reporting, SQA, disease registries, clinical pathology variant analysis, genomic sequencing, cloud platform, data architecture and security, virtualization, innovation and team mentoring.  
â—  
Re-aligned teams and developed and streamlined processes, resulting in an increase in productivity with 30% less budget annually, from $5M to $3.5M.  
â—  
Envisioned and led the development of Software Platform for Integrated Research Information and Transformation (SPIRIT), achieving significant cost reduction, decrease in operational overhead, and increased and consistent quality.  
â—  
Streamlined software development, improved processes, and adopted Agile methodologies, while the team was reduced from 40 to 20 resulted in enhanced results.  
â—  
Envisioned and implemented the SDLC process with CI/CD pipeline for all the Research Informatics Applications, reducing the manual interventions and streamlining fully auditable deployment for the software delivery.  
â—  
Brought SSRS and SSIS processes under CI/CD and eased out the grueling report development and verification process. The clinical reports that were taking weeks to months before this optimization started taking days to develop and verify.  
â—  
Trailblazer in bringing Cloud based processes and data analysis into the organization eventually reducing time-to-build and overall cost-of-ownership.  
â—  
Implemented numerous solutions for Researchers including NLP, Machine Learning, Bio Informatics Pipelines, Cohort discovery.  
â—  
Initiated Mobile Applications development for bringing highly sought data to researchers fingertips within the enterprise \- both on iOS and Android OS.  
elan Pharmaceuticals (now J\&J) in South San Francisco, CA (Febâ€™09 \- Junâ€™11)  
Program Manager, Research Informatics  
Directed cross-functional teams in supporting multiple research informatics projects for the global biotechnology company. Spearheaded various strategic and operational initiatives, including budgeting, planning, hardware evaluation and procurement, vendor selection, platform implementation, offshore team development, and architectural decision-making. Cultivated and maintained productive relationships with multiple overseas vendors, specializing in systems development and deployment.  
â—  
Conceived and directed the implementation of RISe (Research Informatics System at elan), a cutting-edge integrated preclinical informatics platform for chemistry, biology, and preclinical safety labs. Patent\# 20130013623 (2013). Directly supported multiple research groups, spanning plasmids, antibodies, and compound tracking.  
â—  
Managed a portfolio, including agile development methodology and continuous development of an integrated RI platform for building research applications for use with Lab Notebook, Labware, and Symyx. Initiative allowed for use of single software platform that resulted in significant cost reduction and enhanced functionality.  
â—  
Implemented an electronic lab notebook system for Researchers, including migrating data and workflows and eliminating unwieldy systems interface for lab users.  
Habeas (now ReturnPath) in Mountain View, CA (Sepâ€™05 \- Febâ€™09)  
Director of Engineering  
Provided oversight and direction to diverse global teams and held full accountability for the largest email deliverability service provider. Developed, re-engineered, and maintained complex systems that handled rapid growth and scalability and partnered with global vendors to source and employ cutting-edge capabilities aligned with company needs. Mentored, coached, and directed multiple organizations in the areas of software development, product building, and operational efficiencies, ensuring continual achievement of goals and objectives.  
â—  
Re-engineered systems to support sales growth from 100 clients to 800+, including developing an analytical reporting framework that provided insights into customer data, segmentation, concentration, and focus areas for marketing and sales.  
â—  
Developed a product suite of applications for Reputation Management for enterprises. The challenge was to automate the necessary processes, consistent and continuous monitoring, reporting and remediation.  
â—  
Implemented a software framework with Restful API based middleware platform to to scale database and application features with backend using Java and Hibernate with MySQL.  
â—  
Reengineered the application framework to provide rich front-end UI capabilities using Adobe Flex.  
Trust Benefits Online in Emeryville, CA (Novâ€™03 \- Sepâ€™05)  
Director of Product Development  
Mentored and managed a team of software professionals and business analysts in supporting the design and development of product development framework. Partnered with Business Teams, Trust Fund Managers, Business Analysts, and Technology Partners to drive innovation and move forward the business and technology strategy.  
â—  
Supported a traditional mainframe-based parent company spin-off an internet-based, self-service oriented technology company.  
â—  
TrustBenefits offers web-based benefits administration solutions meeting the ever evolving needs of Trust Funds, Employers, Administrators, and Plan Participants. TrustBenefits is a spinoff from Associated Third Party Administrators, a veteran company that provides administrative services to various multi-employer trust funds.  
â—  
Engineered a SaaS based framework to build an online Participant Tool in providing end-users access to their trust fund information. Mentored the original team from ATPA in the new generation of technologies.  
â—  
Re-engineered the original engine that is coded in oracle and oracle forms and built an multi-layer API to take advantage of building multiple products based on the same core database design. Thus helping save years of labor spent in generating the core engine that managed and performed the many complex calculations involving oneâ€™s retirement and other benefits.

Integrated with I2E NLP process to bring the naturalized queries to researchers.  
â—  
Designed a SPIRIT platform \- a Software Platform for Integrated Research and Information Technology \- to solve technical debt created with numerous applications on different technologies over a period of 2 decades.  
â—  
Designed and implemented SPIRIT-HopeSEQ \- a Variant Analysis application for the Pathology Department \- that visually helped them analyze and compare the data with other existing patients and comorbidities, reducing the time to analyze a single dataset from 8 hours to few minutes. Technologies used are Angular, NodeJS and SQL Server.  
â—  
Designed and implemented SPIRIT-Disease Registry \- an application to capture any disease or diagnosis type and track patient data and let the users analyse and support research needs. A single application framework built on the SPIRIT framework that is customizable within the UI to support different disease types, user-roles and permission-sets and feature-mappings.  
â—  
Envisioned and implemented the SDLC process with CI/CD pipeline for all the Research Informatics Applications, reducing the unnecessary overhead and increasing the quality and time of the software delivery.  
â—  
Brought SSRS and SSIS processes under CI/CD and eased out the gueling report development and verification process. The clinical reports that were taking weeks to months before this optimization started taking days to develop and verify.  
elan Pharmaceuticals (now J\&J) in South San Francisco, CA (Febâ€™09 \- Junâ€™11)  
â—  
Designed and implemented RISe \- Research Informatics Systems at elan \- a software platform for managing biological assets in the Research. Resulted in US Patent \#[US20130013623A1](https://elasticpatent.com/US20130013623A1-system-and-method-for-managing-information-of-biological-entities).  
â—  
A POC phase was conducted with both .NET and Java Stacks with real-world applications as testbed. Resulted in selecting .NET as the framework for development.  
â—  
Worked with an offshore development team in building the platform and implementing the software with a small set of onsite resources in quality verification, deployment and training.  
â—  
Technologies utilized include: .NET/C\#, Hibernate, Oracle, Microsoft Workflow Foundation, HPâ€™s Quality Center, Seapineâ€™s Version Control and Test Track, VersionOne.  
Habeas (now ReturnPath) in Mountain View, CA (Sepâ€™05 \- Febâ€™09)  
â—  
Developed a product suite of applications for Reputation Management for enterprises. The challenge was to automate the necessary processes, constant and continuous monitoring, reporting and remediation. Technologies used include Adobe Flex, PHP, Java, Hibernate, MySQL, HPâ€™s Quality Center, Microsoftâ€™s WCAP and Rally.  
â—  
Implemented a software framework with Restful API based middleware platform to to scale database and application features with backend using Java and Hibernate with MySQL.  
â—  
Reengineered the application framework to provide rich front-end UI capabilities using Adobe Flex.  
â—  
Responsible for re-architecting the database backend to support tremendous growth in the number of clients and datasets we have seen. Clients grew from 80 to 600 with data growing from few hundreds of thousands to over a billion per day.  
â—  
Worked with offshore vendors to build multiple development teams with a core team onsite to support vision, quality and operations.  
â—  
Implemented an Organization wide Reporting Distribution to help the business users get customersâ€™ data at their fingertips, using OpenSource JasperSoft, MySQL and PHP.  
Trust Benefits Online (now International Concepts Inc) in Emeryville, CA (Novâ€™03 \- Sepâ€™05)  
â—  
TrustBenefits offers web-based benefits administration solutions meeting the ever evolving needs of Trust Funds, Employers, Administrators, and Plan Participants. TrustBenefits is a spinoff from Associated Third Party Administrators, a veteran company that provides administrative services to various multi-employer trust funds.  
â—  
Engineered a SaaS based framework to build an online Participant Tool in providing end-users access to their trust fund information. Mentored the original team from ATPA in the new generation of technologies.  
â—  
Re-engineered the original engine that is coded in oracle and oracle forms and built an multi-layer API to take advantage of building multiple products based on the same core database design. Thus helping save years of labor spent in generating the core engine that managed and performed the many complex calculations involving oneâ€™s retirement and other benefits.  
â—  
Built an in-house build-system for preparing the clients, trust funds and building a new release of the code into SaaS farm. Designed and implemented template-based content that non-technical folks can manage and deploy the content into ATG Dynamoâ€™s content repositories which are in turn used by the application at the run-time.  
â—  
The technology stack is based on both commercial and open-source tools that include: ATG Dynamo for Java Application Server, Sunâ€™s Web Servers (Netscape, iplanet), Solaris and Oracle for backend, Perl based home grown build and content preparation system based.  
â—  
Configured and Administered ATG Dynamo Clusters, Monitoring and Performance Tuning.  
Educational Background  
Master of Science in Computer Science  
University of Southwestern Louisiana, Lafayette

Master of Technology in AI and Robotics  
University of Hyderabad, Hyderabad India

Bachelor of Engineering in Electronics and Communications Engg.   
Osmania University, Hyderabad, India

documents.title: Srinivas Bolisetty: Technology Leader
documents.content:
# SriBolisetty-17

Srinivas Bolisetty, M.S., M.Tech .  
Technologist | Innovator | Strategist | Informatics Leader  
â˜ (214)-901-8452 SrinivasB@gmail.com  
Highly analytical, results-driven, established technologist equipped with strong business acumen, innovative mindset, and 15+ years of documented success. # SriBolisetty-19

Date Hiring Manager Name (If Applicable) Title/Role Bristol-Myers Squibb Princeton, NJ Position: Technical Solution Domain Architect, IT Enterprise Architecture Dear Mr. / Ms. Hiring Manager Name (To whom it may concern): As a forward-thinking, innovative, established software technologist and informatics leader equipped with over 15 years of documented success within the multibillion-dollar biopharmaceutical industry, I can offer \[organization\] the following:  
â€¢  
Extensive experience in critical roles for recognized organizations, including Executive Director of Technology (Parker Institute for Cancer Immunotherapy), Director of Research Informatics and Applications (City of Hope National Medical Center), and Program Manager (Elan Pharmaceuticals).  
â€¢  
Deep knowledge and technical understanding of processes, platforms, and technologies and ability to quickly grasp strategies, drivers, priorities, and challenges to continually meet and exceed business goals.  
â€¢  
Ability to effectively and accurately manage multimillion-dollar budgets and align talent to maximize productivity and streamline workflows, allowing for decrease in costs.  
â€¢  
Proficient across a wide range of systems and cloud providers, including AWS, Azure, and Salesforce. Successfully led a client in early adoption of AWS, employing expertise and driving innovation.  
â€¢  
Domain areas experience, spanning R\&D, Commercial, Manufacturing, and Business Operations and track record of managing technology framework, data security, and operations, surrounding clinical trials.  
â€¢  
Dedication to personal and professional development through ongoing training and continuing education initiatives, including completion of dual masterâ€™s degrees (MS in Computer Science / MTECH in AI and Robotics).  
Additionally, I possess an entrepreneurial spirit, strong emotional intelligence, and ability to rapidly solve problems within fast-paced, ambiguous environments. I am eager to exit my current sabbatical to achieve a critical role where I can employ my background, skill set, and a passion for excellence that will add immediate value to your organization. Thank you for your time and consideration. I look forward to meeting to discuss my qualifications further. Sincerely, Srinivas Bolisetty  
S R I N I V A S B O L I S E T T Y , M.S., M.TECH  
TECHNOLOGY EXECUTIVE | INFORMATICS LEADER | INNOVATOR | STRATEGIST  
PHONE: 214-901-8452 | EMAIL: SrinivasB@gmail.com | LINKEDIN

He emphasizes his ability to manage multimillion-dollar budgets and streamline workflows while driving technological advancements.
