documents.title: Technology Strategist and Software Engineer
documents.content:
# SriBolisetty-24

Little Rock, AR 72211 (501) 258-6415  
Dear Sir/Madam:  
I specialize in developing and implementing high impact technological strategies that provide positive impact to the growth and profitability of companies. In addition to possessing strong knowledge in sound business practices, I offer proficiency in the analysis, architecture, design, and development of software applications.  
With over 10 years experience of sound technical expertise and double-Masters in Computers and leadership capabilities, I am confident that I would be a strong contributor to your company.  
I love to learn, adopt technology for the business process and create order from chaotic business environment. Having worked with numerous technologies (client-server, system integration, web-based applications) and programming languages (C/C++, C\#, Perl/PHP/ASP, Java/J2EE, .NET) and methodologies (n-tier, middle-ware, XML) and middleware (MQ-Series) and relational databases (Oracle, Sybase, MySQL, Informix and Ingres) and web-technologies (Apache, IIS, Application servers like Dynamo-WebLogic-WebSphere), I can quite confidently say I am a software engineer at heart and a best one at that.  
I am sure every company wishes there be at least one all-rounder in their payroll that can take any technical challenge and make it look like a child's play. I have been there and done that many times now. With an easy going personality that is combined with the experience of participating in software development teams of varying in sizes (from 2 to 22 developers) I can fit in any team and any complex project that you may have. With an insatiable appetite for understanding and creating/bettering business applications with relentless pursuit for quality I am sure I can be a valuable asset to your organization.  
I have enclosed a copy of my resume, which will provide you with a good overview of my skill set providing you with a level of confidence in my abilities.  
Thank you and I look forward to talking with you soon regarding new opportunities within your company.  
Sincerely,

â€¢  
Used Mercury Load Runner to create test-scripts for evaluating and testing performance of the products. The results from these tests are used in creating complete tests for production installations and scaling of customer sites.  
Trust Benefits Online, Oakland, CA, USA April 2000ï¿½October 2000 Application Architect  
Brought in as high-tech consultant assisting TBOL create their next generation Internet based solution for 401K/Trust-Fund management that would be serviced thru ASP (application service provider) framework. TBOL is a startup company spun-off by ATPA (Associated Third Party Administrators) with over forty years of experience and expertise in employee benefits administration.  
Technology  
â€¢  
OS: Solaris, Windows-98/NT.  
â€¢  
Database: Oracle 8i  
â€¢  
Programming Languages: Java, Perl  
â€¢  
Application Servers: Oracle Application Server, ATG Dynamo Application Server, Dynamo Personalization Server  
â€¢  
Tools: Visual Sourcesafe, SCCS, XML, in-house built Content Management System, OptimizeIt  
Product Development  
â€¢  
Successfully designed and implemented an application framework architecture for Trust Benefits Online that is highly configurable and scaleable. This framework is used for developing software applications and helped build various products and services such as Participant Information, Third Party Administration, Employer tools, etc. for managing Employee Benefit Plans for Trust Funds and Unions.  
â€¢  
Implemented the framework so TBOL could implement products in an application service provider type of setting providing services to their clients, third party administrators, and participants online to view and manage their trust fund and benefit information.  
â€¢  
Automation of content delivery process from general administrators to production environment. Additionally, a content management system was designed and implemented based on XML-Repositories in Dynamo application server. This repository assisted TBOL in implementing an end-to-end process for gathering content from various sources while the system had a unified look of entire data source as XML.  
â€¢  
Developed an Oracle Application Server-based prototype for Employee Benefit Information product using OAS 8, Java Cartridges, and stored procedures.  
â€¢  
Designed and implemented all applications in multi-level modular architecture on Dynamo application server product suite separating business logic and data access layers from presentation.  
â€¢  
Mentored team of developers, educating them in Java, Dynamo, and web and application server aspects and coordinated in setting up a complete software development environment from implementing coding standards, writing build scripts (on Windows and Solaris), setting up different server environments, creating procedures for testing (written few automated test scripts), and provided support in post production deployment.  
â€¢  
Established source codes management system initially in SCCS on Solaris and then migrated to Visual SourceSafe system. Implemented software build scripts for both SCCS and VSS platforms in Perl.  
Caresoft Inc., Sunnyvale, CA, USA June 1999ï¿½April 2000 Principal Software Engineer  
Brought in to help Caresoft design and develop web applications to take them to the next generation of web-based services and compete them with the likes of WebMD and DrKoop. Professionally influenced quality of applications and n-tier architecture of the system being one of the key contributors of the Engineering Team.  
Technology  
â€¢  
OS: Solaris, Windows-NT.  
â€¢  
Database: Oracle 8, MS-Access, Excel  
â€¢  
Programming Languages: Java, Perl  
â€¢  
Application Servers: ATG Dynamo Application Server, Dynamo Personalization Server  
â€¢  
Security/Middleware: IBM MQ-Series, Entrust digital security  
â€¢  
Tools: Visual Sourcesafe, XML, XSD/XSL, J-Builder, Visual Cafï¿½, Open content adapter  
Product Development  
â€¢  
Successfully managed the development and implementation of the companyï¿½s flagship product, ï¿½Lab Results Onlineï¿½. This project provided visitors access their lab-test results and analysis online.  
â€¢  
Successfully integrated Caresoftï¿½s backend systems with partnerï¿½s backend with IBM MQ-Series and ATG Dynamo Application Server.  
â€¢  
Design and development of on-the-fly survey/questionnaire system that helped the business team to create and post online with out any intervention from Engineering Team.  
â€¢  
Successfully implemented MQ-Series middleware between Caresoft and its business partner Quest Diagnostics.  
â€¢  
Implemented a content delivery architecture, which combines content from different sources into single framework using Dynamo application server and thereby providing a unified content delivery mechanism that can be used along with a built-in Rules Engine to provide context based content delivery. This process was setup to allow any content to be deployed without having to restart Dynamo itself.  
â€¢  
Worked with domain experts and business analysts for the Lab Results project architecture from front-end details, backend MQ-Series transactions, and delivery of results, profiling, and reporting results. This service is a first-of-its-kind at that time, eventually copied by WebMD.  
â€¢  
Successful implementation of n-tier architecture separating front-end design from the data access and multi-layer abstraction of backend through separation of application logic layer, business logic, and data-access layer.  
â€¢  
Integrated Entrustï¿½s digital encryption/certification technology into n-tier architecture and MQ-Series product.  
â€¢  
Unified content delivery through integration of OpenText content management system with Dynamoï¿½s OCA (Open Content Adapter).  
â€¢  
Worked in the role of MQ Series administrator setting up Queues, Q-Managers, channels, drawing process flows, error-handling, auto-reconciliation of Queue messages, working with IBMï¿½s client services team, setting up debug levels, logs, monitoring, and debugging the log messages.  
â€¢  
Took initiative in implementing coding standards and documenting the sub-system process deliverables to help manage systems better.  
First Union National Bank, Charlotte, NC, USA November 1998ï¿½June 1999 Information Architect  
Primarily involved in re-engineering effort of an existing record-keeping system. Provided leadership as a senior member of the team, while supporting multiple projects simultaneously.  
Product Development  
â€¢  
Involved in the re-engineering of existing DOS-based record-keeping system by redesigning the application architecture as a means of taking advantage of new Sybase-based system.  
â€¢  
Completed process analysis of existing system and documented required changes.  
â€¢  
Successfully coordinated an application design for new modules needing to be built in new Sybase-based record-keeping system. Applications are based on multi-layer architecture with Visual Basic/Active-X front-end, Java-Object layer for business logic, JDBC/stored-procedure for database access from Sybase.  
â€¢  
Responsible for leading a team in design and development of Internet-based applications, such as Internet Inquiry application and Internet-based Transactions application.  
â€¢  
Participated in initial requirements gathering, analysis, and decision making of a new Internet-based system for providing Participant Advice for 401K/retirement-fund participants.  
Broadway & Seymour, Inc., Charlotte, NC, USA November 1994ï¿½November 1998 Sr. Software Engineer  
Over a period of four years moved between Product and Systems Integration teams, providing strong synergy between product design and implementation. Worked in four full releases of the companyï¿½s flagship CRM product called TouchPoint? in gaining solid understanding of product development. Worked with many projects gathering business requirements, participating in brainstorming sessions to obtain critical expertise needed to analyze business process flow and converting them to technical specs, then developing the systems software.  
Product Development  
â€¢  
Participated in the design and development of TouchPoint?, a CRM product, providing 3-tier client/server architecture solution for banking industry primarily focusing in the area of customer service and relations operations, based on Tuxedo, Visual C++/SmallTalk and C++.  
â€¢  
Successfully deployed the product to multiple platforms including IBM-AIX, HP-UX and SUN/Solaris using modular design and with the help of products like RogueWave DBTools, MQ-Series and Tuxedo.  
â€¢  
Participated in design and development of Internet Banking (pilot project) product providing a comprehensive interface to customer accounts through Internet. System deployed on IIS 4.0 using HTML/ASP/JavaScript and Java/COM interface with TouchPoint? providing backend support.  
â€¢  
Provided support in design and prototyping of Touch Point? architecture for providing 3-tier Client/Server architecture solution for banking industry primarily in area of Customer Service and Relations operations, based on Tuxedo, SmallTalk, C++.  
â€¢  
Completed systems integration project for JP Morgan deploying TouchPoint? product. Responsible for customizing and developing backend transactions as well as analyzing and configuring TouchPoint? server setup and processes.  
â€¢  
Successfully developed and implemented Credit Card Fraud Detection System (AEGIS system) for FDC, using Tuxedo, C++, and Oracle on HP-UX platform. Involved in the performance analysis of our MQ-based middleware system, on HP UX, and wrote a test plan/program that measured the performance bottlenecks with in the architecture, which eventually led to an improved over-all performance of the system.  
â€¢  
Designed Credit Card Processing System for FDC, based on 3-tier Client/Server architecture, using Tuxedo, C++ and Visual C++. In the next phase of this project, provided online processing of credit card applications using the same backend.  
â€¢  
Integrated and implemented TouchPoint? transactions with MQ-Series backend with MQI API.  
â€¢  
Completed development of Common Workflow solution using C++ and InConcert product from Xerox Corporation. This product is developed to stand independently and hook-up into TouchPoint? product suite as a module.  
â€¢  
Involved in development of IMAP (Imaging Application), an automated credit card application processing system using C++, Sybase, and Xview on Sun-Solaris platform.  
â€¢  
Worked with Release Engineering team in setting up numerous scripts and debugging to automate build process using products like Purify, Quantify and CodeWizard products.  
â€¢  
Coordinated software build process efforts with ï¿½makeï¿½, ï¿½iMakeï¿½, ï¿½shï¿½ and ï¿½makedependï¿½ tools.  
â€¢  
Wrote Perl-based scripts to include automation of some black box testing processes.  
â€¢  
Developed a web interface tool for Tuxedo and Sybase Database automating every day activities for software developers, thus saving valuable times.  
International Imaging Systems, Milpitas, CA, USA January 1994ï¿½November 1994 Application Developer-II  
Application developer participating in activities of satellite image processing. As a Certified Ingres Database Administrator, managed the database instances.  
Product  
â€¢  
Involved in development of satellite ground station control software, which analyzes and processes raw satellite image data collected.  
â€¢  
Designed and implemented satellite image decoding algorithms and raw-data processing. Worked with ï¿½level 0ï¿½ to ï¿½level 1ï¿½ processing and then ï¿½level 1ï¿½ to ï¿½pre-level 2ï¿½ image processing.  
â€¢  
Provided installation, configuration, and tuning support of database instances.  
Daisy Systems, Hyderabad, AP, India December 1990ï¿½December 1991 Software Engineer  
Product  
â€¢  
Setup computer center.  
â€¢  
Developed software applications in DBase-III and Oracle.  
Technology Details  
â€¢  
Operating Systems: Windows 2000/Me/98, Windows NT, SUN Solaris 5.6, 5.7, 5.8, IBM AIX, HP-UX, Sun OS, SGI-IRIX, Linux Redhat, Cobalt Linux  
â€¢  
Developer Tools: Textpad, Visual SourceSafe, MS Office, Visio, SCCS, JDK, J-Builder, Semantic VisualCafï¿½, Visual Interdev, IIS, IBMï¿½s VisualAge for Java, Lotus Notes, Visual Studio 6.0, IIS4.0, PVCS Tracker/source-control.  
â€¢  
Unix Tools: Make, iMake, sccs/rcs, sh, makedepend, shar, tar, X/Motif, UUCP, Sendmail, MS Office-97, Visual Interdev, PVCS Issue Tracker, VSS  
â€¢  
Languages: Java, Perl, HTML, JavaScript, XML, MS-Access, Visual Basic/ActiveX, C, C/C++, PHP, CGI, ASP, VBScript, Lisp, Prolog  
â€¢  
Databases: Oracle 8i, Sysbase, Informix, Ingres, MySQL RDBMS  
â€¢  
Web Server: Netscape Enterprise Server/iPlanet Web Server and Apache 1.3.x with Mod\_Perl and PHP, IIS  
â€¢  
Application Servers: Oracle Application Server, Dynamo Application Server (DAS, DPS), WebSphere 2.x/3.0, WebLogic  
â€¢  
HTML/Image Tools: Dreamweaver, Adobe Photoshopm Frontpage, Paintshop Pro, Flash  
â€¢  
Middleware/Content Management Tools: IBM MQ-Series 2x and 5.x, Candle Command Center for MQ and OpenText, Tuxedo, Cobra, Tibco  
â€¢  
Productivity Tools: Purify, Quantify, Test Center, Code Wizard, Insure++, Mercury Load Runner, WCAT and URL Hammer, ERWin, DeZign  
â€¢  
Software Methodologies: Rational Rose, Multi-layer architectures, Object oriented design  
Education  
MS (Computer Science) \- University of Southwestern Louisiana, Lafayette, USA ï¿½ Dec ï¿½93 M.Tech. (Artificial Intelligence & Robotics) \- University of Hyderabad, India ï¿½ Dec ï¿½90 B.E. (Electronic & Comm. Engg.) ï¿½ Osmania University, India ï¿½ May ï¿½89
documents.summary: This document outlines the professional background and achievements of Sri Bolisetty, a seasoned software developer with over 10 years of experience in various technologies and business areas, emphasizing leadership, mentoring, and significant contributions to product development and system integration. It details roles held at multiple companies, showcasing technical and marketing accomplishments in software architecture and application development.

documents.title: Senior Software Engineer Profile
documents.content:
# SriBolisetty-26

SENIOR SOFTWARE DEVELOPMENT ENGINEER With 10 Years of Experience and a Track Record of Success Delivering Technology Solutions  
CAREER PROFILE  
Results-driven software engineer at heart with broad-based business and technical expertise which have been used to transform corporate vision and strategy into profitable reality. A proven track record in planning, building, and launching successful commercial products. Keen, in-depth understanding of technologies and trends and a solid background in all core areas \- software development life cycle, requirements gathering, design specifications, code development and management, release engineering, packaging and deployment. Exceptional technical and management skills; relates and interfaces easily at the top executive levels.  
AREAS OF EXPERTISE  
Software Engineering & Lifecycle Management Team Building & Leadership JAD Sessions & Requirements Analysis Application Architecture Database Design & Analysis Release Engineering Quality Assurance & Process Improvement Operations and Code Deloyment  
ACHIEVEMENT HIGHLIGHTS  
Engaged a small group of engineers in spear-heading the development of a framework called Smartkit for deploying many Internet based applications for Hindunet Inc., San Diego. Developed on LAMP platform. Engineered a Java/ATG-Dynamo based next generation 401K/Trust-fund management system for Trust Benefits Online (TBOL). The system is designed to provide the services in ASP (Application Service Provider) environment with an eye for scalability and flexibility in deploying new service offerings with Oracle 8i backend. TBOL is a startup spun-off by Associated Third Party Administrators with over 40 years of experience and expertise in employee benefits administration. Designed, developed and managed an online Laboratory Results application, a flagship product, for Caresoft Inc., Sunnyvale, providing transactional architecture with highest level of security and auditability. The system is based on ATG-Dynamo application server with IBM MQ-Series backend and integrated with Entrust Digital Certificates. Designed, developed and managed TheDailyApple.com website architecture, application framework and development, build and deployment process. The system is integrated with OpenText Content Management System providing unique content delivery with Dynamo's open content adaptor technology and Oracle 8 backend. Coordinated a group of developers in redesigning and re-architecting the next generation n-tier Record Keeping System based on Sybase backend, IBM MQ-Series & Websphere based middleware and VB/Active-X based front-end for First Union National Bank. The system is designed to be modularized to integrate with many of the existing and future bank needs and keeping in mind the changes in the technology forefront, thus providing the ability to control/manage/replace out-dated technology with upcoming technological solutions. Contributed as a Sr. Software Engineer in the design and development of TouchPoint, a CRM Product, providing 3-tier Client/Server architecture for mid-tier banking industry primarily focusing in the areas of Customer Services, Teller Operations and Backend operations. This system utilized the Tuxedo Transaction Manager, IBM MQ-Series and based on highly object-oriented C++ code libraries and ported to multiple operating systems including HP-UX, IBM-AIX and SUN-Solaris. EDUCATION & CREDENTIALS  
Master of Science in Computer Science \- '93 University of Southwestern Louisiana, Lafayette  
Master of Technology in Artificial Intelligence & Robotics \- '91 University of Hyderabad, Hyderabad  
Bachelor of Engineering in Electronics and Communications Engineering \- '89 Osmania University, Hyderabad  
PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE  
June 1999- Present High-Tech Consultant  
Key Contracts:  
Hired as a high-tech consultant for Caresoft Inc., Sunnyvale. Responsible for Product Development and evolution of the Technical Architecture. Contributed from design, coding, testing to deployment and operational analysis. Hired as Consulting Architect by Trust Benefits Online to design and develop their next generation internet based framework. The successful deployment of this application made TBOL receive VC funding and take-off from under the parent company. Contributions include design, development and mentoring the team. Hired as a high-tech consultant for Hindunet Inc., San Diego. Responsible for engineering the product offering providing a framework for multiple applications on a stingy/shoe-string like budget. Working off of LAMP platform, mentored a team of engineers and trained and inspired them to take up a task of utter difficulty into a genuine reality. Hired as a Sr. Technical Consultant for ProtechSoft, Little Rock. Served as a technical lead in product development and marketing departments. Responsible for product design, product research, process analysis, technical assessment and opportunity auditing. 1998-1999 Information Architect, First Union National Bank  
Led a team of developers in re-engineering of an old DOS-based record keeping system with n-tier architecture. Participated in initial requirements gathering, analysis, and decision making of a new Internet-based system for providing Participant Advice for 401K/retirement-fund participants.  
1994-1998 Sr. Software Engineer, Broadway & Seymour Inc.  
Key contributor of TouchPoint product participating in multiple software development life cycles of the product. Contributions include conceptualization, design and development, coding backend-transactions for the product, writing and automation of system testing, performance analysis.  
Successfully deployed TouchPoint product for multiple clients, including JP Morgan and Dime Bank.  
Responsible for leading SI (Systems Integration) engagements for multiple FDC (First Data Corp) projects, including Customer Service application \- AEGIS: The credit card fraud detection system.  
Sr. Designer and developer for the design of products, including Workflow application based on Xerox's InConcert API and Internet Banking product based on TouchPoint.  
Successfully deployed the IMAP application for Chase Manhattan Bank for automated processing of Credit card applications.  
SOFTWARE DEVELOPMENT and PLATFORM EXPERTISE  
Years Used Knowledge Level C/C++ 9 Expert Middleware \- MQ Series/Tuxedo 5 Expert Unix/Linux: Solaris, HP-UX, AIX, Cobalt, RedHat 12 Expert Web Servers (NES, Apache)/Application Servers (ATG Dynamo, IIS, Weblogic, Tomcat) 6 Expert Linux/Apace/MySQL/Perl-PHP 6 Expert Microsoft Visual Interdev/Studio 3 Highly Competence Java/J2EE 5 Highly Competence Database Design 4 Highly Competent RDBMS: SQL Server/Oracle/MySQL/Sybase 10 Highly Competent Debugger Tools: dbx, gdb, Purify, Quantify, CodeWizard, OptimizeIt 5 Highly Competent Release Engineering: make, imake, makedepend, PVCS, Visual SourceSafe 5 Highly Competent Rational Unified Process 2 Competent Windows '98/2000/2003 5 Competent Microsoft .NET 1 Competent  
SRINIVAS BOLISETTY Page 3
documents.summary: Experienced software development engineer with a decade of expertise in delivering technology solutions, specializing in software lifecycle management, application architecture, and team leadership. Proven success in developing and launching commercial products across various industries.

documents.title: Technology Executive Profile Summary
documents.content:
# SriBolisetty-3

E X E C U T I V E S U M M A R Y  
Highly analytical, results-driven, established global technology leader equipped with strong business acumen, innovative mindset, and 15+ years of documented success within the multibillion-dollar biopharmaceutical industry and academic cancer center. Expert in architecture, technologies, databases, business processes and improvements, and automation and in-depth understanding of core business functions and digital capabilities. Recognized for building, mentoring, and motivating diverse and distributed teams in building and maintaining complex software platforms for clinical translational research and healthcare initiatives. Extensive experience across a diverse set of systems and cloud providers, including AWS, Azure, and Salesforce and broad technical domains, spanning security, infrastructure, network, and data. Adept at effectively balancing strategic and tactical needs while fostering inclusive, performance-centric cultures within cutting-edge, multifaceted technology environments.  
P R O F E S S I O N A L E X P E R I E N C E  
P A R K E R I N S T I T U T E F O R C A N C E R I M M U N O T H E R A P Y 2 0 1 7 \- 2 0 1 9  
E x e c u t i v e D i r e c t o r o f T e c h n o l o g y  
Served in a critical leadership role for the leading San Francisco-based startup, specializing in funding clinical trials for cutting-edge immunotherapy treatments. Held full accountability for system and data architecture, managing the technology framework, development, data security, and operations of systems responsible for clinical trials, bioinformatics data pipelines, and research data analysis. Oversaw data security and architecture across IT and clinical systems, as well as establishing SOPs, conducting data reviews, setting up data agreements, and performing security analysis and prevention activities. Worked in collaboration with the VP of Informatics to develop and execute comprehensive technology strategies, ensuring streamlined, effective, and cost-effective workflows.  
â€¢  
Effectively managed a $2M annual IT budget, ensuring high levels of accuracy and accountability.  
â€¢  
Re-focused a 10-person development team to adopt better agile practices in delivering products and frameworks,  
concentrating on quality and deliverability.  
â€¢  
Established off-the-shelf clinical systems to deploy Phase 1A and 1B trials, resulting in extension to phase 2\.  
â€¢  
Extended vendor partnerships to support more complex microbiome and platform trials.  
â€¢  
Implemented Veeva Vault for quality and eTMF, paving the way for later expansion to other clinical offerings.  
â€¢  
Identified and selected a vendor through RFC process, trial onboarding, and vendor management for study form  
development and deployment.  
â€¢  
Implemented Salesforce CRM in record time (\< 3 months), allowing multiple teams to collaborate efficiently.  
â€¢  
Selected and implemented a Tableau-based reporting infrastructure to integrate databases and unify reports and  
dashboards across the enterprise and clinical studies.  
C I T Y O F H O P E N A T I O N A L M E D I C A L C E N T E R 2 0 1 1 \- 2 0 1 7  
D i r e c t o r o f R e s e a r c h I n f o r m a t i c s A p p l i c a t i o n s  
Selected to oversee and manage 19 informatics professionals and multidisciplinary teams in developing and executing the department strategy. Fully accountable for a $3.5M budget and large portfolio, including research informatics platforms and applications, including, clinical trials data analysis and automation, decision support, adverse event monitoring and reporting, SQA, disease registries, clinical pathology variant analysis, genomic sequencing, cloud platform, data architecture and security, virtualization, and innovation.  
S R I N I V A S B O L I S E T T Y , M.S., M.TECH  
TECHNOLOGY EXECUTIVE | INFORMATICS LEADER | INNOVATOR | STRATEGIST  
PHONE: 214-901-8452 | EMAIL: SrinivasB@gmail.com | LINKEDIN  
Technology Strategy  Clinical Systems & Software Development  Technical Project Management  Continuous Improvement  
Business Operations  SDLC & Agile Techniques  Process Development  Research & Data Analysis  Vendor Management  
Client Relationship Management  Team Leadership & Development  Executive Engagement  Communications  
SRINIVAS BOLISETTY I PAGE 2 OF 2  
â€¢  
*Re-aligned teams and developed streamlined processes, resulting in an increase in productivity with 30% less budget, $5M to $3.5M within two years.*  
â€¢  
*Envisioned and led the development of Software Platform for Integrated Research Information and Transformation (SPIRIT), achieving significant cost reduction, decrease in operational overhead, and increased quality.*  
â€¢  
*Streamlined software development, improved processes, and adopted Agile methodologies, reducing the team from 40 to 20, resulting in decreased efforts for enhanced results.*  
E L A N P H A R M A C E U T I C A L S 2 0 0 9 \- 2 0 1 1  
P r o g r a m M a n a g e r  
Directed cross-functional teams of 15+ in supporting multiple research informatics projects for the global biotechnology company. Spearheaded various strategic and operational initiatives, including budgeting, planning, hardware evaluation and procurement, vendor selection, platform implementation, offshore team development, and architectural decision-making. Cultivated and maintained productive relationships with multiple overseas vendors, specializing in systems development and deployment.  
â€¢  
*Conceived and directed the implementation of RISe (Research Informatics System at elan), a cutting-edge integrated preclinical informatics platform for chemistry, biology, and preclinical safety labs. Patent\# 20130013623 (2013). Directly supported multiple research groups, spanning plasmids, antibodies, and compound tracking.*  
â€¢  
*Managed a portfolio, including agile development methodology and continuous development of an integrated RI platform for building research applications for use with Lab Notebook, Labware, and Symyx. Initiative allowed for use of single software platform that resulted in significant cost reduction and enhanced functionality.*  
â€¢  
*Implemented an electronic lab notebook system for Researchers, including migrating data and workflows and eliminating unwieldy systems interface for lab users.*  
H A B E A S ( R E T U R N P A T H ) 2 0 0 6 \- 2 0 0 9  
D i r e c t o r o f E n g i n e e r i n g  
Provided oversight and direction to a diverse global team of 25 resources and held full accountability for a $1M budget for the largest email deliverability service provider. Developed, re-engineered, and maintained complex systems that handled rapid growth and scalability and partnered with global vendors to source and employ cutting-edge capabilities aligned with company needs. Mentored, coached, and directed multiple organizations in the areas of software development, product building, and operational efficiencies, ensuring continual achievement of goals and objectives.  
â€¢  
Strategically aligned with a global partner, reducing costs by 40% ($1M to \~$600K) and increasing productivity by 35%+.  
â€¢  
Re-engineered systems to support sales growth from 100 clients to 800+, including developing an analytical reporting  
framework that provided insights into customer data, segmentation, concentration, and focus areas for marketing and sales.  
â€¢  
Spearheaded the early adoption of Amazon AWS and assisted a Bay Area startup with quickly launching their product on  
iOS platform.  
â€¢  
Successfully founded and obtained VC funding for an internet portal company.  
T R U S T B E N E F I T S O N L I N E 2 0 0 3 \- 2 0 0 6  
D i r e c t o r o f P r o d u c t D e v e l o p m e n t  
Mentored and managed a team of 9 software professionals and business analysts in supporting the design and development of product development framework. Partnered with Business Teams, Trust Fund Managers, Business Analysts, and Technology Partners to drive innovation and move forward the business and technology strategy.  
â€¢  
*Supported a traditional mainframe-based parent company spin-off an internet-based, self-service oriented technology company (TBOL).*  
â€¢  
Led the complete design and architecture of a SaaS product, delivering on-time and within budget.  
E D U C A T I O N  
*Master of Science (MS), Computer Science, University of Southwestern Louisiana, Lafayette Master of Technology (MTECH), AI & Robotics, University of Hyderabad, Hyderabad, India Bachelor of Engineering (BE), Electronics & Communications Engineering, Osmania University, Hyderabad India*
documents.summary: This document outlines the professional background of Srinivas Bolisetty, a seasoned technology leader with over 15 years of experience in the biopharmaceutical industry, highlighting his expertise in informatics, software development, and team management across various organizations. # SriBolisetty-30

Srinivas Bolisetty (Sri) Experienced Software Development Manager and Director  
661-927-7254(M) SrinivasB@Shalusri.com I am currently looking for project management opportunities in the areas of software applications and product development.  
Overview With an overall 17 Years of software development experience and leadership include more than 10 years in Project Management and team building. Dependable leader in creating and managing software development among many areas including Financial, Credit Cards, 401K, Trust Funds, Health care, Pharmaceutical and Email industries. Hands on project manager with extensive experience in managing a large portfolio. Efficiently managed products from inception thru implementation and deployment, while transforming organizations and individual teams from ad-hoc processes to well known agile development. Always keeps a keen focus on business goals while bringing disparate teams together. Participates with cross-functional team exercises to better understand overall goals and stimulate the teams to strive for success of the entire company.  
Experience  
â€¢  
Ã‰lan Pharmaceuticals, South San Francisco, CA â€“ RISe Program Manager Feb 2009 â€” June 2011 Ã‰lan Pharmaceuticals is a multi-billion dollar neuroscience-based biotechnology company that is focused on discovering, developing, manufacturing and marketing advanced therapies in neurology, autoimmune diseases, and severe pain. I am responsible for managing all RI projects using Agile Methodology, provide strategic architectural roadmap for technology, manage supporting information technology platforms for scientists and analysts, offshore vendor relationship management, interact with end-users, scientists and scientific community gathering requirements, user workflows, prioritization of features, system design and development. I am also responsible for the technology oversight, hardware planning and acquisition, hands on architecture and product solution reviews, Test Case documentation and planning, QA preparation and testing. During my tenure at elan, I have implemented RISe \- Research Informatics System at elan \- platform for Research. RISe is a biological and chemical entity registration, workflow management and inventory management system. I have managed the implementation of protein, antibody, plasmid and chemical reagent management systems. I was also responsible for implementation of vendor provided chemistry solutions in RISe, including Compound Registration system, SAR system and E-Notebook from leading vendor Symyx/Accelrys.  
SrinivasB@Shalusri.com Sri â˜ 661-927-7254  
During RISe implementation I have provided a lead role in budgeting, planning, hardware evaluation and acquisition, vendor selection, off-shore team selection and mentoring, integration of offshore and on-site teams, leading the architecture discussions, selecting the technology stack, overseeing implementation and ensuring the delivery of completed product in phases. As proof of concept, the sample applications were built on the frameworks using Java/ J2EE stack as well as .NET/Sharepoint stack. Lead the architecture team to review the stacks, business needs and decided to go with the final framework that is based on .NET/Sharepoint based SOA framework. This framework is designed to integrate existing enterprise solutions as well as to support future business applications.  
Utilized many tools including: VersionOne for agile project management, Cruise Control for daily builds, Hibernate and ADO.NET for ORM and database connectivity, entity-attributed based database as well as relational database for data flexibility, N-Unit for unit testing, TeamDefine for scenario and use case building, CaliberRM for requirements management, Bugzilla for bug-tracking, TOAD for Database design and management.  
â€¢  
Habeas Inc., Mountain View, CA â€“ Director of Engineering March 2006 â€” January 2009 Habeas provides comprehensive, email reputation management and delivery services enhancing the performance and certainty of email operations and improves the reliability, safety and financial performance of email marketing campaigns. Habeas is acquired by ReturnPath in August 2008\. Managed multiple engineering teams across multiple locations, onshore and offshore, while successfully transforming a project life cycle with 6 month turnaround with traditional development methodology into an Scrum based agile development teams delivering releases every month. Delivered release after release in-time on-budget improving the quality of the code, processes and product features. Both ad-hoc and BI reporting capabilities were developed using OpenSource tools such as Jasper and MySQL. The product and database were re-engineered in order to scale them to sustain growth rates. Owned the design and development of all layers of the application from UI to middle-tier (a RESTful Web Services layer) to Database design for new and upcoming features. Total number of clients grew from 175 to 600+ at the time of ReturnPathâ€™s acquisition. Hired, mentored and setup an offshore development team to help sustain the project load and helped integrate them with onshore development team.  
â€¢  
Trust Benefits Online, Emeryville CA â€“ Director of Product Development November 2003 â€” March 2006 Recently acquired by International Concepts Inc., TrustBenefits offers web-based benefits administration solutions meeting the ever evolving needs of Trust Funds, Employers, Administrators, and Plan Participants. TrustBenefits is a spinoff from Associated Third Party Administrators, a veteran company that provides administrative services to various multi-employer trust funds.  
SrinivasB@Shalusri.com Sri â˜ 661-927-7254  
Engineered a SaaS based framework after a couple of different approaches to build Participant Tool application online. Mentored the original team from ATPA in the new generation of technologies. Re-engineered the original engine that is coded in oracle and oracle forms and built an multi-layer API to take advantage of building multiple products. Thus helping save years of labor spent in generating the core engine that managed and performed the many complex calculations involving oneâ€™s retirement and other benefits. Managed several client deployments from acquisition thru staging thru production implementation by adopting various processes and automating them where necessary and possible.  
â€¢  
Hindunet Inc./GHEN Soft Inc., San Diego, CA April 2001 â€” September 2002 Hindunet/GHEN is a startup with roots in social community based websites and web-tools and vision for helping and building a community of portals together under a single banner. Helped successfully get funding for Hindunet as a social venture. Setup an offshore development center for building and supporting the tools, websites and client projects. Responsible for designing and development of the SmartKit framework using LAMP stack. SmartKit was able to successfully implement for many of the client projects with quick turn-around times. Managed several teams and projects comprising different projects.  
â€¢  
VeuhaSoft Inc., Santa Clara, CA August 2000 â€” April 2001  
VeuhaSoft was a startup with big ideas to bring better solutions to complex world of systems integration. Consulted with VeuhaSoft helping many of their clients with product design, architecture and implementation. The projects ranged from custom software development to utilizing well-known Application Servers like ATG Dynamo.  
â€¢  
Caresoft Inc., Sunnyvale, CA Engineering Manager  
July 1999 â€” August 2000 Caresoft was a pioneer in bringing personal health management tools online over the web (very common today, but not then) and revolutionized by brining Lab Test results online securely and privately. Managed several projects in a short-time with a quick-turn around, churning out multiple features, many releases a month. Employed extreme programming methodologyâ€™s paired-programming approach to sustain the development and product quality. Integrated with many data-sources and worked with many cross-functional teams to  
SrinivasB@Shalusri.com Sri â˜ 661-927-7254  
successfully develop and deploy TheDailyApple.com web site, one of its kind in those days, to help individuals manage their own personal health online. Successfully managed integration of personal lab-results, a HL7 compliant system, into the online tools privately and securely using IBM MQ Series, ATG Dynamo and Oracle with collaboration from Quest Diagnostics. Integrated OpenText CMS system into online tools thus providing a fully functional authoring system for authors, reviewers and editors to write and publish content online without having to get intervention from either Engineering or Operations.  
â€¢  
First Union National Bank, Charlotte, NC â€“ Information Architect November 1998 â€” July 1999 FirstUnion was 6th largest bank in US then and took many of the technically advance decisions like bringing online trading, fully automated banking systems, and managing traditional 401 and other retirement trust plans. FirstUnion was one of the first few banks to actually provide 401K fund information online for the users.  
Lead a team in re-engineering an old DOS based record keeping system into n-tier architecture. Participated in requirements gathering, analysis and decision making on new Internet based Participant Advice system for 401-K /Retirement-Fund participants.  
â€¢  
Broadway & Seymour, Charlotte, NC â€“ Software Engineer/Team Lead  
Jan 1994 â€” November 1998 Broadway & Seymour grew from a small time consulting company to products based company building one of kind CRM products for banking and credit card sectors. Currently part of Fidelity division, the flagship product, TouchPoint, is still being used at many banks including Bank of America. Key contributor and one of the original designers on TouchPoint product, known as the go-to guy for Tuxedo and MQ Series. Worked with many client implementations of TouchPoint as well as custom application development. Had a simple motto: Any technology, any client, any challenge  
Education

documents.title: Sri Bolisetty's Professional Overview
documents.content:
# SriBolisetty-34

Srinivas Bolisetty (Sri) M.S., M.Tech.  
Frisco,TX  
(214)-901-8452 â€‹SrinivasB@Gmail.com  
Technology Leadership, Mentoring, Software Architecture, Systems Architecture, Application Platforms, Management of Large Portfolio of Applications, Vendor Relationship, Diverse and distributed teams development, Innovation, Strategy and Process Improvement  
Performance Highlights  
Leadership  
â€¢  
Managed diverse groups of about 17 team members, responsible for all aspects of application analysis to development to operationalization to production support, with an yearly budget of $3.5 million at City of Hope National Medical Center (COH).  
â€¢  
Managed global team of about 10 members, responsible for product design and development, vendor management, user training at elan Pharmaceuticals.  
â€¢  
Managed global team of about 25 members, responsible for product development, Engineering and performance tuning, BI analysis and Data warehouse at Habeas.  
Innovation and Platforms  
â€¢  
Envisaged and led development of Software Platform for Integrated Research Information and Transformation (SPIRIT), for basic, clinical and translational informatics (COH)  
â€¢  
Conceived and directed implementation of RISe (Research Informatics System at elan) â€“ a cutting edge integrated pre-clinical informatics platform for chemistry, biology and preclinical safety labs; Patent: Shah, Ajay, et. al. System and Method for Managing Information of Biological Entities. Patent \# 20130013623, (2013)  
â€¢  
Redesigned and engineered a Reputation platform for Marketing Companies to statistically evaluate and analyze effectiveness of email campaigns that led to quick market adoption eventually leading the No.1 competitor in the space to acquire Habeas.  
Strategy and Process Improvements  
â€¢  
Re-engineered an non-existing SDLC process to adopt best practices, set up a Release Management cycle that rolled nicely into Enterprise ITIL process later on.  
â€¢  
Envisioned a 4-tier environment for software applications development to help improve the quality of enterprise software applications.  
â€¢  
Strategically planned adoption of cloud platforms within Research to help address the future needs in time as the demand arised.  
â€¢  
Strategic alignment of resources with a global partner reducing the overall costs by 40% ($1M to \~$600K), while more than doubling the total number of resources (1+6 to 1+ 14\) and increasing the productivity by 50% (number of product releases, features, reports).  
Entrepreneurship and Grants  
â€¢  
Founded and obtained venture capital for an internet portal  
â€¢  
Contributed architectural and technical solutions to multiple grant proposals. Wrote  
informatics components of grants as co-Investigator. Responsible for informatics portion of grant funded national data coordination center projects.  
â€¢  
Helped Habeas acquire multitude of clients by scaling out application architecture on demand before the PaaS and IaaS days.  
Professional Experience  
Director, Research Informatics Applications, City of National Medical Center, Duarte CA (Oct 2011 \- Present) Leadershipâ€‹: Managed and mentored a team of upto 19 informatics professionals, including multi-discipline teams with a budget of 2.5 million. Organizationalâ€‹:Re-focused the teams and processes to be efficient and effective at building research applications, innovative thinking and automating daily tasks. Portfolioâ€‹: Managed portfolio includes Research Systems, Research Applications, Clinical Trials Data Analysis and Automation, Decision Support, Adverse Event monitoring and reporting, SQA, Disease Registries, Clinical Pathology Variant Analysis, Genomic Sequencing, Cloud Platform, Virtualization and Innovation. Process Improvementsâ€‹: Design and development of a software platform called SPIRIT, Implementation and automation of SDLC, Vendor and Software license management, Continuous Technology Training. Partnershipsâ€‹: Partnering with IT teams, PIâ€™s, Researchers, Physicians and Clinicians Innovationâ€‹: Encouraging, Advising, brainstorming, supporting whichever way needed to build applications, POCâ€™s in areas of Machine Learning, Process Pipelining, Cloud Computing, NLP, Cohort Discovery, Technology Adaption. Trainingâ€‹: Thru the use of Community of Practice, Innovation sessions and Online self-directed CBTs, Individualized course curriculums \- kept the teams abreast of technology, and be more productive and efficient. Program Manager, elan Pharmaceuticals, South San Francisco CA (Feb 2009 \- Jun 2011\) Leadershipâ€‹: Managed blended teams of 10 \- 20 Informaticians and Developers in supporting multiple Research Informatics projects. Provided a lead role in Budgeting, Planning, Hardware evaluation and acquisition, Vendor selection, offshore-team selection, Leading architectural decisions, Overseeing platform implementation Portfolioâ€‹: Managed portfolio include Agile development methodology with continuous development-and-testing with onsite and offshore teams, an Integrated RI Platform in building Research Applications such as Antibody, Plasmid and Cell-line Registry databases, Laboratory Electronic Notebook. Process Improvementsâ€‹: Excel/Word based lab notebooks to electronic lab notebook process to improve and support Intellectual Property (IP) protection and lab assay documentation and repeatability. Partnershipsâ€‹: Vendor partnerships for lab notebook and RI Platform architecture and implementation. Innovationâ€‹: RISe as a platform designed for developing biological entity registration and management system resulting in a Patent.  
Director of Engineering,Habeas (Acq by Return Path), Mountain View CA (Mar 2006 \- Jan 2009\) Leadershipâ€‹: Managed diverse global teams of 12 \- 25 members, leading multidisciplinary responsibilities with a budget of 1 Million. Organizationalâ€‹:Re-Engineering the systems to scale up to withstand the sales growth, from \<100 to \>800 clients. Putting together an Analutical Reporting framework to provide insights into customer data, segmentation, concentration and focus areas for Marketing and Sales. Portfolioâ€‹: Portfolio include End-User Interface with rich media integration, Restful Service API based Middleware framework for flexibility and scalability, robust backend database design to scale both horizontally and vertically to support growth. Process Improvementsâ€‹: Fully Automated QA framework that tested engineered products end to end with different campaign parameters to mimic real world situations, engineering and rearchitecting the components of the platform to take advantage of technology, fully optimized 24/7 development and testing cycle. Partnershipsâ€‹: Partnered with global vendors like Persistent Systems and Sierra Atlantic in Built-to-Own model. Director, Product Development, Trust Benefits Online, Emeryville CA (Nov 2003 \- Mar 2006\) Leadershipâ€‹: Managed and mentored a team of upto 9 software professionals and business analysts. Organizationalâ€‹:Setup and organized the team's from ground up to support the design and development of product development framework. Portfolioâ€‹: Managed portfolio includes Backend Annuity Calculation Engine, Middleware Platform supporting Trust Client specific Rules and Guidelines, Semi-Automated Content Management System that automated building Trust specific websites with limited effort from analysts. Process Improvementsâ€‹: Automated template based approach for building websites with minimal HTML coders/coding. Separation of Business Rules from Operational Processes, Very highly scalable middleware that can support large number of clients and web traffic. Partnershipsâ€‹: Partnering with Business Teams, Trust Fund Managers, Business Analysts, Technology Partners. Innovationâ€‹: CMS and Template based approach to building websites automatically. Unique adoption of new trends in Application Server Framework to advance development of Product Framework.  
Patents and Awards  
Conceived and directed implementation of RISe (Research Informatics System at elan) â€“ a cutting edge integrated pre-clinical informatics platform for chemistry, biology and preclinical safety labs; Patent: Shah, Ajay, et. al. System and Method for Managing Information of Biological Entities. Patent \# 20130013623, (2013)  
American Medical Informatics Association (AMIA) Distinguished Poster Award for software for clinical trials cohort discovery (2015)  
Conference Presentations  
SPIRIT SpecWiz: Metadata Driven, Semantically Enhanced Collaboration Tool for Generation of Specifications for Case Report Forms, Ajay Shah, Srinivas Bolisetty, Fortino Martinez, Stacy Berger, John Meng, Gwen Sale, Jennifer Boesen, Dona McQueen, Gayle Old-Smith, Weizhong Zhu, Joyce Niland, American Medical Informatics Association, San Francisco, (March 2016\)  
SPIRIT â€“ Integrated Platform for Protocol Decision Trees, Eligibility Screening and Cohort Identification, Ajay Shah, John Meng, Sai Achuthan, Srinivas Bolisetty, MTech, Ayyappan Nagender, Weizhong Zhu , Joyce C. Niland, American Medical Informatics Association, San Francisco, CA, (April 2014\) Protocol Decision Trees to Facilitate Protocol Planning and Patient Enrollment, Joyce C. Niland, Cy Stein, Julie Hom, Adina Londrc, Karen Rickard, Srisairam Achuthan, Srinivas Bolisetty, John Meng, Ayyappan Nagender, Ajay Shah, American Medical Informatics Association, San Francisco, CA, (April 2014\) SPIRIT ML âˆ’ A Machine Learning Platform for Translational Research, Srisairam Achuthan , Mike Chang, Ajay Shah and Joyce C Niland, American Medical Informatics Association, San Francisco, CA, (April 2014\) Integrated Translational Research Informatics, invited speaker and session chair, Ajay Shah John Meng, Sai Achuthan Weizhong Zhu, Srinivas Bolisetty, Ayyappan Nagender, Mike Chang, Joyce C. Niland, BioAsia-IT Hyderabad, India (Feb 2014\)  
Educational Background  
â€¢  
Master of Scienceâ€‹ in Computer Science University of Southwestern Louisiana, Lafayette  
â€¢  
Master of Technologyâ€‹ in AI and Robotics University of Hyderabad, Hyderabad India  
â€¢  
Bachelor of Engineeringâ€‹ in Electronics and Communications Engg. Osmania University, Hyderabad, India

documents.summary: Srinivas Bolisetty is a seasoned technology leader with extensive experience in software and systems architecture, particularly in clinical trials and healthcare informatics. He has successfully managed large teams and budgets, driving innovation and process improvements across various organizations.

documents.title: Technology Executive Profile
documents.content:
# SriBolisetty-38

Areas of Expertise: Technology Strategy Clinical Systems & Software Development Technical Project Management Continuous Improvement  
Business Operations SDLC & Agile Techniques Process Development Research & Data Analysis Vendor Management  
Client Relationship Management Team Leadership & Development Executive Engagement Communications  
E X E C U T I V E S U M M A R Y  
Highly analytical, results-driven, established global technology leader equipped with strong business acumen, innovative mindset, and 15+ years of documented success within the multibillion-dollar biopharmaceutical industry. Expert in technologies, databases, business processes and improvements, and automation and in-depth understanding of core business functions and digital capabilities. Recognized for building, mentoring, and motivating diverse and distributed teams in building and maintaining complex software platforms for clinical translational research and healthcare initiatives. Extensive experience across a diverse set of systems and cloud providers, including AWS, Azure, and Salesforce and broad technical domains, spanning security, infrastructure, network, and data. Adept at effectively balancing strategic and tactical needs while fostering inclusive, performance-centric cultures within cutting-edge, multifaceted technology environments.  
P R O F E S S I O N A L E X P E R I E N C E  
*P A R K E R I N S T I T U T E F O R C A N C E R I M M U N O T H E R A P Y 2 0 1 7 \- 2 0 1 9*  
*E x e c u t i v e D i r e c t o r o f T e c h n o l o g y*  
Served in a critical leadership role for the leading California-based non-profit, specializing in funding clinical trials for cutting-edge cancer treatments. Held full accountability for managing the technology framework, development, data security, and operations of systems responsible for clinical trials, bioinformatics data pipelines, and research data analysis. Oversaw data security and architecture across IT and clinical systems, as well as establishing SOPs, conducting data reviews, setting up data agreements, and performing security analysis and prevention activities. Worked in collaboration with the VP of Informatics to develop and execute comprehensive technology strategies, ensuring streamlined, effective, and cost-effective workflows.  
*Effectively managed a $2M annual IT budget, ensuring high levels of accuracy and accountability. Re-focused a 10-person development team to adopt better agile practices in delivering products and frameworks, focusing on quality and deliverability. Established off-the-shelf clinical systems to deploy Phase 1A and 1B trials, resulting in extension to phase 2\. Extended vendor partnerships to support more complex microbiome and platform trials. Implemented Veeva Vault for quality and eTMF, paving the way for later expansion to other clinical offerings. Identified and selected a vendor through RFC process, trial onboarding, and vendor management for study form development and deployment. Implemented Salesforce CRM in record time (\< 3 months), allowing multiple teams to collaborate efficiently. Selected and implemented a Tableau-based reporting infrastructure to integrate databases and unify reports and dashboards across the enterprise and clinical studies.*  
*C I T Y O F H O P E N A T I O N A L M E D I C A L C E N T E R 2 0 1 1 \- 2 0 1 7*  
*D i r e c t o r o f R e s e a r c h I n f o r m a t i c s A p p l i c a t i o n s*  
Selected to oversee and manage 19 informatics professionals and multidisciplinary teams in developing and executing the department strategy. Fully accountable for a $3.5M budget and large portfolio, including research systems, research applications, clinical trials data analysis and automation, decision support, adverse event monitoring and reporting, SQA, disease registries, clinical pathology variant analysis, genomic sequencing, cloud platform, data architecture and security, virtualization, and innovation.  
S R I N I V A S B O L I S E T T Y , M.S., M.TECH  
PHARMA TECHNOLOGY EXECUTIVE | INFORMATICS LEADER | INNOVATOR |  
PHONE: 214-901-8452 | EMAIL: SrinivasB@gmail.com | LINKEDIN  
*SRINIVAS BOLISETTY I PAGE 2 OF 2 Re-aligned teams and developed streamlined processes, resulting in an increase in productivity with 30% less budget, $5M to $3.5M within two years.*  
*Envisioned and led the development of Software Platform for Integrated Research Information and Transformation (SPIRIT), achieving significant cost reduction, decrease in operational overhead, and increased quality. Streamlined software development, improved processes, and adopted Agile methodologies, reducing the team from 40 to 20, resulting in decreased efforts for enhanced results.*  
*E L A N P H A R M A C E U T I C A L S 2 0 0 9 \- 2 0 1 1*  
*P r o g r a m M a n a g e r*  
Directed cross-functional teams of 15+ in supporting multiple research informatics projects for the global biotechnology company. Spearheaded various strategic and operational initiatives, including budgeting, planning, hardware evaluation and procurement, vendor selection, platform implementation, offshore team development, and architectural decision-making. Cultivated and maintained productive relationships with multiple overseas vendors, specializing in systems development and deployment.  
*Conceived and directed the implementation of RISe (Research Informatics System at elan), a cutting-edge integrated preclinical informatics platform for chemistry, biology, and preclinical safety labs. Patent\# 20130013623 (2013). Directly supported multiple research groups, spanning plasmids, antibodies, and compound tracking. Managed a portfolio, including agile development methodology and continuous development of an integrated RI platform for building research applications for use with Lab Notebook, Labware, and Symyx. Initiative allowed for use of single software platform that resulted in significant cost reduction and enhanced functionality. Implemented an electronic lab notebook system for Researchers, including migrating data and workflows and eliminating unwieldy systems interface for lab users.*  
*H A B E A S ( R E T U R N P A T H ) 2 0 0 6 \- 2 0 0 9*  
*D i r e c t o r o f E n g i n e e r i n g*  
Provided oversight and direction to a diverse global team of 25 resources and held full accountability for a $1M budget for the largest email deliverability service provider. Developed, re-engineered, and maintained complex systems that handled rapid growth and scalability and partnered with global vendors to source and employ cutting-edge capabilities aligned with company needs. Mentored, coached, and directed multiple organizations in the areas of software development, product building, and operational efficiencies, ensuring continual achievement of goals and objectives.  
*Strategically aligned with a global partner, reducing costs by 40% ($1M to \~$600K) and increasing productivity by 35%+. Re-engineered systems to support sales growth from 100 clients to 800+, including developing an analytical reporting framework that provided insights into customer data, segmentation, concentration, and focus areas for marketing and sales. Spearheaded the early adoption of Amazon AWS and assisted a Bay Area startup with quickly launching their product on iOS platform. Successfully founded and obtained VC funding for an internet portal company.*  
*T R U S T B E N E F I T S O N L I N E 2 0 0 3 \- 2 0 0 6*  
*D i r e c t o r o f P r o d u c t D e v e l o p m e n t*  
Mentored and managed a team of 9 software professionals and business analysts in supporting the design and development of product development framework. Partnered with Business Teams, Trust Fund Managers, Business Analysts, and Technology Partners to drive innovation and move forward the business and technology strategy.  
*Supported a traditional mainframe-based parent company spin-off an internet-based, self-service oriented technology company (TBOL). Led the complete design and architecture of a SaaS product, delivering on-time and within budget.*  
E D U C A T I O N  
*Master of Science (MS), Computer Science, University of Southwestern Louisiana, Lafayette Master of Technology (MTECH), AI & Robotics, University of Hyderabad, Hyderabad, India*
documents.summary: Srinivas Bolisetty is a seasoned technology leader with over 15 years of experience in the biopharmaceutical industry, specializing in technology strategy, clinical systems, and software development. He has a proven track record of managing large teams and budgets while driving innovation and operational efficiency in complex technology environments.

documents.title: Accomplished Biotech Technology Leader
documents.content:
# SriBolisetty-4

Accomplished technology leader with a 14+ year history of success in the biotech/pharma industry. Expertise in architecting cutting-edge informatics systems, integrating research tools for seamless data flow, and empowering organizations through cloud adoption and automation. Passionate about driving efficiency gains and streamlining research processes.  
*AI4HI \- EIR Oct 2023 \- Present*  
As Entrepreneur in Residence and executive team member at AI4HI, I spearhead commercialization of innovative technologies developed at both Amritha Vishwa Vidyapeeth and AI4HI. My mission is to create accessible, affordable digital health solutions by strategically integrating hardware, software, and AI advancements. I ensure our technology remains cutting-edge, adaptable, and fosters powerful collaborations with academic and industry partners..  
*CSL BEHRING \- Head of Data & Analytics Engg 2021-2023*  
Spearheaded development of Knowledge Graph-based applications to enhance R\&D collaboration. Led Big Data, Operational Data Warehouse, and enterprise analytics teams at CSL Behring. Spearheaded development of Knowledge Graph-based applications to enhance R\&D collaboration.  
*PARKER INSTITUTE FOR CANCER IMMUNOTHERAPY \- Executive Director of Technology 2017-2019*  
Integral member of PICI's team, establishing foundations for cross-functional clinical, regulatory, and IT initiatives that include: development of translational research informatics platform, managed hybrid cloud/on-prem IT solutions and strategic worldwide partnerships to drive innovation in rapidly evolving field.  
*CITY OF HOPE \- Director of Research Informatics Applications 2011-2017*  
Modernized systems for diverse clinical trials (observational, clinical, population science) at City of Hope. Implemented cutting-edge technology and automation, significantly boosting efficiency. Mentored teams and consultants to bridge technology gaps, fostering career development and maximizing technology adoption.  
*ELAN PHARMACEUTICALS \- ProgramManager, Research Informatics 2009-2011*  
Spearheaded the strategic development of Elan's Research Informatics System (RISe). This transformative platform streamlined data management across the R\&D lifecycle. Integrated RISe with core tools (e.g., Electronic Lab Notebooks, assay designers) for seamless data flow, accelerating application development and insights for research and business teams.  
*Master of Science (MS), Computer Science, University of Southwestern Louisiana, Lafayette*  
*Master of Technology (MTECH), AI & Robotics, University of Hyderabad, Hyderabad, India*  
*Bachelor of Engineering (BE), Electronics & Communications Engineering, Osmania University, Hyderabad India*
documents.summary: Sri Bolisetty is a seasoned technology leader with over 14 years of experience in the biotech and pharma sectors, specializing in informatics systems and cloud adoption. Currently serving as Entrepreneur in Residence at AI4HI, he focuses on commercializing innovative digital health solutions through strategic technology integration.

Adept at effectively balancing strategic and tactical needs while fostering inclusive, performance-centric cultures within cutting-edge, multifaceted technology environments.

*PARKER INSTITUTE FOR CANCER IMMUNOTHERAPY 2017-2019*  
*Executive Director of Technology*  
Served in a critical leadership role for the leading San Francisco-based startup, specializing in funding clinical trials for cutting-edge immunotherapy treatments. Held full accountability for system and data architecture, managing the technology framework, development, data security, and operations of systems responsible for clinical trials, bioinformatics data pipelines, and research data analysis. Oversaw data security and architecture across IT and clinical systems, as well as establishing SOPs, conducting data reviews, setting up data agreements, and performing security analysis and prevention activities. Worked in collaboration with the VP of Informatics to develop and execute comprehensive technology strategies, ensuring streamlined, effective, and cost-effective workflows.

â€¢  
*Re-focused a 10-person development team to adopt better agile practices in delivering products and frameworks,*  
*concentrating on quality and deliverability.*  
â€¢  
*Established off-the-shelf clinical systems to deploy Phase 1A and 1B trials, resulting in extension to phase 2\.*  
â€¢  
*Extended vendor partnerships to support more complex microbiome and platform trials.*  
â€¢  
*Implemented Veeva Vault for quality and eTMF, paving the way for later expansion to other clinical offerings.*  
â€¢  
*Identified and selected a vendor through RFC process, trial onboarding, and vendor management for study form*  
*development and deployment.*  
â€¢  
*Implemented Salesforce CRM in record time (\< 3 months), allowing multiple teams to collaborate efficiently.*  
â€¢  
*Selected and implemented a Tableau-based reporting infrastructure to integrate databases and unify reports and*  
*dashboards across the enterprise and clinical studies.*  
*CITY OF HOPE NATIONALMEDICAL CENTER 2011-2017*  
*Director of Research Informatics Applications*  
Selected to oversee and manage 19 informatics professionals and multidisciplinary teams in developing and executing the department strategy. Fully accountable for a $3.5M budget and large portfolio, including research informatics platforms and applications, including, clinical trials data analysis and automation, decision support, adverse event monitoring and reporting, SQA, disease registries, clinical pathology variant analysis, genomic sequencing, cloud platform, data architecture and security,

â€¢  
*Re-aligned teams and developed streamlined processes, resulting in an increase in productivity with 30% less budget, $5M to $3.5M within two years.*  
â€¢  
*Envisioned and led the development of Software Platform for Integrated Research Information and Transformation (SPIRIT), achieving significant cost reduction, decrease in operational overhead, and increased quality.*  
â€¢  
*Streamlined software development, improved processes, and adopted Agile methodologies, reducing the team from 40 to 20, resulting in decreased efforts for enhanced results.*  
*ELAN PHARMACEUTICALS 2009-2011*  
ProgramManager  
Directed cross-functional teams of 15+ in supporting multiple research informatics projects for the global biotechnology company. Spearheaded various strategic and operational initiatives, including budgeting, planning, hardware evaluation and procurement, vendor selection, platform implementation, offshore team development, and architectural decision-making. Cultivated and maintained productive relationships with multiple overseas vendors, specializing in systems development and deployment.

Initiative allowed for use of single software platform that resulted in significant cost reduction and enhanced functionality.*

*HABEAS (RETURN PATH) 2006-2009*  
*Director of Engineering*  
Provided oversight and direction to a diverse global team of 25 resources and held full accountability for a $1M budget for the largest email deliverability service provider. Developed, re-engineered, and maintained complex systems that handled rapid growth and scalability and partnered with global vendors to source and employ cutting-edge capabilities aligned with company needs. Mentored, coached, and directed multiple organizations in the areas of software development, product building, and operational efficiencies, ensuring continual achievement of goals and objectives.

documents.title: Software Engineer Seeking Opportunities
documents.content:
# SriBolisetty-7

Dear Hiring Manager, I am a software engineer at heart having worked with a vast number of technologies. I am  
currently looking for a Software Developer and Engineer role. I have worked with full stack  
development from UI all the way to the backend and integration with 3rd party systems.  
Involved with coding and every phase of a project or a product from requirements gathering to  
production deployment and operations. I am confident that my easy go personality will fit into  
most of the development teams that are in product development, or deployment and/or  
operations or customized enterprise software application development.  
Having worked with traditional in-house systems to cloud based applications, I have seen many  
complex situations that are almost impossible to solve and took pleasure in making them look  
so easy at the end. I always enjoyed working in environments where there seem like too many  
problems and challenges than the people can solve.  
Find attached is a summary of a few technologies that I have worked during my career. This  
helps you understand my appetite for learning and working with the technologies that differ so  
greatly from one another. I have always enjoyed learning new technologies and figuring them  
to solve common business problems.  
Also, find attached are a few LinkedIn Recommendations I have received over the years. This  
helps you understand the depth of technology and commitments I have and my nature of  
working with anyone from C-level all the way to the developer. I take complete satisfaction in  
solving the toughest problems and mentoring others along the way.  
Should you have any questions, feel free to contact me at â€‹SrinivasB@gmail.com or at  
214-901-8452.  
Thank you and have a great day.  
\-Srinivas
documents.summary: SriBolisetty is an experienced software engineer with a strong background in full stack development and a passion for solving complex problems. He is currently seeking a Software Developer and Engineer role, highlighting his adaptability and commitment to learning new technologies.

Sincerely,

documents.title: Pharma Technology Executive Profile
documents.content:
**[HEADLINE]{.underline}**

*Pharma Technology Executive, Informatics Leader, Innovator &
Strategist*

**[SUMMARY]{.underline}**

Established software technologist equipped with an innovative spirit,
Master of Science (MS) in Computer Science, Master of Technology (MTECH)
in AI and Robotics, and 15+ years of success in the multibillion-dollar
pharma industry. Skilled at building cross-functional teams from the
ground up, driving intense collaboration, effective communication, and
streamlined workflows. Imaginative leader and out-of-the-box thinker
recognized for the ability to develop and improve processes, establish
automation, and visualize and enforce frameworks within complex
environments. Dynamic and adaptable problem-solver and strategist with a
broad technical background and expertise in software architecture,
systems development, engineering, SDLC, systems analysis, SaaS, database
systems, R&D, and onshore and offshore team sourcing and leadership.

**[EXPERIENCE]{.underline}**

**PARKER INSTITUTE: EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR OF TECHNOLOGY**

Held full accountability for managing the technology framework,
development, data security, and operations of systems responsible for
clinical trials, bioinformatics data pipelines, and research data
analysis. Oversaw data security and architecture across IT and clinical
systems, as well as establishing SOPs, conducting data reviews, setting
up data agreements, and performing security analysis and prevention
activities. Managed a \$2M budget and worked in collaboration with the
VP of Informatics to develop and execute comprehensive technology
strategies.

Select Highlights:

-   Established off-the-shelf clinical systems to deploy Phase 1A and 1B
    trials, resulting in extension to phase 2.

-   Extended vendor partnerships to support more complex microbiome and
    platform trials.

-   Re-focused a 10-person development team to adopt better agile
    practices in delivering products and frameworks, focusing on quality
    and deliverability.

-   Implemented Salesforce CRM in record time (\< 3 months), allowing
    multiple teams to collaborate efficiently.

**CITY OF HOPE NATIONAL MED CENTER: DIRECTOR, RESEARCH INFORMATICS
APPLICATIONS**

Managed 19 informatics professionals and multidisciplinary teams in
developing and executing the department strategy. Fully accountable for
a \$3.5M budget and large portfolio, including research systems,
research applications, clinical trials data analysis and automation,
decision support, adverse event monitoring and reporting, SQA, disease
registries, clinical pathology variant analysis, genomic sequencing,
cloud platform, data architecture and security, virtualization, and
innovation.

Select Highlights:

-   Re-aligned teams and developed streamlined processes, resulting in
    an increase in productivity with 30% less budget, \$5M to \$3.5M
    within two years.

-   Streamlined software development, improved processes, and adopted
    Agile methodologies, reducing the team from 40 to 20, resulting in
    decreased efforts for enhanced results.

**ELAN PHARMACEUTICALS: PROGRAM MANAGER**

Spearheaded various strategic and operational initiatives, including
budgeting, planning, hardware evaluation and procurement, vendor
selection, platform implementation, offshore team development, and
architectural decision-making. Cultivated and maintained productive
relationships with multiple overseas vendors, specializing in systems
development and deployment.

Select Highlights:

-   Conceived and directed the implementation of RISe (Research
    Informatics System at elan), a cutting-edge integrated preclinical
    informatics platform for chemistry, biology, and preclinical safety
    labs. Patent# 20130013623 (2013). Directly supported multiple
    research groups, spanning plasmids, antibodies, and compound
    tracking.

-   Managed a portfolio, including agile development methodology and
    continuous development of an integrated RI platform for building
    research applications for use with Lab Notebook, Labware, and Symyx.
    Initiative allowed for use of single software platform that resulted
    in significant cost reduction and enhanced functionality.

**HABEAS: DIRECTOR OF ENGINEERING**

Provided oversight and direction to a diverse global team of 25
resources and held full accountability for a \$1M budget for the largest
email deliverability service provider. Developed, re-engineered, and
maintained complex systems that handled rapid growth and scalability and
partnered with global vendors to source and employ cutting-edge
capabilities aligned with company needs.

Select Highlights:

-   Strategically aligned with a global partner, reducing costs by 40%
    (\$1M to \~\$600K) and increasing productivity by 35%+.

-   Spearheaded the early adoption of Amazon AWS and assisted a Bay Area
    startup with quickly launching their product on iOS platform.

**TRUST BENEFITS ONLINE: DIRECTOR OF PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT**

Mentored and managed a team of 9 software professionals and business
analysts in supporting the design and development of product development
framework. Partnered with Business Teams, Trust Fund Managers, Business
Analysts, and Technology Partners to drive innovation and move forward
the business and technology strategy.

Select Highlights:

-   Supported a traditional mainframe-based parent company spin-off an
    internet-based, self-service oriented technology company (TBOL).
documents.summary: Srinivas B is a seasoned Pharma Technology Executive with over 15 years of experience in the industry, specializing in informatics, software architecture, and team leadership. He has a proven track record of driving innovation, improving processes, and managing substantial budgets across various organizations.
