in architecture, technologies, databases, business processes and improvements, and automation and in-depth understanding of core
business functions and digital capabilities. Recognized for building, mentoring, and motivating diverse and distributed teams in
building and maintaining complex software platforms for clinical translational research and healthcare initiatives. Extensive
experience across a diverse set of systems and cloud providers, including AWS, Azure, and Salesforce and broad technical domains,
spanning security, infrastructure, network, and data. Adept at effectively balancing strategic and tactical needs while fostering
inclusive, performance-centric cultures within cutting-edge, multifaceted technology environments.
Technology Strategy

Clinical Systems & Software Development

Business Operations

SDLC & Agile Techniques

Client Relationship Management

Technical Project Management

Continuous Improvement

Process Development Research & Data Analysis

Team Leadership & Development

Executive Engagement

Vendor Management
Communications

PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE
PARKER INSTITUTE FOR CANCER IMMUNOTHERAPY
Executive Director of Technology

2017-2019

Served in a critical leadership role for the leading San Francisco-based startup, specializing in funding clinical trials for cutting-edge
immunotherapy treatments. Held full accountability for system and data architecture, managing the technology framework,
development, data security, and operations of systems responsible for clinical trials, bioinformatics data pipelines, and research data
analysis. Oversaw data security and architecture across IT and clinical systems, as well as establishing SOPs, conducting data reviews,
setting up data agreements, and performing security analysis and prevention activities. Worked in collaboration with the VP of
Informatics to develop and execute comprehensive technology strategies, ensuring streamlined, effective, and cost-effective
workflows.
â€¢
â€¢
â€¢
â€¢
â€¢
â€¢
â€¢
â€¢

Effectively managed a $2M annual IT budget, ensuring high levels of accuracy and accountability.
Re-focused a 10-person development team to adopt better agile practices in delivering products and frameworks,
concentrating on quality and deliverability.
Established off-the-shelf clinical systems to deploy Phase 1A and 1B trials, resulting in extension to phase 2.
Extended vendor partnerships to support more complex microbiome and platform trials.
Implemented Veeva Vault for quality and eTMF, paving the way for later expansion to other clinical offerings.
Identified and selected a vendor through RFC process, trial onboarding, and vendor management for study form
development and deployment.
Implemented Salesforce CRM in record time (< 3 months), allowing multiple teams to collaborate efficiently.
Selected and implemented a Tableau-based reporting infrastructure to integrate databases and unify reports and
dashboards across the enterprise and clinical studies.

CITY OF HOPE NATIONAL MEDICAL CENTER
Director of Research Informatics Applications

2011-2017

Selected to oversee and manage 19 informatics professionals and multidisciplinary teams in developing and executing the
department strategy. Fully accountable for a $3.5M budget and large portfolio, including research informatics platforms and
applications, including, clinical trials data analysis and automation, decision support, adverse event monitoring and reporting, SQA,
disease registries, clinical pathology variant analysis, genomic sequencing, cloud platform, data architecture and security,
virtualization, and innovation.

â€¢
â€¢
â€¢

Re-aligned teams and developed streamlined processes, resulting in an increase in productivity with 30% less budget, $5M
to $3.5M within two years.
Envisioned and led the development of Software Platform for Integrated Research Information and Transformation (SPIRIT),
achieving significant cost reduction, decrease in operational overhead, and increased quality.
Streamlined software development, improved processes, and adopted Agile methodologies, reducing the team from 40 to
20, resulting in decreased efforts for enhanced results.

ELAN PHARMACEUTICALS
Program Manager

2009-2011

Directed cross-functional teams of 15+ in supporting multiple research informatics projects for the global biotechnology company.
Spearheaded various strategic and operational initiatives, including budgeting, planning, hardware evaluation and procurement,
vendor selection, platform implementation, offshore team development, and architectural decision-making. Cultivated and
maintained productive relationships with multiple overseas vendors, specializing in systems development and deployment.
â€¢
â€¢

â€¢

Conceived and directed the implementation of RISe (Research Informatics System at elan), a cutting-edge integrated
preclinical informatics platform for chemistry, biology, and preclinical safety labs. Patent# 20130013623 (2013). Directly
supported multiple research groups, spanning plasmids, antibodies, and compound tracking.
Managed a portfolio, including agile development methodology and continuous development of an integrated RI platform
for building research applications for use with Lab Notebook, Labware, and Symyx. Initiative allowed for use of single
software platform that resulted in significant cost reduction and enhanced functionality.
Implemented an electronic lab notebook system for Researchers, including migrating data and workflows and eliminating
unwieldy systems interface for lab users.

HABEAS (RETURN PATH)
Director of Engineering

2006-2009

Provided oversight and direction to a diverse global team of 25 resources and held full accountability for a $1M budget for the largest
email deliverability service provider. Developed, re-engineered, and maintained complex systems that handled rapid growth and
scalability and partnered with global vendors to source and employ cutting-edge capabilities aligned with company needs.
Mentored, coached, and directed multiple organizations in the areas of software development, product building, and operational
efficiencies, ensuring continual achievement of goals and objectives.
â€¢
â€¢
â€¢
â€¢

Strategically aligned with a global partner, reducing costs by 40% ($1M to ~$600K) and increasing productivity by 35%+.
Re-engineered systems to support sales growth from 100 clients to 800+, including developing an analytical reporting
framework that provided insights into customer data, segmentation, concentration, and focus areas for marketing and sales.
Spearheaded the early adoption of Amazon AWS and assisted a Bay Area startup with quickly launching their product on
iOS platform.
Successfully founded and obtained VC funding for an internet portal company.

TRUST BENEFITS ONLINE
Director of Product Development

2003-2006

Mentored and managed a team of 9 software professionals and business analysts in supporting the design and development of
product development framework. Partnered with Business Teams, Trust Fund Managers, Business Analysts, and Technology
Partners to drive innovation and move forward the business and technology strategy.
â€¢
â€¢

Supported a traditional mainframe-based parent company spin-off an internet-based, self-service oriented technology
company (TBOL).
Led the complete design and architecture of a SaaS product, delivering on-time and within budget.

documents.summary: This webpage presents the professional profile of Srinivas Bolisetty, a results-driven software technologist with extensive experience in team building, leadership, and process improvement across various roles in the tech industry. It includes his educational background, work experience, and key skills.

documents.title: Srinivas Bolisetty's Professional Profile
documents.content:
# SrinivasBolisetty (1)

Srinivas Bolisetty (Sri) M.S., M.Tech.
Frisco,TX
(214)-901-8452 â€‹SrinivasB@Gmail.com
Technology Leadership, Mentoring, Software Architecture, Systems Architecture, Application
Platforms, Management of Large Portfolio of Applications, Vendor Relationship, Diverse and
distributed teams development, Innovation, Strategy and Process Improvement

Performance Highlights
Leadership
â—
â—
â—

Managed diverse groups of about 17 team members, responsible for all aspects of
application analysis to development to operationalization to production support, with an
yearly budget of $3.5 million at City of Hope National Medical Center (COH).
Managed global team of about 10 members, responsible for product design and
development, vendor management, user training at elan Pharmaceuticals.
Managed global team of about 25 members, responsible for product development,
Engineering and performance tuning, BI analysis and Data warehouse at Habeas.

Innovation and Platforms
â—
â—

â—

Envisaged and led development of Software Platform for Integrated Research
Information and Transformation (SPIRIT), for basic, clinical and translational informatics
(COH)
Conceived and directed implementation of RISe (Research Informatics System at elan) â€“
a cutting edge integrated pre-clinical informatics platform for chemistry, biology and
preclinical safety labs; Patent: Shah, Ajay, et. al. System and Method for Managing
Information of Biological Entities. Patent # 20130013623, (2013)
Redesigned and engineered a Reputation platform for Marketing Companies to
statistically evaluate and analyze effectiveness of email campaigns that led to quick
market adoption eventually leading the No.1 competitor in the space to acquire Habeas.

Strategy and Process Improvements
â—
â—
â—
â—

Re-engineered an non-existing SDLC process to adopt best practices, set up a Release
Management cycle that rolled nicely into Enterprise ITIL process later on.
Envisioned a 4-tier environment for software applications development to help improve
the quality of enterprise software applications.
Strategically planned adoption of cloud platforms within Research to help address the
future needs in time as the demand arised.
Strategic alignment of resources with a global partner reducing the overall costs by 40%
($1M to ~$600K), while more than doubling the total number of resources (1+6 to 1+
14) and increasing the productivity by 50% (number of product releases, features,
reports).

Entrepreneurship and Grants
â—
â—
â—

Founded and obtained venture capital for an internet portal
Contributed architectural and technical solutions to multiple grant proposals. Wrote
informatics components of grants as co-Investigator. Responsible for informatics portion
of grant funded national data coordination center projects.
Helped Habeas acquire multitude of clients by scaling out application architecture on
demand before the PaaS and IaaS days.

SrinivasB@GMail.com

Sri â€‹â˜â€‹ 214-901-8452

 Professional Experience
Director, Research Informatics Applications, City of National Medical Center, Duarte
CA (Oct 2011 - Present)

multi-discipline teams with a budget of 2.5 million.
Organizationalâ€‹:Re-focused the teams and processes to be efficient and effective at building
research applications, innovative thinking and automating daily tasks.
Portfolioâ€‹: Managed portfolio includes Research Systems, Research Applications, Clinical Trials
Data Analysis and Automation, Decision Support, Adverse Event monitoring and reporting,
SQA, Disease Registries, Clinical Pathology Variant Analysis, Genomic Sequencing, Cloud
Platform, Virtualization and Innovation.
Process Improvementsâ€‹: Design and development of a software platform called SPIRIT,
Implementation and automation of SDLC, Vendor and Software license management,
Continuous Technology Training.
Partnershipsâ€‹: Partnering with IT teams, PIâ€™s, Researchers, Physicians and Clinicians
Innovationâ€‹: Encouraging, Advising, brainstorming, supporting whichever way needed to build
applications, POCâ€™s in areas of Machine Learning, Process Pipelining, Cloud Computing, NLP,
Cohort Discovery, Technology Adaption.
Trainingâ€‹: Thru the use of Community of Practice, Innovation sessions and Online self-directed
CBTs, Individualized course curriculums - kept the teams abreast of technology, and be more
productive and efficient.
Program Manager, elan Pharmaceuticals, South San Francisco CA
(Feb 2009 - Jun 2011)
Leadershipâ€‹: Managed blended teams of 10 - 20 Informaticians and Developers in supporting
multiple Research Informatics projects. Provided a lead role in Budgeting, Planning,
Hardware evaluation and acquisition, Vendor selection, offshore-team selection, Leading
architectural decisions, Overseeing platform implementation
Portfolioâ€‹: Managed portfolio include Agile development methodology with continuous
development-and-testing with onsite and offshore teams, an Integrated RI Platform in
building Research Applications such as Antibody, Plasmid and Cell-line Registry databases,
Laboratory Electronic Notebook.
Process Improvementsâ€‹: Excel/Word based lab notebooks to electronic lab notebook process to
improve and support Intellectual Property (IP) protection and lab assay documentation and
repeatability.
Partnershipsâ€‹: Vendor partnerships for lab notebook and RI Platform architecture and
implementation.
Innovationâ€‹: RISe as a platform designed for developing biological entity registration and
management system resulting in a Patent.

SrinivasB@GMail.com

Sri â€‹â˜â€‹ 214-901-8452

 Director of Engineering,Habeas (Acq by Return Path), Mountain View CA
(Mar 2006 - Jan 2009)

responsibilities with a budget of 1 Million.

<100 to >800 clients. Putting together an Analutical Reporting framework to provide insights
into customer data, segmentation, concentration and focus areas for Marketing and Sales.

based Middleware framework for flexibility and scalability, robust backend database design to

documents.title: Software Development Manager Profile
documents.content:
# SrinivasBolisetty (3)

Srinivas Bolisetty (Sri)
Experienced Software Development Manager and Director
661-927-7254(M) SrinivasB@Shalusri.com
I am currently looking for project management opportunities in the areas of software
applications and product development.

Overview
With an overall 17 Years of software development experience and leadership include more
than 10 years in Project Management and team building. Dependable leader in creating and
managing software development among many areas including Financial, Credit Cards, 401K,
Trust Funds, Health care, Pharmaceutical and Email industries. Hands on project manager
with extensive experience in managing a large portfolio.
Efficiently managed products from inception thru implementation and deployment, while
transforming organizations and individual teams from ad-hoc processes to well known agile
development. Always keeps a keen focus on business goals while bringing disparate teams
together.
Participates with cross-functional team exercises to better understand overall goals and
stimulate the teams to strive for success of the entire company.

Experience
â—

Ã‰lan Pharmaceuticals, South San Francisco, CA â€“ RISe Program
Manager
Feb 2009 â€” June 2011
Ã‰lan Pharmaceuticals is a multi-billion dollar neuroscience-based biotechnology company
that is focused on discovering, developing, manufacturing and marketing advanced
therapies in neurology, autoimmune diseases, and severe pain.
I am responsible for managing all RI projects using Agile Methodology, provide strategic
architectural roadmap for technology, manage supporting information technology
platforms for scientists and analysts, offshore vendor relationship management, interact
with end-users, scientists and scientific community gathering requirements, user
workflows, prioritization of features, system design and development.
I am also responsible for the technology oversight, hardware planning and acquisition,
hands on architecture and product solution reviews, Test Case documentation and
planning, QA preparation and testing.
During my tenure at elan, I have implemented RISe - Research Informatics System
at elan - platform for Research. RISe is a biological and chemical entity registration,
workflow management and inventory management system. I have managed the
implementation of protein, antibody, plasmid and chemical reagent management
systems. I was also responsible for implementation of vendor provided chemistry
solutions in RISe, including Compound Registration system, SAR system and E-Notebook
from leading vendor Symyx/Accelrys.

SrinivasB@Shalusri.com

Sri â˜ 661-927-7254

 During RISe implementation I have provided a lead role in budgeting, planning,
hardware evaluation and acquisition, vendor selection, off-shore team selection
and mentoring, integration of offshore and on-site teams, leading the architecture
discussions, selecting the technology stack, overseeing implementation and ensuring the
delivery of completed product in phases.
As proof of concept, the sample applications were built on the frameworks using Java/
J2EE stack as well as .NET/Sharepoint stack. Lead the architecture team to review
the stacks, business needs and decided to go with the final framework that is based
on .NET/Sharepoint based SOA framework. This framework is designed to integrate
existing enterprise solutions as well as to support future business applications.
Utilized many tools including: VersionOne for agile project management, Cruise Control
for daily builds, Hibernate and ADO.NET for ORM and database connectivity, entityattributed based database as well as relational database for data flexibility, N-Unit for
unit testing, TeamDefine for scenario and use case building, CaliberRM for requirements
management, Bugzilla for bug-tracking, TOAD for Database design and management.
â—

Habeas Inc., Mountain View, CA â€“ Director of Engineering
March 2006 â€” January 2009
Habeas provides comprehensive, email reputation management and delivery services
enhancing the performance and certainty of email operations and improves the
reliability, safety and financial performance of email marketing campaigns. Habeas is
acquired by ReturnPath in August 2008.
Managed multiple engineering teams across multiple locations, onshore and offshore,
while successfully transforming a project life cycle with 6 month turnaround with
traditional development methodology into an Scrum based agile development teams
delivering releases every month.
Delivered release after release in-time on-budget improving the quality of the code,
processes and product features. Both ad-hoc and BI reporting capabilities were
developed using OpenSource tools such as Jasper and MySQL.
The product and database were re-engineered in order to scale them to sustain growth
rates. Owned the design and development of all layers of the application from UI to
middle-tier (a RESTful Web Services layer) to Database design for new and upcoming
features. Total number of clients grew from 175 to 600+ at the time of ReturnPathâ€™s
acquisition.
Hired, mentored and setup an offshore development team to help sustain the project
load and helped integrate them with onshore development team.

â—

Trust Benefits Online, Emeryville CA â€“ Director of Product Development
November 2003 â€” March 2006
Recently acquired by International Concepts Inc., TrustBenefits offers web-based
benefits administration solutions meeting the ever evolving needs of Trust Funds,
Employers, Administrators, and Plan Participants. TrustBenefits is a spinoff from
Associated Third Party Administrators, a veteran company that provides administrative
services to various multi-employer trust funds.

SrinivasB@Shalusri.com

Sri â˜ 661-927-7254

 Engineered a SaaS based framework after a couple of different approaches to build
Participant Tool application online. Mentored the original team from ATPA in the new
generation of technologies.
Re-engineered the original engine that is coded in oracle and oracle forms and built an
multi-layer API to take advantage of building multiple products. Thus helping save years
of labor spent in generating the core engine that managed and performed the many
complex calculations involving oneâ€™s retirement and other benefits.
Managed several client deployments from acquisition thru staging thru production
implementation by adopting various processes and automating them where necessary
and possible.
â—

Hindunet Inc./GHEN Soft Inc., San Diego, CA
April 2001 â€” September 2002
Hindunet/GHEN is a startup with roots in social community based websites and webtools and vision for helping and building a community of portals together under a single
banner.
Helped successfully get funding for Hindunet as a social venture. Setup an offshore
development center for building and supporting the tools, websites and client projects.
Responsible for designing and development of the SmartKit framework using LAMP
stack. SmartKit was able to successfully implement for many of the client projects with
quick turn-around times.
Managed several teams and projects comprising different projects.

â—

VeuhaSoft Inc., Santa Clara, CA
August 2000 â€” April 2001
VeuhaSoft was a startup with big ideas to bring better solutions to complex world of
systems integration.
Consulted with VeuhaSoft helping many of their clients with product design,
architecture and implementation. The projects ranged from custom software
development to utilizing well-known Application Servers like ATG Dynamo.

â—

Caresoft Inc., Sunnyvale, CA Engineering Manager
July 1999 â€” August 2000
Caresoft was a pioneer in bringing personal health management tools online over the
web (very common today, but not then) and revolutionized by brining Lab Test results
online securely and privately.
Managed several projects in a short-time with a quick-turn around, churning out multiple
features, many releases a month. Employed extreme programming methodologyâ€™s
paired-programming approach to sustain the development and product quality.
Integrated with many data-sources and worked with many cross-functional teams to

SrinivasB@Shalusri.com

Sri â˜ 661-927-7254

 successfully develop and deploy TheDailyApple.com web site, one of its kind in those
days, to help individuals manage their own personal health online.
Successfully managed integration of personal lab-results, a HL7 compliant system, into
the online tools privately and securely using IBM MQ Series, ATG Dynamo and Oracle
with collaboration from Quest Diagnostics.
Integrated OpenText CMS system into online tools thus providing a fully functional
authoring system for authors, reviewers and editors to write and publish content online
without having to get intervention from either Engineering or Operations.
â—

First Union National Bank, Charlotte, NC â€“ Information Architect
November 1998 â€” July 1999
FirstUnion was 6th largest bank in US then and took many of the technically advance
decisions like bringing online trading, fully automated banking systems, and managing
traditional 401 and other retirement trust plans. FirstUnion was one of the first few
banks to actually provide 401K fund information online for the users.
Lead a team in re-engineering an old DOS based record keeping system into n-tier
architecture. Participated in requirements gathering, analysis and decision making on
new Internet based Participant Advice system for 401-K /Retirement-Fund participants.

â—

Broadway & Seymour, Charlotte, NC â€“ Software Engineer/Team Lead
Jan 1994 â€” November 1998
Broadway & Seymour grew from a small time consulting company to products based
company building one of kind CRM products for banking and credit card sectors.
Currently part of Fidelity division, the flagship product, TouchPoint, is still being used at
many banks including Bank of America.
Key contributor and one of the original designers on TouchPoint product, known as
the go-to guy for Tuxedo and MQ Series. Worked with many client implementations
of TouchPoint as well as custom application development. Had a simple motto: Any
technology, any client, any challenge

Education
â—

University of Southwestern Louisiana, Lafayette â€“ Master of Science in
Computer Science â€“ Dec â€˜93
â— University of Hyderabad, Hyderabad India â€“ Master of Technology in
Artificial Intelligence and Robotics â€“ Dec â€˜91
â— Osmania University, Hyderabad, India â€“ Bachelor of Engineering in
Electronics and Communications Engineering

SrinivasB@Shalusri.com

Sri â˜ 661-927-7254
documents.summary: Srinivas Bolisetty is an experienced Software Development Manager and Director with 17 years in software development and over 10 years in project management, seeking new opportunities in software applications and product development. He has a proven track record of leading teams and managing projects across various industries, implementing agile methodologies, and delivering successful software solutions.

documents.title: Srinivas Bolisetty's Professional Profile
documents.content:
# **Srinivas** (Sri) **Bolisetty M.S.**, M.Tech.

â˜**(214)-901-8452**
[[SrinivasB@Gmail.com]{.underline}](mailto:SrinivasB@Gmail.com)

Technology Leadership, Software and Systems Architecture, Application
Platforms, Management of Large Portfolio of Applications, Vendor
Relationship, Mentoring and managing diverse and distributed teams
development, Innovation, Strategy and Process Improvement. Deep
expertise in cloud and mobile computing and special expertise in
building software platforms for basic, clinical and translational
research and healthcare

## 

## Performance Highlights

> Leadership

-   Managed diverse groups of about 17 team members, responsible for all
    aspects of application analysis to development to operationalization
    to production support, with an yearly budget of \$3.5 million at
    City of Hope National Medical Center (COH).

-   Managed global team of about 10 members, responsible for product
    design and development, vendor management, user training at elan
    Pharmaceuticals.

-   Managed global team of about 25 members, responsible for product
    development, Engineering and performance tuning, BI analysis and
    Data warehouse at Habeas.

> Innovation and Platforms

-   Envisaged and led development of Software Platform for Integrated
    Research Information and Transformation (SPIRIT), for basic,
    clinical and translational informatics (COH)

-   Conceived and directed implementation of RISe (Research Informatics
    System at elan) -- a cutting edge integrated pre-clinical
    informatics platform for chemistry, biology and preclinical safety
    labs; Patent: System and Method for Managing Information of
    Biological Entities. Patent \# 20130013623, (2013)

-   Redesigned and engineered a Reputation platform for Marketing
    Companies to statistically evaluate and analyze effectiveness of
    email campaigns that led to quick market adoption eventually leading
    the No.1 competitor in the space to acquire Habeas.

> Strategy and Process Improvements

-   Re-engineered an non-existing SDLC process to adopt best practices,
    set up a Release Management cycle that rolled nicely into Enterprise
    ITIL process later on.

-   Envisioned a 4-tier environment for software applications
    development to help improve the quality of enterprise software
    applications.

-   Strategically planned adoption of cloud platforms within Research to
    help address the future needs in time as the demand arised.

-   Managed Mobile applications development in clinical research
    including: BRisk, Clinical Trials at COH, Adverse Events Calculator.

-   Strategic alignment of resources with a global partner reducing the
    overall costs by 40% (\$1M to \~\$600K), the productivity is
    increased by over 35% with half the staff (number of product
    releases, features, reports).

> Entrepreneurship and Grants

-   Founded and obtained venture capital for an internet portal

-   Contributed architectural and technical solutions to multiple grant
    proposals. Wrote informatics components of grants as
    co-Investigator. Responsible for informatics portion of grant funded
    national data coordination center projects.

-   Helped Habeas acquire multitude of clients by scaling out
    application architecture on demand before the PaaS and IaaS days.

## Professional Experience

> **Director, Research Informatics Applications, City of National
> Medical Center, Duarte CA (Oct 2011 - Present)**
>
> [Leadership]{.underline}: Managed and mentored a team of upto 19
> informatics professionals, including multi-discipline teams with a
> budget of 2.5 million.
>
> [Organizational]{.underline}:Re-focused the teams and processes to be
> efficient and effective at building research applications, innovative
> thinking and automating daily tasks.
>
> [Portfolio]{.underline}: Managed portfolio includes Research Systems,
> Research Applications, Clinical Trials Data Analysis and Automation,
> Decision Support, Adverse Event monitoring and reporting, SQA, Disease
> Registries, Clinical Pathology Variant Analysis, Genomic Sequencing,
> Cloud Platform, Virtualization and Innovation.
>
> [Process Improvements]{.underline}: Design and development of a
> software platform called SPIRIT, Implementation and automation of
> SDLC, Vendor and Software license management, Continuous Technology
> Training.
>
> [Partnerships]{.underline}: Partnering with IT teams, PI's,
> Researchers, Physicians and Clinicians
>
> [Innovation]{.underline}: Encouraging, Advising, brainstorming,
> supporting whichever way needed to build applications, POC's in areas
> of Machine Learning, Process Pipelining, Cloud Computing, NLP, Cohort
> Discovery, Technology Adaption.
>
> [Training]{.underline}: Thru the use of Community of Practice,
> Innovation sessions and Online self-directed CBTs, Individualized
> course curriculums - kept the teams abreast of technology, and be more
> productive and efficient.
>
> **Program Manager, elan Pharmaceuticals, South San Francisco CA\
> (Feb 2009 - Jun 2011)**
>
> [Leadership]{.underline}: Managed blended teams of 10 - 20
> Informaticians and Developers in supporting multiple Research
> Informatics projects. Provided a lead role in Budgeting, Planning,
> Hardware evaluation and acquisition, Vendor selection, offshore-team
> selection, Leading architectural decisions, Overseeing platform
> implementation
>
> [Portfolio]{.underline}: Managed portfolio include Agile development
> methodology with continuous development-and-testing with onsite and
> offshore teams, an Integrated RI Platform in building Research
> Applications such as Antibody, Plasmid and Cell-line Registry
> databases, Laboratory Electronic Notebook.
>
> [Process Improvements]{.underline}: Excel/Word based lab notebooks to
> electronic lab notebook process to improve and support Intellectual
> Property (IP) protection and lab assay documentation and
> repeatability.
>
> [Partnerships]{.underline}: Vendor partnerships for electronic lab
> notebook and RI Platform architecture and implementation.
>
> [Innovation]{.underline}: RISe as a platform designed for developing
> biological entity registration and management system resulting in a
> Patent.
>
> **Director of Engineering,Habeas (Acq by Return Path), Mountain View
> CA\
> (Mar 2006 - Jan 2009)**
>
> [Leadership]{.underline}: Managed diverse global teams of 12 - 25
> members, leading multidisciplinary responsibilities with a budget of 1
> Million.
>
> [Organizational]{.underline}:Reengineering the systems to scale up to
> withstand the sales growth, from \<100 to \>800 clients. Putting
> together an Analytical Reporting framework to provide insights into
> customer data, segmentation, concentration and focus areas for
> Marketing and Sales.
>
> [Portfolio]{.underline}: Portfolio include End-User Interface with
> rich media integration, Restful Service API based Middleware framework
> for flexibility and scalability, robust backend database design to
> scale both horizontally and vertically to support growth.
>
> [Process Improvements]{.underline}: Fully Automated QA framework that
> tested engineered products end to end with different campaign
> parameters to mimic real world situations, engineering and
> re-architecting the components of the platform to take advantage of
> technology, fully optimized 24/7 development and testing cycle.
>
> [Partnerships]{.underline}: Partnered with global vendors like
> Persistent Systems and Sierra Atlantic in Built-to-Own model.
>
> **Director, Product Development, Trust Benefits Online, Emeryville CA\
> (Nov 2003 - Mar 2006)**
>
> [Leadership]{.underline}: Managed and mentored a team of upto 9
> software professionals and business analysts.
>
> [Organizational]{.underline}:Setup and organized the team\'s from
> ground up to support the design and development of product development
> framework.
>
> [Portfolio]{.underline}: Managed portfolio includes Backend Annuity
> Calculation Engine, Middleware Platform supporting Trust Client
> specific Rules and Guidelines, Semi-Automated Content Management
> System that automated building Trust specific websites with limited
> effort from analysts.
>
> [Process Improvements]{.underline}: Automated template based approach
> for building websites with minimal HTML coders/coding. Separation of
> Business Rules from Operational Processes, Very highly scalable
> middleware that can support large number of clients and web traffic.
>
> [Partnerships]{.underline}: Partnering with Business Teams, Trust Fund
> Managers, Business Analysts, Technology Partners.
>
> [Innovation]{.underline}: CMS and Template based approach to building
> websites automatically. Unique adoption of new trends in Application
> Server Framework to advance development of Product Framework.

## 

## 

## 

## Patents and Awards

> Conceived and directed implementation of RISe (Research Informatics
> System at elan) -- a cutting edge integrated pre-clinical informatics
> platform for chemistry, biology and preclinical safety labs; Patent:
> Shah, Ajay, et. al. System and Method for Managing Information of
> Biological Entities. Patent \# 20130013623, (2013)
>
> American Medical Informatics Association (AMIA) Distinguished Poster
> Award for software for clinical trials cohort discovery (2015)

## 

## Conference Presentations

> SPIRIT SpecWiz: Metadata Driven, Semantically Enhanced Collaboration
> Tool for Generation of Specifications for Case Report Forms, Ajay
> Shah, Srinivas Bolisetty, Fortino Martinez, Stacy Berger, John Meng,
> Gwen Sale, Jennifer Boesen, Dona McQueen, Gayle Old-Smith, Weizhong
> Zhu, Joyce Niland, American Medical Informatics Association, San
> Francisco, (March 2016)
>
> SPIRIT -- Integrated Platform for Protocol Decision Trees, Eligibility
> Screening and Cohort Identification, Ajay Shah, John Meng, Sai
> Achuthan, Srinivas Bolisetty, MTech, Ayyappan Nagender, Weizhong Zhu ,
> Joyce C. Niland, American Medical Informatics Association, San
> Francisco, CA, (April 2014)
>
> Protocol Decision Trees to Facilitate Protocol Planning and Patient
> Enrollment, Joyce C. Niland, Cy Stein, Julie Hom, Adina Londrc, Karen
> Rickard, Srisairam Achuthan, Srinivas Bolisetty, John Meng, Ayyappan
> Nagender, Ajay Shah, American Medical Informatics Association, San
> Francisco, CA, (April 2014)
>
> SPIRIT ML âˆ’ A Machine Learning Platform for Translational Research,
> Srisairam Achuthan , Mike Chang, Ajay Shah and Joyce C Niland,
> American Medical Informatics Association, San Francisco, CA, (April
> 2014)
>
> Integrated Translational Research Informatics, invited speaker and
> session chair, Ajay Shah John Meng, Sai Achuthan Weizhong Zhu,
> Srinivas Bolisetty, Ayyappan Nagender, Mike Chang, Joyce C. Niland,
> BioAsia-IT Hyderabad, India (Feb 2014)

## **Educational Background**

-   **Master of Science** in Computer Science\
    University of Southwestern Louisiana, Lafayette

-   **Master of Technology** in AI and Robotics\
    University of Hyderabad, Hyderabad India

-   **Bachelor of Engineering** in Electronics and Communications Engg.
    Osmania University, Hyderabad, India

He has a proven track record in managing diverse teams, driving innovation, and implementing strategic process improvements across various organizations.

-   Strategic alignment of resources with a global partner reducing the
    overall costs by 40% (\$1M to \~\$600K), the productivity is
    increased by over 35% with half the staff (number of product

-   Contributed architectural and technical solutions to multiple grant
    proposals. Wrote informatics components of grants as
    co-Investigator. Responsible for informatics portion of grant funded
    national data coordination center projects.

-   Helped Habeas acquire multitude of clients by scaling out
    application architecture on demand before the PaaS and IaaS days.

>

documents.summary: Srinivas Bolisetty is a seasoned technology leader with extensive experience in software and systems architecture, particularly in healthcare and clinical research. He has successfully managed diverse teams and large budgets while driving innovation and process improvements across various organizations.

documents.title: Srinivas Bolisetty - Software Leader
documents.content:
# srinivas_bolisetty

Srinivas Bolisetty
Experienced Director of Software Development
srinivasb@gmail.com

Summary
Results-driven Software technologist with in-depth understanding of technologies and trends and a
solid background in all core business functions, a go-getter attitude, an eye towards process
improvements and automation, hire-mentor-build teams from ground-up, imaginative and out-of-box
thinking, visualize and enforce frameworks over problem solving, wide variety of expertise in
technologies, databases, business areas, corporate cultures and entrepreneurship.
Always looking for problems to solve and making software development a fun and easy thing to do.

Specialties
Team building, leadership, software architecture, complex systems development, process
improvement and re-engineering, Software FDLC, Database systems and analysis, R&D, Strategic
and Tactical management.

Experience
Director of Engineering at Habeas Inc.
March 2006 - Present (1 year 4 months)
3 recommendations available upon request
Director of Product Development at TrustBenefits Online
November 2003 - March 2006 (2 years 5 months)
Application Architect (Self-Employed)
September 2002 - November 2003 (1 year 3 months)

April 2001 - September 2002 (1 year 6 months)

 Srinivas Bolisetty
Experienced Director of Software Development
srinivasb@gmail.com

3 people have recommended Srinivas
"Srinivas is one of the best directors, engineers and DBA's that I have had the pleasure to work
with. His schema's are a dream to read, his services are clearly designed and their APIs are
designed for the long run. As a director, I found him to be both productive himself and able to get
max productivity out of his teams. His system designs are end-to-end the right level of
completeness, performance, complexity and sophistication for the company's needs. His
experience and intelligence are very evident. His agresiveness is pure virtue in a startup."
â€” Rich Rein, Director Software Development, Habeas, Inc., worked directly with Srinivas at
Habeas Inc.
"This recommendation is a tough one for me, because I could say so much and not enough. Simply
put, Srinivas is thoughtful, goes the extra mile (yep that meant weekends when I needed his help),
and is without a doubt a team player and a rock solid engineer. Some people you want on your
team, Srinivas is someone that you will also welcome as a friend!"
â€” Larry Ellis, Manager of Partner Development, Habeas, worked with Srinivas at Habeas Inc.
"Srinivas is a very hard working and dedicated individual. He has excellent technical skills in
database application design and rapid application developement. He is a great asset to any team."
â€” Dharmendra Naik, Sr. Director, Habeas Inc, managed Srinivas at Habeas Inc.

Contact Srinivas on LinkedIn
